loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Asha is a member of Furaha borrower group. She is a 48-year-old woman,she is widowed, and she is a mother of two children.Her children are aged 20 and 16 years. She also cares for two other dependents.

 Asha started her own business selling charcoal 10 years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Asha’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Asha hopes to save money and expand her business.

Situmai and Sikudhani are also members of the same borrower group. They also requested loans of 400,000 Tsh and 200,000 Tsh respectively.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Obras Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma B. D. T. actualmente asume el cargo D. Prsidenta del Grupo Obras.  Ella se dedica ala confección D. ropa y disfraces nos cuenta que empezó esta labor realizando disfraces para niños D. la escuela inicial y para lograr clientela ella asistía a diferentes colegios D. su localidad en el Callao con el fin D. ofrecer sus servicios, ala par también hacia trabajos para una casa D. novios, pero poco a poco decidió seguir con su negocio propio D. alquiler D. disfraces hasta lograr hacerse conocida, actualmente tiene su propio taller D. confecciones al cual se dedica a tiempo completo, D. esta manera ayuda a su esposo que trabaja en el servicio D.  taxi. ambos apoyan a sus 3  hijos en su educación universitaria,la señora norma también esta incursionando en otro negocio q es la venta D. atún la cual realiza los días sábados y domingos en el mercado,ella siente que poco a poco esta alcanzando sus objetivos uno D. ellos es terminar D. construir su casa y ponerla como ella dice “muy linda” y con el préstamo D. EDAPROSPO seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio D. esta manera podrá seguir creciendo y produciendo lo q la hace muy feliz.
La Señora Norma aparece muy sonriente sentada entre todas sus compañeras del grupo OBRAS
texts.en:
Sra. Norma B. D. T. is the president of the Grupo Obras. She is in the business of making clothing and costumes. She tells us that she initially began making costumes for school children, and in order to obtain clients, she attended different high schools in her town of Callao to offer her services. She also did work for a bridal store, but little by little she decided to continue with her own business of renting costumes, until she succeeded in making herself well known. Currently she has her own tailoring shop which she is dedicated to full-time. This way, she helps her husband who works as a taxi driver. Together they both support their three children in their university education. Sra. Norma is also venturing into another business, which is the sale of tuna, which she does on Saturdays and Sundays in the market. She feels that little by little she is reaching her goals, one of which is to finish building her house, and to make it, as she says "very pretty". With this loan from EDAPROSPO, she will continue investing in her business, so that she will be able to continue growing and producing that which makes her very happy. *Sra. Norma appears very cheerful seated amongst all of her OBRAS group colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue setting up her costume store

loans.name: Chamnab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamnab, age 30, was married in 2001 and has two children. She lives with her mother and her brother and sister in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her daughter is a teacher.

Chamnab is a silk weaver; additionally she also sells silk fabric. She buys it from other weavers in her village for resale in Phnom Penh market. 

Chamnab has asked for a loan one time already. Her sister doesn’t have her own transportation, so Chamnab is requesting her second loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her sister for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister for commuting to work.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 49 year-old father of five who owns and runs a tailoring business in Kisumu. Charles specializes in men’s suits, and is beginning to produce women’s suits as well. He sells the suits both retail and wholesale to other shops. Charles has owned his tailoring business for the past 21 years, and he now employs 15 people. Charles is a true businessman; he also owns residential houses and farms. He has successfully repaid four loans with SMEP, and has currently requested a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase additional fabric and boost production. In the future, Charles hopes to move into the manufacturing sector as his scale of production continues to increase. He would like to educate his children and give them the opportunity to achieve whatever they may desire. Charles describes himself as reliable, hard-working, and a good manager.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun C., 48, is married with two children. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province. He is engaged in a business selling groceries on boat at Tonle Sap Lake (the great lake of Cambodia) to people living on water. He is able to earn approximately an income US $6 per day in revenue. His wife is engaged in the agriculture sector of raising pigs at home, earning an income of US $3 per day. This couple is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more various kinds of groceries to expand the husband’s business. Also, she plans to purchase more rice to manufacture rice wine and to make the waste from rice wine producing as food for the pigs she is raising. She hopes that her business plan will be successful, and her family standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Nejua

texts.en:
Nejua G. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to purchase simsim and groundnut to sell. Nejua is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has 5 children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start her own store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing simsim and groundnut to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, wheat flour, salt sugar and beans in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Mariaflor

texts.en:
Mariaflor T. is from the village of San Andres, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Mariaflor is married and has four grown children. 

To make a living, Mariaflor owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Mariaflor has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariaflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariaflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Mariaflor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mariaflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Pasquelina Muthanje

texts.en:
Pasquelina is 38 years old and married to Silvester. They have one son and one daughter.

Pasquelina was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by a KADET credit officer. She plans to use her loan to buy raw materials (i.e. trees for timber extraction) for her timber business. She says December is the busiest season for timber sales and furniture sales and she wants to have enough stock for the festive season’s spike in demand. Her business is located in a very busy market place and her customers are mostly carpenters.

Pasquelina intends to continue saving profits generated from the business. Her hope is to purchase a piece of land and to build her own residential house. She describes herself as a hardworking lady, loves her family and is determined to educate her children.

loans.use: To add stock to her timber business

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram is married and has three children. He was born in 1962. M.'s family lives in Baku city. His runs an auto repair business. Bayram has been in this business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things to improve his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Mama Mary T. is married to Mr. T., and they have five children . Due to the fact that it is too difficult to take care of the family singlehandedly and that her husband could not provide for the children's basic care alone, Mary decided to joint GHAPE in 2000. She has been having many marital problems with her husband’s brothers, which has made her sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small for her children. Mary's inability to get investment capital to generate income to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.
.
With this loan, Mary plans to buy a two wheeled motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she has a good rider for the motorcycle. In addition, Mary has saved money that she can now withdraw to purchase her bike. This is the reason that she asks for only 50,000 XAF. She plans to use the profits generated by the business to sponsor her children in school and to provide for her family's basic needs. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment of repayment will be made on the fourth month of loan disbursement. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of a two wheeled motorcycle

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak R. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province, and she is 58 years old. She is the mother of six children; one works in the public sector, one is employed at a garment factory, and the others attend a local public school.  

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  Her husband, Mr. Hak Heam, earns money to support their family by collecting palm juice. He is on the left in the picture.

This year, Mr. Hak Heam can harvest juice from more palm trees than last year.  However, he must sell it far from the local village, and he does not have any way to transport the palm juice.  Mrs. Nak R. decided to ask a loan to buy a new motorbike for him to use as transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transporting palm juice

loans.name: True Faith Group

texts.en:
Weedor F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called True Faith. She is 49 years old and is married with five children aged 14 - 32 years old. Their educational levels are 5th grade - 12th grade. She also cares for two nephews and a niece. She is illiterate due to her father’s decision that only his male children he would be educated. Weedor and her family live in Dolo’s town and work in the Harbel market, Harbel, Margibi County in Liberia.

Her business is the sale of garden eggs (African eggplant) and peppers. She buys her products at wholesale and sells at retail on a table in the Harbel market.  She has been running this business for more than three years and hopes to grow her business to a bigger level in the near future. 

She talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Weedor will use this loan to purchase more garden eggs and peppers for resale to improve business. She dreams of providing her children with an education so that they can have a better future.  
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Weedor is the lady standing on the right. 

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more garden eggs and peppers for resale.

loans.name: Ruby Pearl

texts.en:
Ruby's parents owned five hectares of rice field but it was pawned when she and her other siblings were in school.  Later she and her husband paid for the farm and now tills it together.  Ruby wants to give her two children a proper education and improve their house.

Ruby recently joined CEVI to gain access to its loan program. She requested for a loan of Php6,000, which she will use to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Hoang Phong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Ngan N. (11) is a 47-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ngan is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hoang Phong-Hoang Hoa (06,07,02). Ngan is married and has two adult children. She operates a business raising cattL. for saL.. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month. In 2003, Ngan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 630,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase calves to raise and sell. Ngan is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase calves to raise and sell. The loan will be her 8th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. N. T. Tham (9) is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Du (13) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 3. L. T. Can (8) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. L. T. Tao (12) is a 41-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. L. T. Tham (10) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ngan N. (11) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Ngan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hoang Phong-Hoang Hoa (06,07,02). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Ngan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ngan kiếm được khoảng 500.000 VND. Vào 2003, Ngan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ngan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 630,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Tham (9) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Du (13) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 3. L. T. Can (8) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. L. T. Tao (12) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. L. T. Tham (10) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de Telica Departamento de León, actualmente está trabajando en el Mined Telica, desempeñándose como Asesor Pedagógica, es casada
texts.en:
This client is from Telica, León department. She is employed as an Educational Advisor by Telica's Ministry of Education. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay of a department store debt.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela B. is from the village of Misom Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosela owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, biscuits, napkins, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Rosela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosela is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan Rosela has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lord Abett Group

texts.en:
Augustine S. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Lord Abett. He is 29 years old, is single, and has one child who is three years old. Augustine was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

For six years, Augustine has been selling provisions like soap, body cream hair grease, and toothpaste on Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner which keeps his customers returning.

Augustine plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisions like soap, body cream, hair grease, and toothpaste. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Augustine is the one holding the sign. Inset at the lower left is Regino G..

loans.use: To buy more soap, body cream, hair grease, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.en:
A. Marufjon is 43 years old and married with three children. Marufjon has been operating a butcher shop and meat selling business for 10 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Marufjon is requesting a loan of 10,000 TJS. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur and his experience in this business, Marufjon is qualified to receive this loan. He is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Mr. Kea Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for ten people who live in Ka Kou village in Prey Veng province. They will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mr. Kea P. has been selected as the group leader for this loan. He is 53 years old. He is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Thet But, is a duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs. Now he has a problem because his wife’s ducks are too small to sell. To improve this, Mr. Kea P. is applying for a loan to buy duck food. He will also use the loan to buy gasoline. He is the father of two children, one of whom is helping him with the farming. The other is a duck breeder.

loans.use: To buy duck food

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 53 years old and married, with eight children between the ages of 15 and 32. Three of the children are currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. Beatrice has been farming for nine years and has employed two people from her community. Her products are milk, maize, beans, potatoes, peas and vegetables which she sells to the local market.

Her biggest challenges in this business are the marketing of milk and the fluctuation in the prices of milk.

Beatrice has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 66,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and build a dairy unit. This loan will enable her to provide enough milk for her family and earn income that will enable her to meet the basic needs of the family. In the future, she would like to purchase more dairy cows to increase her milk production and also to venture into zero grazing.

She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering the poor.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta S. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old and is widowed with three adult children. Restituta owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,667 PHP a month. In 2010, Restituta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. Restituta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is a widow with no children. She has not received any form of education.

Adjoa smokes fish as well as fries some for sale in Abura. She has been in this business for five years and uses her income to take care of herself.

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical expenses.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya.  He has been farming for 2 years and has employed one farmhand.  His main products are eggs, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his business and from the sale of maize.

Peter has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farming. He will use this loan to purchase more chickens to increase his stock. He will use the proceeds from this loan to send his child to a good school for a better foundation. His biggest challenge has been diseases and bad weather conditions.

Peter is 28 years old. He is married and has one child aged 4 who is attending school.

In the next five years, he wants to supply eggs to most learning institutions in the North-Rift region.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Elvis; tiene 38 años de edad, e socio es soltero y trabaja en la empresa de transportes y cargas, encargado de las encomiendas, el socio también apoya a su familia con el negocio familiar ellos tiene una tienda y el desea el préstamo para invertir en implementar el negocio de su mama y comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar y otros.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “KAROLL WOKTILA”. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Elvis is 38 years old, single and works in the transport and delivery company. He is in charge of deliveries. He also supports his family in the family business. They have a store, and he wants the loan to invest in the implementation of his mother’s business and to buy oil, rice, sugar etc. He is thankful for the loan through this medium and similarly commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock a grocery store

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Nieta, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-coungo, sous préfecture de Fana,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font la restauration et le commerce des habillements.Ces femmes du groupe Nieta sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habillements, des céréales et des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.  
FANTA O. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements pour toutes catégories de personnes.                                                                                                        Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises le plus généralement à Bamako et au Burkina Faso et effectue sa vente à la maison et en ambulance, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Nieta group are all married with four children, around 41 years old and live in large extended families in the village of Marka-Counga in the municipality of Fana, the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through friends and family and are involved in foodsales and selling clothes, cereal and condiments. Fanta O. aims to use her loan in order to purchase clothes for a variety of people. She sources her goods from Bamako and Burkina Faso and sells them from her home or through door-to-door sales through cash and credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her family's needs and to invest in her business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Fanny Lisbeth

texts.es: Fanny Lisbeth tiene 27 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Este negocio lo realiza mediante pedidos, en un inicio empezó con algunas prendas pero ahora su negocio se ha establecido en su vivienda, por lo que siempre tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes o amistades que viven cerca de su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio en conversar con sus clientes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa, cosméticos, calzado para la compra de un mayor inventario.
texts.en: Fanny Lisbeth is 27 years old, a mother and hard-working woman.  She lives in her home with her husband and 2 children.  Her business is general retail, which she conducts by taking orders.  Early on, she started with a few items, but now her business is set up in her home, and she always has strong demand from customers or friends who live near her.  What she likes most about her business is talking with her customers.  With the loan requested, she will buy more clothing, cosmetics, footwear, to have more inventory.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie M. is from the town of Banga. She is 19 years old. Leslie is single. She is engaged in farming and currently helps in tilling her family's rice farm. She said she had to stop going to college due to financial difficulties in her family. She is working hard to be able to save for her college education. She hopes to graduate and find a decent job so she can still help her family financially.

Leslie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leslie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leslie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for her college education.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She is 29 years old, married to G. N. and has 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
Bushra supports her family by stitching clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has a good number of clients in her area and she receives regular orders from them every month. 

Her husband has a shop where he sells different crockery like glass sets, dinner sets, etc.  to his customers for good profit. His shop is in the market and he has been running this business for the past 7 years.  

Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk quantity to sell through his shop.  Bushra is hopeful that her husband has good experience in his business and with this loan investment, his business will surely get improved and help Bushra improve the living standard of her family.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.   

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy crockery for resale

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada M. is a resident of Tokmok. She is the leader of this group. Aizada is 35 and married. Together with her husband she is raising three children: two sons and a daughter. The daughter and the first son are at school, and the second son is not yet; he is preschool age (under 7). 

Aizada works as a teacher at school and her husband makes money by transporting vehicles.  Six years ago with the initial investment of 2000 soms Aizada started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase farm animals in order to increase the number of her livestock. In the future she dreams of purchasing a big house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 02.02.03-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Binh L. T. (50)is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of 02.02.03-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa. Binh is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.02.03-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.

Binh is married with school-aged children. To making a living, Binh operates a family member's business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for saL.. Binh has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Binh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND to expand the business. This will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Binh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. T. Lieu (51) is a 64-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  D. T. Huong (52) is a 27-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  L. T. Ha (53) is a 24-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


4.  T. T. Von (02) is a 56-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  N. T. Tan (54) is a 44-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Binh L. T. (50) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố 02.02.03-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa.  Binh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020203-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa (02.02.03-Hong Ky-Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Binh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Binh kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Binh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Lieu (51) là 64 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  D. T. Huong (52) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  L. T. Ha (53) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  T. T. Von (2) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  N. T. Tan (54) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana, de 39 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hijos: Analis, de 4 y Elvis, de 18 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. El trabajo que desarrolla junto a su familia e hijas, es el sembrío de tubérculos como papa, olluco y oca, los cuales vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero ella, no pierde el tiempo pues según afirma, mientras que los fertiliza y limpia de sus cultivos, también se  dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, los que gracias a su buen cuidado y alimentación; comercializa su carne, a los pobladores de Ricrican. Damiana, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y ahora ella desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, y sobre todo a minimizar gastos con nuevas técnicas de cultivo. Este es el  cuarto crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, agradece el apoyo que recibió al integrarse. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en sus diferentes sembríos.
texts.en:
Damiana, age 39, is a courageous single mother of two children: Analis (age 4) and Elvis (age 18). This family lives in their own home located in the town of Ricrican. Damiana works with her family growing tubers such as potatoes, ulluco, and oca. These crops are sold at the central market in the city of Tarma. Damiana says she does not waste time since she must fertilize and clean her crops. In addition, she raises small animals such as pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs. By taking care of and feeding the animals, she is able to sell the meat to the residents of Ricrican. Damiana has been farming for twenty years and now wants to improve the quality of her crops and minimize her costs with new agricultural techniques.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. As a member of her Communal Bank, Damiana is grateful for the support she has received since joining. With the amount she requested, she will buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on her various crops.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Miry

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

In 2006, Miry decided to open his own business to increase his family's income. Therefore he opened a restaurant. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it. He is aiming to extend his business and improve his work.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling on the entrance of the restaurant and renovate it

loans.name: Wena

texts.en:
Wena is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: ice cream making and Trisikad (or pedicab) operator businesses. Her husband Gino T., who is 34 years old, works as a Brgy. Police officer and Trisikad driver to earn a living. They have no children. 

Wena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can improve her business, repair her house and have savings in the future. Wena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to grow her business

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KADIAMOR est créé en 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Ses femme ont constitué leur par voisinage et par affinité. Elles sont toutes activité dans le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KOBITENE

Madame MARIE EKOUDIENE D. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 06 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents et/ou amis.

Grâce à CAURIE-MF elle a pu diversifier ses activités, de la vente de poissons frais elle est donc passé à la vente d'huile de palme et de balais. 

Les activités qu'elle mène grâce à l'appui de CAURIE-MF, lui ont permis de contribuer aux besoins de la famille surtout pour les dépenses quotidiennes aussi le plus souvent pour le payement de la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The Kadiamor solidarity group was created in 2008. It is made up of ten women who live in the same neighborhood and are either neighbors or friends. They are all active in small businesses. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois in Kobitene.

Mrs. Marie Ekoudiene D. who is standing on the right of the photo is in charge of the group. She is 45 years old, married and mother to five children. She also has six other chidren in her care who were entrusted to her by relatives or friends. Thanks to Cauri-MF she has been able to diversify her activities and has passed from the sale of fresh fish to the sale of palm oil and brooms. The business she has, thanks to the support of Caurie-MF, has allowed her to contribute to her family's needs, and above all to the daily expenses and more often than not to the children's school fees.

loans.use: To maintain her small trading activity

loans.name: Vista Alegre Group

texts.es:
El comité “Vista Alegre” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santani. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como la cría de animales para su posterior venta. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está pasando en el 2do ciclo, con muchas ganas de sobresalir adelante.
La sra. Lucila es la presidenta del comité y ella fue la que tuvo la iniciativa de formar el grupo con todas las mujeres que poseen la misma actividad, la cría de animales, porque es un rubro muy sacrificado. Solicitan el crédito para poder comprar más animales y acrecentar sus ingresos luego de que finalicen los negocios de venta de animales.
texts.en:
The Vista Alegre committee was formed by a group of several neighbours in the town of Santani. Each member has her own business: raising animals and then selling them. The group is close-knit and works together on activities that strengthen their friendship. They are now in their second loan cycle and are very eager to make progress in life.

Sra Lucila is the president of the committee and the person who founded the group, all of whom are women who raise animals for a living. It’s a difficult and time-consuming job. The women are seeking a loan to buy more animals and increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy cows, chickens, and pigs

loans.name: Jose Odias

texts.es:
Don José, de 64 años de edad, reside en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa, dos hijos de 26 y 24 años de edad, una nieta de 2 años, don José posee un negocio donde ofrece bebidas refrescantes y artículos de primera necesidad, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón, tomates, y otros más que son necesarios y demandados por los clientes, esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse competente en el negocio y a que sus ventas mejoren.
Su objetivo es continuar incrementando el negocio, contar siempre con la preferencia de sus clientes y ver que sus hijos tengan lo necesario.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old.  He lives in Chinameca, in San Miguel department, together with his wife, two children aged 26 and 24, and a 2 year-old granddaughter.  José has a business selling refreshing drinks and essentials.  He works from Monday to Sunday.

José is requesting a loan to buy soda, corn, beans, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), fried pork rinds, tomatoes and other essential products that are in demand among his customers.  This investment will help him to remain competent in his business and improve his sales.

José's goal is to continue increasing his business, keep his customers' loyalty and provide his children with what they need.

loans.use: To buy soda, corn, beans, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), fried pork rinds and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz N. is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. Mubariz sells cattle; he purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

After 9 years in this business, Mubariz knows very well how to choose, breed and look after the animals. He gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful and generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Mubariz is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle. He is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Rosefe

texts.en:
Rosefe E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Rosefe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosefe owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari (variety) shop. The income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. She also buys and raises pigs and goats for sale. Rosefe has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosefe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosefe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional breads, biscuits, and canned goods. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Rosefe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional breads, biscuits & canned goods

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom K. is married and has one child. 

He sells men’s clothes, such as shirts, pants, underwear and ties in the market of Shohmansur in Dushanbe city. He purchases goods from suppliers who export the goods from China and Bishkek city. 

He plans to purchase new seasonal men’s clothes, and for this reason he has requested a loan of US $2,500.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of men’s clothes

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Dosouma, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tabac, d’articles divers et de poissons.                                                                                                                            
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du tabac, des articles divers et des  poissons.              
TENIN F. compte acheter du tabac  avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses des enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group, all married women or widows, are on the average 38 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of N’Dosouma, Sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell tobacco, various first-need items and fish.
The members of the Djekafo group are on the first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy tobacco, various first-need items and fish.

Tenin F., plans to buy tobacco from the wholesalers in Fana. She sells locally in her village and in the nearby areas, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 7,500 West African francs, which will be used to pay off her loan and provide for the needs of her children, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy tobacco (for resale)

loans.name: Ccori Chuspa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “CCORI CHUSPA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el Distrito de Urubamba Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mabel; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de abarrotes en el bello valle sagrado de los inkas, la socia tiene una tienda en la parte baja de sus casa y ella vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y los complementa con algunos útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, reglas, cartulinas, papeles entre otros. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales menores, a la docencia, a la enfermería. 
La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mabel, 42, is a member of the “CCORI CHUSPA” communal bank located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  She is married and has three children.  She alternates her household chores with tending to her grocery store in the beautiful Sacred Valley of the Incas.  She has a store on the ground floor of her house where she sells all sorts of basic need items to which she’s added such things as school supplies like notebooks, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers, construction paper and paper, among others.  She wants the loan to buy basic need items.

The other members are farmers, raise small farm animals, teach or are in nursing.

Mabel appreciates the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Trenzas de Oro” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad,  está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Adelaida estudió hasta 2do de secundaria.
Trabaja  con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta  de animales domésticos como vacunos y ovinos, también nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de tejidos artesanales y venta de combustibles como petróleo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, comprará 50 galones de petróleo y lanas para elaborar  tejidos, cuenta que su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él es técnico albañil.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa, tener carro y seguir tejiendo e innovando con sus prendas.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la  facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the “Las Trenzas de Oro” [Golden Braids] communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 40 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children. Adelaida studied through the second year of secondary school. 

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for PEN 500.00, which she used to invest in her business of buying and selling domestic animals such as cattle and sheep. She also tells us that she sells knitted crafts and fuels such as gasoline.

With this loan of PEN 800.00, she will buy 50 gallons of gasoline and wool to make knitted items. She says her husband helps her in her business. He is a mason.

Her dream is to have a big house, to have a car, and to continue knitting and innovating with her knitted clothing items.

What she likes about the communal bank is the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 50 gallons of gasoline and wool at wholesale price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Nyimpa

texts.en: Nyimpa is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She cooks banku (cooked fermented corn dough and cassava dough) with fish and hot pepper sauce at Elmina. Nyimpa has been cooking for sale for 10 years. The quantity she cooks runs out before 12:00 noon. She wants to sell more, and so needs a loan so she can make more quantities to sell. The increase in profits that will come as a result of the loan will be put back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To make more quantities of banku to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor vive en la ciudad de Tambo Real donde un grupo de personas formaron el banco comunal “Solidaridad de Tambo Real”. 

Víctor es casado, tiene 44 años y tiene cinco hijos, él nos cuenta que es albañil y se dedica a construir casas, refaccionar casas y otras cosas más. El también se dedica a la ganadería tiene varias vacas y toros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del establo.
texts.en:
Víctor lives in Tambo Real, where he is a member of the  “Solidaridad de Tambo Real” community bank. 

Victor is 44, married, and has five children.  He is a construction worker and builds and renovates houses, among other things.  He also raises livestock and has some cows and bulls.  He has been doing this for a number of years, and it has been going well, thanks to the effort he puts in his work.  He will use this loan to maintain his stables.

loans.use: to maintain his stables.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has seven children. 

Juanito has a shop that sells snacks, detergents, & food seasoning. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Juanito is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Celia Marina

texts.es:
La Señora. Celia es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive por el sector de Molleturo, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amable y carismáticas.
 
Doña Celia tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 5 son casados e independientes y dos trabajan. Su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Celia se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar, allí cría chanchos, aves de corral, cuyes y ganado a los que los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y su cosecha es para su consumo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para la cría y venta.
 
Su meta es mejorar sus potreros y su sueño es tener una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the communal bank "Yanbal".  She lives in the Molleturo sector, a place where people are work in animal husbandry, agriculture and trade.  They are people who maintain their culture and traditions and are very friendly and charismatic.
 
Celia is 60 years old, married, and this relationship produced 7 children who are all grown, 5 are married and independent and 2 are working. Her husband works in a restaurant.  The house where they live is their own property.

Celia works on the tasks at home, breeding pigs, poultry, guinea pigs and cattle that are sold in her community.  She also works in farming and the harvest is for their own consumption.
 
This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest in the purchase of cattle for breeding and selling.
 
Celia's goal is to improve her pastures and her dream is to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 25 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are school-going. For the last year, she has been operating a food stall so as to make a living. Previously, she used to sell porridge. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to be operating a successful business. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, cooking fat, tomato sauce and salt. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to access credit.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cooking fat, tomato sauce and salt.

loans.name: Res

texts.en: Mrs. Res is a hardworking 75-year-old woman who lives in Reussey Keo Commune, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Mrs. Res is a widow who has only one lovely son. Her son is married and lives with her. What she wants most is to offer her family a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Mrs. Res has been selling Khmer traditional medicine.  Mrs. Res earns approximately $2 per day from this business.  To assist with her income, her son started a business as a mixed goods seller. Her son has talked with her about expanding his business, but he lacks the money to do so.  He wishes that his mother will borrow funds in order to purchase candles, sugar, beer, food ingredients, etc. Mrs. Res hopes that kind lenders will support her son’s business. She expects he will gain more benefit from his business each day.

loans.use: to purchase candles, sugar, beer, and food ingredients.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a businessman. He is married and has one child. He sells cosmetics and baby clothing to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. He is also a teacher by profession. He has managed to grow his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to open a beauty college in five years. He needs a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos tiene 29 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los hermanos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, está conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Roberto se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, urea para los cultivos. 
 
 Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprarse una casa donde pueda vivir cómodamente.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo y visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
29-year old Roberto Carlos is single and has no children. He lives with his siblings in Ventanas canton, in Bolívar province.

There are fifteen members in his Community Bank which is called the Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja and is located 90 minutes from the cooperative. The branch deals mainly with agricultural loans for such items as cocoa seedlings, rice, maize, soya, bananas, oranges etc.

Roberto earns his living from the land. He grows cocoa, rise, maize, soya, and oranges which he buys and sells in San José del Tambo each weekend. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea, and other supplies for his fields. With the support he receives from this loan, he will be able to buy basic necessities.

The main difficulties Roberto faces are insect infestations and diseases, and the changing climate. His dream is to buy a house for himself where he can live. In his free time, Roberto enjoys going for walks and visiting relatives.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea, and other supplies

loans.name: Kabanyana

texts.en:
Kabanyana is 32 years old and single. She has been selling green bananas, cooking oil and juice for about five years. Her business hours are from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Kabanyana has requested this loan through Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more cooking oil and juice to sell. The extra income generated from the loan will help her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase green bananas, cooking oil, juice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a set of tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Anibal Gerardo

texts.es:
Anibal de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa, aún no tienen en casa de sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Anibal desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovino, porcino y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para compra de más alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo.  Anibal es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  tener mejoras económicas que ofrecerles a su esposa y a sus padres.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 21, lives with his wife in his parents’ house which lacks basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department; they don’t have children yet.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Aníbal has been raising small farm animals (sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell.  His corrals are located in his yard and they are appropriate.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that his animals will reach optimal growth and can be sold in various local markets earning good profits to cover his daily household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy more animal feed and for veterinary medicines for his animals.  With income obtained he’ll be able to repay the loan and improve his wife’s quality of life.  Aníbal is a hardworking, very responsible person.  The only thing he wants is to get ahead and to improve economically to provide for his wife and his parents.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia.  His wife sells shoes.

Their elder daughter is a college student and a younger child is also a student. 

He started his taxi service business in 2002 by using his own car.  Taxi income is pretty much the same everyday, and it is not enough to pay the college fees.  Therefore, he and his wife decided to open a second hand clothes shop, based on his wife's experience.  They have already found the place to rent and bought a small amount of supplies. 

He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy used shoes for his wife's business.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for his wife's business.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is 55 years old and lives in Liberad Alto, Sincaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Daylinda has a shop that sells softdrinks. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional cases of softdrinks to sell. Daylinda has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 67-year-old entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She runs an eatery located near her town's elementary school. Editha cooks the food that she sells to her community. Editha also sells soft drinks. She works hard to improve her business.

Editha has requested a loan to buy soft drinks and ingredients such as spices, meat and vegetables. Editha hopes to expand her eatery in the future. She also hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and ingredients such as spices, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 32 años es una comerciante natural, que vive al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 16 años. Ella emprendió su aventura de negocios desde hace 4 años con un financiamiento que recibió de una empresa que vende sus productos a través de guías especializadas, con la que adquirió su código  y empezó a vender cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, joyas en plata y sus derivados. Muy pronto su negocio fue creciendo, porque el producto de sus ganancias lograba invertirlo en él,  apoyada por su cónyuge, quien le ha ayudado en los momentos de mayor desafío que se presentaron al iniciar, porque su capital de crédito no lo recuperaba tan pronto como ella esperaba. Luz Marina sueña con el crecimiento la expansión de su negocio y esta es la razón por la cual acude a aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina pequeña y productos cosméticos que vinieron en la oferta de fin de año, con los cuales la surtirá y en el momento de mayor volumen de ventas como navidades y año nuevo, hará, la mejor exhibición de ellos y así mismo la mejor venta del año. Los indicadores financieros de su negocio lo muestran como rentable y con mucho potencial de crecimiento de acuerdo con su característica,  pues maneja una utilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 34%, indicador  desde donde parte,  para continuar con el ascenso de las ventas esperadas, contando con un nuevo capital e trabajo como el que ofrece su credikiva..
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 32, is a natural merchant living in southwest Barranquilla with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 5 to 16 years.  She started her adventure in business four years ago with a loan she got from a firm that sells the products she sells via catalogue.  With it she purchased a code and started selling cosmetics, women’s accessories, silver jewelry and derivatives.  Very soon her business started to grow because she would reinvest her profits into it and being supported by her spouse who has helped her during the times of greatest challenge she faced at the beginning because she would not recuperate her credit capital as fast as she had planned to.
