What she pretends to do is expand her business buying more products since her community is far from the area's main town and people need a variety of merchandise.  This way she both helps people by offering them the products and her family can have daily support.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos de 25 años, el es conductor de una tricimoto (medio de transporte rápido y eficaz para ir a lugares que un carro no puede) vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral y rodeada por un estero. 

Empezó hace 5 años haciendo carreras con una tricimoto (medio de transporte rápido), debido a la necesidad y a que las personas de su sector necesitaban un medio de transporte rápido que llegara a los lugares que un transporte común no llega. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ha venido trabajando para poder mantener a su hija de 5 años. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere renovar la moto comprando una nueva para trabajar con mas rapidez, en el futuro quiere tener una casa ya que ahora vive en la casa de su tio y necesita darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
25-year-old Carlos drives a motor rickshaw (a fast and efficient means of transport for going places where a car cannot). He lives in a peri-urban zone called “Perimetral” that is surrounded by a marsh.

He started 5 years ago making runs with a motor rickshaw (a speedy mode of transport), due to the necessity and because people in his area needed a fast means of transport that would get to the places that public transport would not. Since then, he has been working to support his 5-year-old daughter. He works from 8am to 9pm every day.

With the loan, he wants to change the motorcycle, buying a new one in order to work faster. In the future he wants to have a house, since he now lives in his uncle’s house and he needs to give his daughter a better life.

loans.use: Motorcycle

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie M. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (five orphaned nephews and nieces).  Sophie has a business that sells Bitenge African Attire, batiks and dresses.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sophie sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    

Sophie has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO that she will use to buy rolls of African attires and dresses.  She also generates additional income through part time work as a nurse and councilor in Kampala city council.  The main business challenges for Sophie include thieves and licenses.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a permanent business premise in Kampala city.  Sophie lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African attires and dresses.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
In 2004, Rosemarie E. found an opportunity to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI and she was inspired by the stories of other poor women. 

She wanted to become successful like them. Because of the opportunity to take out loans, Rosemarie was able to start a business she thought she could be successful at: fishing. 

She is courageous enough to take all the risks of running this business because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream she keeps in her mind of  having all her children finish their schooling through college. 

Rosemarie has kept on taking loans from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her new loan to buy equipment needed for her fishing business, such as a new boat, fishing nets and other supplies so that her husband will catch more fish to sell. If ever the couple gets better output, they will be able to invest more in their business and in their home.

Rosemarie's only hope is that her children not experience the hard life she and her husband experienced. She dreams of expanding her fishing business. Her long term goal is to build a new, spacious, concrete home to live in.
   
Rosemarie and her husband help each other to achieve their dreams of offering a better life to their children. The couple says thank you to Kiva and ASHI for offering financial support to her business effort.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel M. is from Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 41 years old. Rosel is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosel owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Rosel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 50 años, está casada con Víctor, de 52 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Juana, de 16, Elmer, de 12 y Eloy, de14 años de edad; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. La siembra de tubérculos como papa y olluco; es su principal actividad. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Pero según afirma, lo que más le gusta a ella, es cuidar de sus 20 cabezas de reses, los que engorda y después los vende en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Desde adolescente Teofila, comenzó a apoyar a sus padres en el cuidado y mejora de sus cultivos y hasta ahora se siente feliz de poder pasar sus días en el campo. Ahora Teofila, quiere seguir mejorando la calidad de sus productos, con ello asegura podrá vender a mayor precio sus cosechas. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, y según afirma, se siente contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde las personas son personas responsables y comprometidas. Con el monto que solicita comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en sus diferentes sembríos de tubérculos.
texts.en: Teofila is 50 years old, married to Victor, 52.  Both have six children, three live with them at their house located in Ricrican: Juana; 16, Elmer; 12, and Eloy; 14.  Her main activity is growing tubers such as potato and olluco (a native tuber).  She has more than 20 years of experience working in agriculture. What she likes the most is taking care of her 20 heads of cattle, she raises them and then sells them at the central market in the city of Tarma. When she was a teenager, she started helping her parents in the care and maintenance of their crops and to this day she feels happy to spend her days in the field. For now, Teofila wants to improve the quality of her products, because she would be able to sell at a higher price.  This is her fifth loan with MFP, and as she indicates she is happy to belong to the community bank, where people are responsible and committed.  With the requested amount she will buy several sacs of organic fertilizer to use in the tuber fields.

loans.use: Buy sacs of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine is 36 years old, married and has four children between three and 16 years old. Currently, three of her children attend school, except the youngest. Blandine produces local beer and juice from sorghum, which she has done for a period of six years. In the picture, Blandine is at her place of work with materials used to prepare local juices and beers. Her husband works as an artisan in their village. 

Blandine will use the loan to buy more sorghum. With the new profits from her expanded business, Blandine plans to purchase more sorghum, food for the family, and pay the school fees for her children. She dreams of having a big stock of sorghum in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to produce more local beers and juice to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad M. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Felicidad is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Felicidad owns & operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. 

Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used again to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felicidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma S. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Juma has a music recording studio business, which he has run for ten years.
To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more assets for his music recording studio. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Juma hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more assets for his music recording studio

loans.name: Chork

texts.en:
Mrs. Chork S. was born in 1982. She is a married woman who lives in a village called Svay Prey in the Kandal province. Chork and her husband have three children, two of whom attend the local school. Their youngest is one year old. Her husband appears in this picture with her.

Chork and her husband are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to support their family. They also earn some income milling rice. Chork is asking for a loan to buy pig food to support her pig breeding business. She will also use part of her loan to buy spare parts to repair their rice-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Raykan

texts.en:
Raykan T. is 47, married and has one child. She graduated as a seller and worked for a long time at the local consumer goods shop.

After privatization, she lost her job and decided to engage in her own business of selling socks. She started with the initial capital of only 500 KGS and managed to develop this activity into a monthly profit of 12,000 KGS. Today Raykan ‘s business includes  a wide assortment of socks and women and men’s footwear. 

Raykan has applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods for sale. It will allow her to further develop her business and in the future, to give a higher education to her son.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of footware for sale

loans.name: Erick Cristopher

texts.es: El Sr. Erick tiene 28 años de edad, el es padre de un niño de 4 años de edad, el vive en la casa de sus abuelos desde niño, casa ubicada en el distrito de La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de 2 pisos. El se dedica al servicio de tranporte urbano en el ambito de la ciudad, en vehiculo alquilado, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 3 años, como todo joven tienen muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder adquirir su propio vehiculo y asi obtener mayores ingresos. Erick invertira el dinero en la compra de utiles escolares como libros cuadernos, mochilas, uniformes entre otros ya que desea que su hijo se desarrolle profesionalemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Erick is 28 years old and is the father of a four year old boy. He lives in his grandparents’ two story house located in the District of La Tinguina. He has a rental car and for three years has provided transportation services in the city area.

Like most young people he has dreams and goals and one of them is to obtain his own car. He is requesting the loan for school supplies such as books, notebooks, backpacks, and uniforms, because he wants his son to develop professionally.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Amelita is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelita sells bananas and food items in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital for her business.

Amelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to sell. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 63 years old and a member of the Joy group in Faulu Kenya.  She does livestock farming to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years and has three employees.  Being a widowed lady with five children, she works hard in her business in order to raise her five children.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances and her business at large.  She wants 60,000 KES to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Lampard Group

texts.en:
Desolery F. is in her early 30s and married with children. She has been running a general store business for six years. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Desolery's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop stock and also bought a motorcycle. She paid back her loan successfully.  

She hopes for a new loan to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is buy another motorcycle for carrying people, like a taxi.

Desolery will share this loan with her loan group "Lampard," which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture Desolery is first person on the left in the first row.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store.

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La Sra. Diomith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen  de la Inmaculada” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Está casada y tiene 02 hijos en edad escolar.

La idea  del negocio nace  con la ayuda  de su hermana, ella le inserta en  la venta de cosméticos.  Su préstamo inicial fue  de S / 600.00 nuevos soles, buscando con ello   generar sus propios ingresos y así  apoyar en la economía de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00, comprará más cosméticos tales como lápiz labiales, talcos de cuerpo, perfumes, colonias y además de ello joyería sortijas, gargantillas, relojes, pulseras, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes  que son a su vez amigos, familiares y trabajadores de diversas instituciones públicas y privadas,  
 
Diomith, mujer  trabajadora,  se siente muy  contenta  por la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Diomith is a member of the ‘Virgen de la Inmaculada’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is married and has two school-aged children.

The idea for her business came from the help of her sister, who got her into cosmetics sales. Her first loan was for 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) so that she could generate her own earnings and contribute to her household’s finances.

With this loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase more cosmetics like lip liner, body powder, perfume, sprays and jewelry like rings, necklaces, watches, and bracelets in order to provide better service to her customers who include friends, relatives and employees of various public and private institutions.

Diomith is a hardworking woman and she is happy for making her ideas a reality. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to grow.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like lip liner, body powder, perfume, sprays and jewelry like rings, necklaces, watches, and bracelets.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El señor Martin es conviviente con la señora Flora Villarroel López más de 12 años, tienen 4 hijos dependientes que estudian, viven en la comunidad de 2da Candelaria hace 11 años atrás. 
                                                                                                        
El señor Martin es constructor albañil y agricultor cultivan papa, haba, oca, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno que los utilizan en las faenas agrícolas, de esta forma el mantiene a su familia, don Martin se apersono a solicitar un crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa más semilla de haba para aumentar su producción agrícola ya que les queda muy lejos acudir a Entidades Financieros a la ciudad de Cbba, por ultimo nos comenta que siempre demostrara a sus hijos que no les falte nada y que sean mejores que el a futuro.
texts.en:
Martin has lived with his partner Flora Villarroel López for over 12 years and they have four children together, all of whom study and are dependent on them financially. They have lived in the community of Segunda Candelaria for the last 11 years. 

Martin is a builder, bricklayer and a farmer. To support his family he grows potatoes and broad beans and raises geese and livestock which he uses for farm work.

Martin came to apply for a loan in person since it is very far for him to go to financial organisations in Cochabamba. He plans to purchase agricultural supplies such as organic fertiliser (chicken manure) and potato and broad bean seeds to increase his agricultural production. He tells us that he has always made sure that his children never went without and he hopes that they will have a better life than him in the future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Kanyshai's Group

texts.en:
Kanyshai is the leader of this group. She is 53 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families and the sons help Kanyshai run the family business. Kanyshai works as a teacher; in parallel with her job she sells children’s clothing. She started this business five years ago with the initial investment of 10 000 soms. Her friend, who has been in this business for a long time, helped in the initial stages. At the moment Kanyshai’s monthly profit is 10 000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to repair her house. In the future she wants to see her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen, a married mother of three boys and one girl, owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, Moreen has operated a beauty salon and a cyber café. She also owns real estate which is her other source of income. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is a major challenge she faces in her business.

Having decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. Moreen's dream is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
El Sr. Narciso de 41 años de edad, esta acompañado con la Sra. Liliana, ellos tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos que actualmente están cursando sus estudios primarios.
Don Narciso es mecánico, se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 12 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.999; comenzó con el capital que su madre le dió por venta de un terreno. El cuenta con un pequeño taller donde repara los automóviles que le son llevados. El Sr. se defina como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia.
El solicita el credito para la compra de llaves, gatos, pinzas y demás instrumentos que utilizara en el arreglo de los vehículos que le son llevados.
texts.en:
Mr. Narciso, age 41, lives with Mrs. Liliana. They are blessed with three children who are currently in elementary school.
Mr. Narciso is a mechanic. He has done this work for over 12 years, approximately since the year 1999. He started off with the capital that his mother gave him from the sale of a plot of land. He has a small workshop where he repairs the vehicles that are brought to him. He describes himself as a very hard-working man. Everything that he does is for his family's well-being.
He is requesting this loan for the purchase of keys, jacks, clips and other instruments that he will use to repair the vehicles that are brought to him.

loans.use: to purchase keys, jacks, clips and other instruments which he will use to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Katagata Farmers Group

texts.en: Eldard, a married father of nine children, has been selling cattle for 10 years in Bushenyi, enabling him, through hard work, to earn about 100,000 shillings per week. He also derives extra income selling bananas grown on a plantation he owns. With the Kiva loan, Eldard plans to buy more cattle for resale, and in the future expects to expand his business in order to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza de sus iglesias y centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Rosa se dedica a un a la venta de comida, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche, este trabajo le ha permitido salir adelante y lleva en él 8 años. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su 4 crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its churches and its historical center. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 60 years old, married, and has eight children. All of them are adults, married, and independent. She does not have a house of her own and lives in a rental property.

Sra. Rosa has a business selling food. She works Sunday to Sunday from 5am to 8pm. This work has allowed her to get ahead and she has been in business for eight years. Rosa is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest the funds in the purchase of provisions for her business. Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for her food business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 56 years old and has been in mixed farming for 6 years. She produces milk, eggs, and maize, which she sells at the local market. She is married with 8 children, all adults save for the last two, who are still in school.

Anna has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds and expand her poultry business. This is her fourth loan with Juhudi; her prior loans were repaid promptly.

Anna notes that she has had experience with poultry and hopes her new investment will be more productive. She faces significant challenges with dairy since milk is perishable.

loans.use: To purchase birds for her poultry business

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 33-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him.  His desire is to educate his children up to university.   

Vincent is in the transportation business.  With the income generated he has been able to provide for the basic needs for his family.  His major challenge has been the mechanical break downs of his motor vehicle. His dream is to buy a new vehicle. Vincent needs this loan to buy a motor engine.

loans.use: buy a motor engine

loans.name: Nancy Achieng

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has two children between 3.5 and 7 years old. She operates an electronics retail store where she sells electronic devices, speakers and DVD players. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional devices such as TVs to sell. Her business goal is to transform the business into a wholesale enterprise within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to venture into an electronic sales dealership of respected companies such as Sony, LG and Samsung.

loans.use: To purchase additional devices such as TVs to sell

loans.name: Yath

texts.fr: Monsieur Yath est un tailleur de 40 ans  qui vit au Sénégal  dans un quartier communautaire  non loin de l’un des guichets  de l’U-IMCEC ou il est membre depuis aout 2007. Il est marié et père  de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 1 et 12 ans. Il  coud essentiellement des modèles  de femmes et pratique cette activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Il a choisi cette activité par passion et surtout par recommandation de ses parents. Il éprouve beaucoup de plaisir pour le travail bien fait et la création de nouveautés. Il a déjà remboursé 2 crédits antérieurs et sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour le réaménagement et la finition de son atelier de couture. Il souhaite rentabiliser davantage son activité, accroitre ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yath is a 40-year-old tailor who lives in Senegal in a community not far from a U-IMCEC branch where he has been a member since August 2007.  He is married and the father of eight children, from 1 to 12 years old. He essentially sews women's styles and has been in this business for over 30 years. He chose this business for the love of it and especially per his parents' recommendation. He demonstrates great pleasure in work well-done and in making new things. 

Mr. Yath has already repaid two previous loans and is now requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for renovating his tailoring shop. His wish is to make his business more profitable, to grow his revenues, and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his tailor shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been a businessman operating a retail shop for the past two years. He is 26 years old, single, and supports his parents.

He learned about KADET from KADET staff and applied for his first loan of KES.50,000 which he plans to use to purchase more inventory like sugar, salt, and soft drinks for sale. 

He hopes to make a profit and invest the income by expanding his business to a wholesale one. He is a hardworking guy who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like sugar, salt, and soft drinks for sale in his store

loans.name: Jorge Maximo

texts.es:
Jorge de 41 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Isla Trinitaria”.
Su taller de fabricación de muebles lo empezó haces 5 años, actualmente trabaja con su hijo de 25 años.
No tiene dificultad, es soltero y tienes aspiraciones de mejoramiento de vivienda.
El solicita el préstamo para el mejoramiento de vivienda.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda en donde pueda tener una vida feliz con su hijo.
texts.en: Jorge is 41 years old. He lives in a suburban area called “Isla Trinitaria”. He started his furniture making workshop 5 years ago and he now works with his 25 year old son. He has no difficulties. He is single and aspires to improve his home. He is asking for the loan for home improvement. His dream is to finish building his home so he can have a happy life with his son.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks and sand.

loans.name: Glendy Yamileth

texts.es:
Glendy  tiene 21 años de edad, esta acompañada con un hijo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica, desde hace seis años, aprendió esta actividad de una prima, quien la motivo y le proporcionaba los productos al crédito, para que fuera empezando y vio que vendía bastante y por tal razón, instalo su propia tienda.
Para comprar los productos, ella viaja en el vehículo de su suegra, hasta una ciudad del oriente del país, sale de su casa a las 4:00 de la mañana y regresan a las 11:00 de la mañana.
El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 200 libras de azúcar, 200 libras de frijoles,  200 libras de maíz, 20 libras de harina maseca, 2 cajas de jabón extra, 1 caja de jabón rinso, 8 galones de aceite para cocina, 100 libras de arroz y verduras. También para comprara recargas telefónicas y flores para el día de difuntos.
Con esta inversión Glendy, surtirá más su tienda, tendrá variedad de productos, lo que le generara mejores ingresos, permitiéndole tener una seguridad económica a su hogar y una mejor vida para su hijo.
Ella ahorrara para comprar un vehículo y movilizarse por su propia cuenta, para adquirir sus productos para la tienda, dando a sus clientes precios bajos, para tener más venta.
texts.en:
Glendy is 21 years old and has a child.  She works selling basic grocery and household products, work she has done for the past six years.  She learned this activity from her cousin, who motivated her and provided her with products on credit so that she could start.  She saw that she sold a lot and for that reason she started her own store.  In order to purchase products, she travels in her mother-in-law's vehicle to a city in the eastern part of the country.  She leaves her house at 4:00 in the morning and returns at 11:00 in the morning.  

The loan would be invested in the purchase of 200 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of beans, 200 pounds of corn, 20 pounds of corn flour, 2 boxes of extra soap, 1 box of soap with bleach, 1 box of soap with stain remover, 8 gallons of cooking oil, and 100 pounds of rice and vegetables.  She will also purchase telephone calling cards and flowers for the Day of the Dead.  

With this investment, Glendy will supply her store, have a variety of products, and will generate better income, which will allow her to have economic security in her home and improve the life of her son.  She will save to purchase a vehicle to be able to travel on her own to purchase products for the store, giving her clients low prices in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase of 200 pounds of sugar, 200 pounds of beans, 200 pounds of corn, 20 pounds of corn flour, 2 boxes of extra soap, 1 box of soap with bleach, 1 box of soap with stain remover, 8 gallons of cooking oil, and 100 pounds of rice and vegetables.  She will also purchase telephone calling cards and flowers for the Day of the Dead.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Marilou has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts for copra (the dried meat of a coconut). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with six adult children.

Marcelina has a general store and earns PHP 2,700 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Marcelina hopes to sustain her business and to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Matagalu

texts.en:
Matagalu is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Vaisala. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To earn a living, Matagalu owns and  operates a business venture in the arts sector, operating a handicrafts business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Matagalu has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Matagalu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Matagalu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Matagalu is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase paints, design board, fabrics, glitter and pandanus leaves. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Matagalu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase paints, design board, fabrics, glitter and pandanus leaves.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Marissa has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Saraen

texts.en:
Saraen, age 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Her children are employed as a driver and a garment worker. 

Since her husband's current motorbike is very old, Saraen is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi. By doing so, her husband will be able to attract more customers to his transportation service. 

In the future, Saraen would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Julian Andres

texts.es:
Julian es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que decidió trabajar por su propia cuenta con el ánimo de generar los ingresos con los cuales pueda contribuir económicamente a su hogar. Con el ánimo de ofrecer a sus padres su contribución para mejorarles su calidad de vida, Julian desde hace aproximadamente 3 años decidió empezar a trabajar como conductor de una moto-taxi el cual ofrece el servicio en todo el municipio. Julian con sus ahorros logró comprar la moto-taxi y esto le permitió hacer de su negocio mucho más rentable. Gracias al buen servicio que presta, ha podido captar gran cantidad de clientes fijos que cuando requieren sus servicios lo llaman a el específicamente. Con el ánimo de ofrecer un mejor servicio, Julian espera realizarle algunas mejoras a su moto-taxi, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una carpa y a pintar su moto-taxi.
Julian espera que de esta manera sus clientes queden más a gusto con sus servicios y pueda aumentar sus ingresos. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos pueda ofrecerles a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Compra de una carpa y a pintar su moto-taxi.

loans.name: Turwanyubunebwe Group

texts.fr:
Léonce fait partie du groupe Turwanyubunebwe, il habite à Gitega. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Sindayiheba cultivatrice .Ensemble, ils ont 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire.

Il est   coiffeur  depuis 17 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il   va  augmenter son capital et acheter des tondeuses supplémentaires.Ainsi, il peut recruter quelqu’un, afin de  servir beaucoup de clients en travaillant conjointement; de ce fait,il va gagner plus.

Avec le gain de son travail, il supporte aisément les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léonce is part of the Turwanyubunebwe Group and lives in Gitega.  He is 40 years old and is married to a woman named Sindayiheba, who works as a farmer.  Together, they gave four children, two of whom are attending school at the primary level.

He has been a barber for 17 years.

This is his second loan taken out via Turame.  With the loan funded by Kiva, he will augment his capital and purchase additional clippers.  He will be able to recruit someone to work for him so he can better serve his many clients by working in conjunction with someone else.  This way, he will earn higher profits.

With the earnings from his work, he can easily manage his children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to increase his capital, purchase clippers, and hire another person to help him serve his many clients.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia needs another loan to fix the walls at the place where she lives Sis 35 years old. She is divorced and she works as a nurse at a hospital located at El Alto. Also, she works as a plumbing assistant every weekend. Lidia is a mother of four children.She hopes you can help her. She is healthy and she works hard but she doesn't receive any help from her ex-husband. In the picture, Lidia is at her house and as you can see, the place is in poor condition.

loans.use: to fix the walls at the place where she lives

loans.name: Têlé

texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Agbodrafo (Lakes Prefecture), Mrs Têlé A. is married and the mother of five (5) children. In addition to her own children, she also takes care of two (2) children of her eldest child. A dynamic woman who is full of hope, she has a stall of kitchen utensils and accessories at her local market. Widowed for the last two years, she has had a difficult time supporting her family. At the moment, her local market is becoming a regional market with much larger crowds. She wants to take advantage of the opportunity to make her business more professional. Only the improvement and increase of her business will allow her to properly meet the needs of her children. That is why she is asking for a loan of $600 to increase and diversify the products she sells to take advantage of this new chance and improve her standard of living. To finance this business is to ease of suffering of an entire family beset by daily difficulties.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1963 à Agbodrafo (Préfecture des Lacs) Madame A. Têlé est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. En plus de ses enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (2) petits fils de son aîné. Femme dynamique et pleine d’espoir, elle dispose d’un étalage d’ustensiles et accessoires de cuisine au marché de sa localité. Veuve depuis 2 ans, elle a du mal à supporter les charges familiales. Actuellement, le marché de sa localité est en passe de devenir un marché régional et on y note une très grande affluence. Aussi veut-elle profiter de cette occasion pour rendre professionnelle son activité. Seul le renforcement de son commerce pourra lui permettre d’assumer convenablement les besoins de ses enfants. Pour y parvenir, il lui faut de l’argent. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour augmenter et diversifier ses produits afin de tirer profit de cette nouvelle donne et relever son niveau de vie. Financer cette affaire, c’est soulager les souffrances de toute une famille en proie aux difficultés quotidiennes.

loans.use: buying and reselling utensils and kitchen accessories

loans.name: Mariette

texts.en:
Mariette has just started selling clothes but can only buy a few at a time. She has chosen this business so that she can sell clothing for children and adolescents, including her own. She sells her clothing to people in her neighborhood, as well as street markets on Saturdays. She would like to be able to have enough inventory to make a larger profit and continue expanding her young business. Mariette lives with her only child outside of Trou-du-Nord, a city with a large market for a small business economy. Micro-entrepreneurs like Mariette and shoppers make clothing stands like Mariette's an ideal business for growth and her professional commitment to her business makes her a great addition to Esperanza's associates.

NOTE: As with all Esperanza loan recipients in Haiti, Mariette is a member of a solidarity group, which receives and pays back equal shares of one loan. This $1,200 loan will benefit nine other entrepreneurs and their businesses in along with Mariette. They formed their Bank of Hope, went through business training and will repay their loan together. If one person is struggling to pay on time in full, their group will help to make up the difference. This fosters accountability and a community support system.

loans.use: Purchase new and used clothing to expand inventory

loans.name: Dilma Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Dilma P.. I sell plastic goods like tubs, glasses, plates, bags, sheets, pichers, baskets, buckets, hooks, and garbage bins. I've been doing this for 3 years and my daughter helps me to sell my products. At this moment I'd like to increase my inventory because the demand for these products is high and I sell a lot. With the profits I make I want to remodel my business and provide for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dilma P. me dedico a la venta de utencilios de plastico como ser pilas, vasos, platos, bolsas, panas, picheles, canastas, baldes, ganchos, baldes para basura, actividad que realizo desde hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para la venta de mi producto, en estos momentos necesito tener mas inventario ya que la demanda de estos productos es buena y hay muchas ventas, con las ganancias que obtenga deseo remodelar mi negocio y alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy all sorts of plastic goods

loans.name: Meak

texts.en: Mrs. Meak N. is a widow and lives with her 6 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a fruit seller, earning around $2.50 each day, while three of her children work in a garment factory and the other three are students. This loan will be used to repair her house because it frequently leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair a house

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
My name is Ameeran B. and I am the mother of five children. I make knitwear while my husband works at a property dealer shop and my eldest son is a tailor. Together, we earn $150 USD a month. This income is too less to bear the expenses of seven family members.

Therefore, I need to expand my knitting business, buy additional wool. Thus, I am requesting a $250 USD loan. The additional profits that I will be able to generate from this expansion will help me marry off my eldest daughter and improve our current financial condition.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool

loans.name: Alicia Maritza

texts.es:
Sra. Alicia belongs to the Senor de los Milagros de Yungay group. She sells general merchandise at retail in the Peruvian "departamento" or region of Ancash, her charisma having helped her launch the business. She started the store to help her husband with household expenses.

She says that she began with little money, but with help from Manuela Ramos and a recent loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she's bought sugar, rice, and pasta. She's expanding her business, her goal being to grow it a little more everyday and to make it a hub for the neighborhood.

Sra. Alicia, 22, has an 8-month old daughter; she receives help and support from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alicia pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay, su actividad es la venta de abarrotes al por menor, esta ubicado en el campo Ferial de Yungay, Provincia de Yungay, Departamento de Ancash, su carisma hace que ella pueda tener su propio negocio, para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos.

Ella manifiesta que empezó con poco capital y con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos y el reciente crédito obtenido de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($99), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado una bolsa de azúcar, un saco de arroz y dos paquetes de fideos. Esta incrementando su negocio, teniendo como objetivo que crezca cada día más y ser un centro comercial

La señora Alicia tiene 22 años, y tiene una hija de 8 meses, ella recibe el apoyo y ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. Manual C. lives in his own home in the Milluni area of the city of El Alto with his two children. Manual works as a builder on private jobs. The home on his property has only two rooms and electricity. Because he lives in the surrounding areas of El Alto, there isn't a perimeter wall (fence). The loan will be used for the construction of a perimeter wall and a primary access door to his home. This is the second time that he has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates that he is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Manuel C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Milluni de la Ciudad de El Alto con sus dos hijos, el señor Manuel trabaja como constructor en obras particulares. La vivienda de su propiedad solo cuenta con dos habitaciones y el servicio de electricidad domiciliaria, ya que vive en la zona peri urbana de El Alto y no cuenta con un muro perimetral El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción del muro perimetral y una puerta de acceso principal a su domicilio. Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado, lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Building of a perimeter wall (fence) and a principal access door to the house.

loans.name: Rfppn Group

texts.fr:
Following this year ‘s lack of rain, the Women’s Group of Popenguine for the Protection of the Environment has decided to create a cereal bank to prepare for the next few months, because the crops are not good. This is why, for the first time, we are asking for financing so we can buy peanuts, millet, corn and baobab fruits to stock those products.  At this time, we would like to take advantage of the marketing drive to buy the maximum amount of grain possible, because we know the danger of famine is likely to be felt this year and surely the winter will be tough. This is how we will be able to supply the population of our ecovillage in foodstuff. Thus, our advanced planning will serve the population of the ecovillage.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Suite à une pluviomètrie déficiente pour cette année, le Regroupement des Femmes de Popenguine pour la 

Protection de la Nature a décidé  de créer une banque de céréales pour préparer les prochains mois, car 

les récoltes ne sont pas bonnes. C'est pour cela que pour la première fois nous demandons un 

financement afin de pouvoir acheter des arachides, du mil, du maîs et des fruits de baobab pour stocker ces 

produits. En ce moment, nous voulons profiter de la campagne de commercialisation pour achater le 

maximum possible de grains, car nous savons que la famine risque de se faire sentir cette année et que 

certainement la période hivernale va être très dure. Ce qui fait que nous pourrons venir fournir les 

populations de notre écovillage en denrée alimentaire. Ainsi, la prévision que nous aurons fait servira à la   

population de  l'écovillage

loans.use:
Purchase of cereals to constitute a bank of stock.
Achat de céréales pour constituer une banque de stock

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver B. is a 60-year-old farmer who sells milk to the local bazaar traders in a small village in Saatli region. He is married and has three children. It is very hard to keep a family in reasonable condition when you are unemployed, and his only source of income is selling milk and yoghurt. Anver has more than ten years of experience in this field, and last year, the price of goods increased by five times (500%), so keeping only one cow is not enough to maintain such a large family. Anver has decided to expand his dairy business by purchasing one milk cow for $700 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina S. and I am from Chichawatni, Pakistan. I have four kids including three girls and one boy. All my girls are teachers and my boy is obtaining a law degree. Both my husband and I have worked very hard all our life to provide a good future to our kids, and although we have limited resources, we have always put a top priority on our children's education.

My husband runs a diesel oil agency that receives reasonable revenues, however, we require a loan in order to improve our business even further. As group leader, I have undertaken responsibility for five women who reside in my neighborhood, including: Sakina M.. who requires a loan to expand her general store; Shugufta N., who would like to buy clothes for her business; and Shugufta P., who needs to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: Expand diesel oil store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is an obstetrician (childbirth physician). Thanks to her studies she has been able to obtain a position with a state institution. During the morning she attends to patients in the emergency room and in the afternoon she gives her time to medical attention in her own doctor's office. Just recenlty, she started selling medical and beauty products also. She works mostly with women, and for fifteen years she has given women gynecology services and family planning.

At first she worked only in the emergency room but her dream was to have her own office, and with determination and effort she achieved it. Now her goal is to complement her office with a small pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gloria es de profesión obstreta. Gracias a sus estudios ella ha podido obtener un puesto de trabajo en una institución del estado. Durante las mañanas ella atiende a pacientes en una posta medica y por las tardes, dedica su tiempo a la atención medica en su propio consultorio y, desde hace muy poco tiempo, a la venta de productos medicinales y de belleza también. Su trato es básicamente con mujeres, ella se encarga de darles atención en ginecología y en planificación familiar desde hace quince años. Al inicio ella solo trabaja en la posta medica pero su sueño era tener un consultorio propio es por eso que a base de empeño y esfuerzo lo consiguió, ahora sus meta es complementar su consultorio con una farmacia-bazar.

loans.use: Add more products to her mini pharmacy.

loans.name: Sriyati

texts.id:
The income earned by Sriyati’s husband as a worker in a workstation is not enough to afford their family's daily needs as well as to pay their children tuition fee. For that reason, Sriyati should work. She is doing laundry business with washing machine and iron as the asset. In a month, Sriyati could earn Rp 1,000,000 revenue, and still has to buy detergent and other materials, which requires Rp 100,000 a week. With the income, she is able to pay her children tution fee.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha suaminya sebagai karyawan sebuah bengkel ternyata belum cukup untuk memenui kebutuhan rumah tangga yang begitu banyak. Juga harus membiayai sekolah anaknya yang sekarang sudah SMP. Karena alasan itulah, Sriyati juga bekerja. Saat ini usahanya adalah sebagai tukang cuci pakaian (laundry). Dengan sarana mesin cuci dan setrika, dalam sebulan pendapatannya bisa mencapai Rp.1.000.000. Tetapi tentu saja dia juga harus membeli sabun dan pengharum untuk pakaian, yang perminggunya bisa mencapai Rp.100.000. Keuntungan yang didapat bisa dipakai membayar biaya sekolah anaknya, Ayu Wulandari.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is forty seven years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. At the moment, one of her children has completed junior high school and is ready to enter senior high school, while the other two children are in primary school. She is a petty trader who trades in rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other such foods at a table in the local market.

Despite her business' relative success, she is convinced that the business can thrive even more with an increase in capital. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans in order to increase her stock and to generate greater income. Ultimately, she hopes that the expected increase in income from this particular loan will allow her to construct a decent shelter for her and her family.

Rose belongs to the community group called The Lord Is My Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure on one another to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing the stock of food (e.g., more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans).

loans.name: Fuente De Esperanza (Source Of Hope) Group 8

texts.en:
Francisca B. lives with her parents, her husband, and her two children, ages three and six. She is currently 4 months pregnant with her third child. She owns and cooks in a small “fritura” where she sells fried foods like empanadas along with other snacks. While she’s at work, her 6 year-old goes to school and the 3 year-old stays at home with her parents. Francisca has successfully repaid three loans to Esperanza International and is currently applying for her fourth.

Francisca has great ambitions for the future. She wants to expand her business so that she will have money to pursue many dreams. She has completed her first year of high school and, though she is not currently in school, she hopes to go back and finish her diploma. She would love to be able to have her own house for her family. She also dreams of being able to send her three kids through school all the way to college so that they can have professional careers.

Note: Mariana Isa was not able to come because her niece was very sick, so her husband appears in this photo in her place.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: To grow her business selling fried foods

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Cao Thị Hà 54 tuổi, hiện tại kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc hộ khá trong địa phương. Chồng chị ngoài làm ruộng ra còn làm thêm nghề thợ xây bình quân mỗi tháng anh đi làm thu nhập 2.000.000đ. Chị có 3 người con, 2 con đã có việc làm, 1 con đang đi học. Ngay từ những ngày đầu Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia Quỹ vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn ban đầu còn thấp nên chị chỉ được vay 500.000đ chị đã đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, vốn vay được tăng dần theo hàng năm, chị đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi chị nuôi thêm lợn, bò. Từ việc chăn nuôi có hiệu quả gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị trong gia đình. Các con chị đi làm hàng tháng thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 11.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. 
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cao Thi H., aged 54, has three children, two of whom are grown-ups and are working while the other one is still in school. Mrs. H.’s husband is not only a farmer but also a construction worker, earning about 2.000.000 VND per month. The family’s financial situation is relatively good compared to that of other families in her neighborhood. When TYM Fund opened its branch in her area, Mrs. H. didn’t hesitate to participate in the program and request loans. Because the loan of the first round was limited, Mrs. H. could only take out 500000 VND and used it to breed chickens. As the amount of loans that can be borrowed increases annually, Mrs. H. has used them to raise pigs and cows. The family’s situation has been improved a lot as a result, which allows the family to purchase necessary furniture for their house. Her two children who are working make 3.000.000 VND per month, which helps the whole family a lot. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. would like to borrow 11.000.000 VND ($ 675) to keep investing in poultries. Her family’s monthly income is 6.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Mosi

texts.en:
Mosi is 34 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 13 and 5. She has been selling charcoal since 2000. She works everyday from 8am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mosi is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for re-sale.

loans.name: Enita

texts.es: Enita tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales  son sus ganas de seguir adelante, su esposo Juan es trabajador dependiente de una empresa local y siempre está de acuerdo con lo que su cónyuge decide, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace ya varios años.  Las aspiraciones que tiene para sus hijos es brindarles sus estudios y todo lo necesario para que se sientan felices.  Enita quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener cada día mayor cantidad de productos, posteriormente quiere tener un minimarket, ahora necesita de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Enita is 34 years old and the mother of four children, who are her motivation to continue onward. Her husband Juan is a worker dependent on a local enterprise and he is always in agreement with what his wife, who has been selling groceries for several years now, decides. The dream that she has for her children is to provide them with educations and all the basic necessities so they are happy. Enita wants to continue to grow her business and have more products each day and, later, she would like to have a mini-mart. She currently needs capital to meet her objective, which is why she is seeking this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products she sells in her grocery store.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene 43 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias al Éxito II y vive en la Mz E lote 10 del Asentamiento Humano Fujimori Fujimori en el Puerto de Salaverry  provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta primer año de secundaria pero no tuvo apoyo económico departe de sus padres por tal motivo no pudo seguir estudiando.  Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales se casaron dos y ella tiene a su cargo a un hijo de 14 años.
María Isabel vende gelatina, cerveza helada y los sábados y domingos hace comida para vender en su casa, a lo que popularmente  le llaman piqueos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compro cerveza y gaseosa, manifiesta que estaba recién incursionando en este negocio y le fue muy bien porque vendió absolutamente todo, de tal manera que continuó y piensa ampliarlo un poco más.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas, ampliará su negocio, comprará más cosas como por ejemplo, vasos, banquitos (sillas), cerveza y gaseosa.
María Isabel sueña con tener un bonito y elegante restaurant.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 43 years old and is a member of the communal bank Las Empresarias al Exito II. She lives at Mz E lote 10 of Asentamiento Humano Fujimori Fujimori in the Puerto de Salavery in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad Peru department. She finished her first year of secondary school but did not have the economic support from her parents in order to keep studying. She got married at 19 years old and has three children. Two of her children are married and she cares for her 14 year old son. Maria Isabel sells jell-o and beer and on Saturdays and Sundays she makes food, commonly called "piqueos", which she sells from her home. She repaid her first loan in four installments and she used it to purchase beer and soft drinks. She had just started her business when she received this loan and business went well as she sold absolutely everything which allowed her to stay in business and to start thinking about expanding. She will repay this loan in four installments and will use it to expand her business and purchase supplies such as cups, stools, beer and soft drinks. Maria dreams with having a beautiful and elegant restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as cups, stools, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and has two grown-up children. She sells vegetables and fruits at the central food market. Her business is quite successful because of its good location and reasonable prices. Her monthly net income is 2000 UAH.

Galina has been in this business for 5 years. The company she used to work for downsized and she was left without any income. She decided to open the food business. For a while it was the only source of income for her family.  

Galina would like to get a loan in the amount of 3000 UAH to purchase 100 lbs. of oranges, 50 lbs. of cucumbers, and 50 lbs. of tomatoes and other vegetables. She hopes that increased variety will bring more customers. Galina uses her income to help provide for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase 100 lbs. of oranges, 50 lbs. of cucumbers, and 50 lbs. of tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
This simple housekeeper from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental is coping with life's challenges. At the age of 42, Clemencia S. admits that there is no room for her to rest comfortably and wait for unknown blessings. She and her husband Ernesto did not finish any college degree. Given that fact, the couple tried the fishing business. The first few months went by with unpredictable returns. But the couple did not give up. They continued and learned the business. At present, they own 2 units of pumpboats that give a weekly net income of PHP 800 to PHP 1,000. Not bad when they were just starting out.

To yield more income, they want to purchase additional fish nets which they can have for rent. They applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Clemencia has safeguarded her credit records with the cooperative. Being a member for almost 4 years, she shared that though the loan windows are readily available, the savings products of Paglaum are what she likes most.

Mr. and Mrs. S. have saved for the education of their children. They want their children to be able to fulfill their dreams by pursuing their studies. They conclude that Paglaum MPC has been a consistent partner in extending financial assistance for their livelihood. So if financial difficulties arise, they can always run to Paglaum.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.en:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. S. Asomidin has been selling vegetables in Dushanbe Central market for the past 2 years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Asomidin began selling vegetables at the market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Asomidin is a father of two children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing his best in order to ensure his children the best future and to make them well educated. Now he needs a loan for a size of 4000 Somoni in order to increase the stock of his selling goods. He promises to repay the loan within 9 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of vegetables

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Шоева Махбуба 1988 года рождения. Она живет с родителями в районе Рудаки. Благодаря тёте, которая научила ее шить и вышивать, Махбубу уже хорошо знают в своем районе. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев, а также вышивкой.  Ее девиз «Клиент – всегда прав»! Учитываю этот девиз, она старается  угождать своим клиентом разновидностью фасонов и орнаментами, которые сама вышивает. Махбуба вышивает необычные узоры. 
Махбуба также закупает материал и шьет халаты, которых закупают продавцы с рынка «Корвон» и сейчас она хочет получить займ 1500 сомони сроком 6 месяцев, чтобы купить материал и нитки.
texts.en:
Mahbuba S. was born in 1988. She lives with her parents in the Rudaki area. Thanks to her aunt who taught her to sew and embroider, Mahbuba is already well known in her neighborhood. She sews traditional dresses and also embroiders. Her motto is “The client - is always right!” Given her motto, she tries to serve her clients by providing a variety of styles and decorations, which she embroiders herself. Mahbuba embroiders unusual patterns. Mahbuba also purchases fabric and sews housecoats, which are purchased by the sellers at the “Korvon” market and she would like to take out a 6 month loan for $425 (150 somoni) in order to purchase fabric and thread. .

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Benevolent Primary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Benevolent Islamic Primary School, Magburaka. The school was built by the Benevolent Mission in 1986. It has a total of 14 staff members and 432 pupils. 

The Benevolent school staff will use their first loan from Kiva through SMT for a variety of purposes. Some will start a small business, while others will invest in their existing businesses.  As an example, John A.S. K. (2nd from right) is the Deputy Head Teacher of the school. John is married to a businesswoman and the two of them have two children together. To supplement his meager monthly salary, he sells local products like rice, palm-oil, pepper, etc. This loan will enable him to invest in his business. 

Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture; others will use their loan in home building projects. Some will pay for their children’s education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. With their monthly salaries, they will gradually repay their loan to SMT.

loans.use: Invest in Business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin S. is a 33-year-old family man with four children. He owns a small piggery business by which he hopes to provide for his family's needs. He has a sow that bears piglets, which he sells to other pig growers in his village. He has been in this business a long time because, aside from the fact that he enjoys the work, he has earned a reasonable profit from raising pigs.

Franklin is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more feed for his pigs, and believes that the loan will really help him grow his piggery business. Franklin is also interested in venturing into other lines of business as a means of paying his children's tuition and other school fees. More about CEVI CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and own their own business. CEVI gives its clients the credit assistance they need, and also provides training and insurance coverage to further support its clients' businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto de 42 años de edad, está casado hace 8 años, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos ya viven fuera de casa. Las labores agrícolas son parte de su vida, es un hombre noble y carismático, sobre todo muy entregado a cada uno de sus cultivos. Cuando lo visitamos, lo hallamos a las 7.00am realizando la cosecha de papa, sonriendo por la alegría que le trae esta faena, después alista y transporta su producto para comercializarlo en los mercados de la ciudad. La siembra de papa es muy rentable para Alberto, aunque tenga que trabajar mucho en el desarrollo de este tubérculo, se siente muy complacido por los precios del mercado, esto lo motiva a seguir sembrando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos menores. Los planes de Alberto son de incrementar sus cultivos, pero carece de tierras propias, esto no lo desanima, pues seguirá sembrando en chacras alquiladas hasta que pueda comprarse las suyas. Generalmente para las reuniones de su banco comunal, asiste su esposa, porque él está trabajado en sus chacras. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo a demostrado ser un cliente muy puntual. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en la compra de semillas de alverjas, para sembrarlas en la chacra cosechada de papa.
texts.en:
Alberto is 42 years of age, has been married for eight years, and has seven children of whom two are now living away from home. Agricultural work is part of his life. He is a noble and charismatic man, but above all he is very devoted to his farming. When we visited him, we found him harvesting potatoes at seven in the morning and smiling with the joy that this chore brings him. Afterward, he gets his produce ready and transports it to be sold in the city markets. Growing potatoes is very profitable for Alberto. Although it's a lot of work to produce them, he feels very satisfied with the prices at market. This motivates him to continue planting them, in order to improve the quality of life for his young children. Alberto plans to increase his plantings but he doesn't have his own fields. This doesn't discourage him. He will continue farming on rented farmland until he is able to buy his own. His wife usually attends the meetings of his communal bank because he is working in his fields. This is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in all of that time he has shown himself to be a very punctual client. The funds he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for peas in order to grow them in the field once the potatoes are harvested.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for peas.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana E. is 40 years old. She is widowed with four children who are currently in school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for eleven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts, and the fruits from the palm nuts are also processed through various stages to obtain the oil which is used to prepare many local dishes. Nana produces and supplies it to food vendors to prepare their meals. She normally treks them in gallons to the big cities in Ghana like Accra and Kumasi. In addition to that, she also sells items like onions, peppers, and spices on top of a table in the market.

Nana wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency to produce oil in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business, enabling her to raise more income to support her children’s education. Nana belongs to the village bank called ‘Yohane’ which literary means John.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Fulgencio Júlio

texts.pt:
Fulgencio nasceu em gaza, tem 27 anos de idade é solteiro e sem filhos, estudou até a 10ª classe e cursou a formação de professores primários equivalente ao nível medio.

Sai de Gaza para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilândia com os seus pais apois a transferencia do seu pai no serviço este que trabalhava na Educaçao. Depois de concluir o ensino basico, a sua mãe aconselhou o para ingressar no curso de formaçao de professores primarios como cominho rapido para entrar no  mercado de emprego. Assim Fulgencio concluiu o curso em dois anos e logo foi afecto para trabalhar como adiministractivo na direcçao distrital de Educaçao na mesma vila de Namaacha, esta a trabalhar como efectivo a tres anos e oufere um salario no valor de 4.700,00mt mensalomente,não consegue poupar nada porque esta a construir a sua rensidencia na vila de Boane que sita a 75 KM de distancia da vila de Namaacha e não consegue concluir, aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um valor para dar continuidade da sua obra valor este que obteve com um pouco de dificuldades devido a falta de bens, mas com ajuda do seu tio seu avalista  ele consegue superar a barreira e continuar com as obras.  Responsabiliza se pele mae e seus dois irmaos mais novos que vivem na cidade do Maputo enviando lhes 1000,00mt por mês.


Este e o segundo emprestimo de fulgencio na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Os primeiros 10.000.00mt foram usados para comprar material de construçao para dar inicio da sua obra pois já possuia uma parte de terra que obteve atraves do stick, e estes outros 10.000.00mt seram usados para dar continuidade da mesma obra. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e adquirir um outro para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Fulgencio was born in Gaza Province. He is 27 years old and single with no children. He attended school through the 10th grade and he received training as an elementary teacher.
