He left Gaza Province for Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland, with his parents after his father was transferred through his work in education. After completing primary education, his mother advised him to enroll in the training course for primary teachers as a fast path to entering the job market. Fulgencio completed the course in two years and quickly went to work as an administrator in the District Administration Office of Education in the same town of Namaacha. He has been working for three years and earns a salary of 4700 meticais monthly. He has not been able to save because he is building his residence in the town of Boane, which is located 75 km away from the town of Namaacha. he has not been able to complete the construction, so he approached Hluvuku requesting a loan to continue the work. He obtained this with a little bit of difficulty due to lack of collateral, but with the help of his uncle as a backer, he was able to overcome this barrier and continue the work. He takes care of his mother and his two younger siblings who live in the city of Maputo by sending them 1000 meticais per month.

This is Fulgencio's second loan from Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first 10,000 meticais were used to buy construction material to start the project, since he already has part of the land. This additional 10,000 meticais will be used to continue the same building project. He is confident that he is going to repay before the loan term and take another loan to furnish the house.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Candida Rosa M. se dedica a la venta de sandalias y zapatos en su propio negocio que atiende desde hace 35 largos años habiendo sido este el negocio que a ella le ha permitido desarrollarse y percibir los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.

Ella busca la manera de salir adelante y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las sandalias y los zapatos y así llenar sus estantes y ofrecer variedad al público para continuar percibiendo los ingresos para sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Ms. Candida M. sells shoes at her own business that she has attended to for 35 long years. This business has permitted her to grow and receive an income. She has found it necessary to expand, and has therefore turned to CEPRODEL to be a beneficiary of credit to purchase footwear to fill her shelves and offer a variety of footwear to the public, so she can continue making an income to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano C. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Ponciano is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Ponciano owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Ponciano has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ponciano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ponciano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Ponciano is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ponciano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy L. owns and operates a variety retail store selling different products in her community. Juvy is single and has adult children. She is from the town of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin. Juvy has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dabawara 1 De (Dabawara Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DABAWARA 1 de l’association DABAWARA  sont toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture  de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république  du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le sorgho. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de  l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 23  hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue  Marka-Coungo et Fana  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DABAWARA 1 of the association DABAWARA are all married women who average 46 years of age and 4 children. The women live in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a leading rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their winter-time activities. The crops are peanuts and sorghum. The group is now on its fifth collaboration, and the past loans have indeed been settled. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 23 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after the harvests to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang L., age 28, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she manufactures hammocks, typically earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate income for his family. He is a motor-taxi driver providing his services to people in the city, earning an income of US $5 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband since the old motorbike consumes a lot of gasoline and needs to be repaired very often.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old and broken bike

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy O., age 53, and his wife, Mrs. Rem Chorn, 50, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have one son and one daughter. All of them are married and live in separated home. 
Thy has been a fisherman for twenty-one years; he fishes from the lake far away from his house. While his wife sells fish that her husband catches. Besides of selling fish, she raises cows as well. Thy’s wife has asked for a loan one time already. He is now applying for another loan again in amount of $800 to purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en: Precy S., 36 years old, is married to Eduardo who works as an electrician.  They have four children, three of whom have already finished their studies, while the youngest one, a 3-year-old, is at school.  To make a living, Precy has been managing a general store in the village of Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela for almost six years, and has been able to earn a weekly income of about PHP1,000, which she spends on the maintenance of her business and on family needs. Precy would now like to borrow PHP6,000 to add to her working capital in order to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Hermina

texts.en:
Hermina believes that investment is compared to a treasure that is quite useful when you are badly in need. She is happily married and generally has nine adult-aged children. With her investment in business, she is hoping to help her children in time of their needs. Hermina and her husband lives together in the village of La Salette, Benito Soliven, Isabela.
	Hermina is involved in raising of hogs in their village. She has two hogs so far and she is still hoping to increase their numbers when her loan amounting to PHP4,000 will be granted. She also hopes to have supply of feeds so that she won’t encounter any problem anymore in times of shortage. She aims to uplift their living condition someday with the help of her husband, lenders and most especially with our merciful God.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more pigs and feeds

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is engaged in making home made embutido (Embutido is a Filipino style of meatloaf wrapped in an aluminum foil) for three years and sells them in her village. Due to a limited budget to produce more embutido, she wants to borrow a loan from the KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP5,000 to have additional capital to buy the necessary ingredients. She hopes to expand her business and earn more income to sustain the needs of her family. Through this loan, she believes that her business will grow and become more profitable. She hopes that her loan request will be granted. 

Yvonne is 47 years old and married to Victor, a bus driver. The couple is blessed with three children who are all college graduates.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy ingriedients to produce "embutido"

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, who is 43 years old, is married to Joseph M. Sr.  Her husband is a security guard. They are blessed with four children:  Mark Anthony, 20; Jennifer, 17; Joseph Jr.,16; and Jonalyn, who is four years old. They live in the village of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela.

Florence has been working as a food vendor for almost three years. She sells rice cakes and cooked food in their village.  She earns a daily net income of PHP 200. That income is not sufficient for her family needs and the education of her children.  She is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva's lenders. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her products. She hopes that lenders will approve her loan request to improve the productivity of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Tous mariés, les membres du groupe Djiguiya ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec les frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de Bougouni dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de mariages et de commerce de céréales. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière afin de faire assez de stocks de céréales, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 6 tonnes de maïs, 500kg de fonio et 3 tonnes de petit mil. Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de Bougouni pour être  ensuite revendus en gros sur le marché de Bamako. Leur clientèle est essentiellement composée d’hommes et la vente se fait au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
All married, the members of the Djiguiya group are, on average, 34-years-old and have 5 children. They live in traditional domestic families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands. These women live in the Massabla-coura section of Bougouni village in the third administrative region of Mali. They know each other through marriage and the grain trade. In order to stock grain and increase their financial resources, they have decided to join together at the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. As a group, they are on their sixth loan; they successfully repaid their first five loans. With this loan, they intend to buy 6 tons of corn, 500 kg of fonio (a West African grain), and 3 tons of millet. They purchase the products from suppliers in villages surrounding Bougouni and then resell them at retail prices at the Bamako market. Their customers are primarily men, and sales are made in cash. With this loan, the women each envision receiving a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA to be used depending on each woman's individual activities.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Grains

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji A. bakes and sells local Sudanese bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials for baking so she can bake more bread to sell. Keji is 39 years old and is married to a journalist. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bigger bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more baking materials

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert tiene 41 años, es muy alegre y vive en compañía de su esposa Amelia y sus dos hijos, en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a tocar diversos instrumentos musicales, ya que esa es su gran pasión,  desde que era muy pequeño aprendió a hacerlo, y ahora pertenece a una agrupación musical que se dedica a brindar todo tipo de presentaciones en distintas ceremonias donde requieran sus servicios. Es por este motivo que se encuentra muy feliz de  trabajar en lo que realmente le gusta además tiene el apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos quienes son sus principales admiradores, con esta gratificante  motivación sabe que logrará llegar muy lejos y espera poder cumplir  todos sus sueños para el bienestar de su familia. También es muy unido con sus compañeros de grupo y juntos están trabajando muy duro para salir adelante, lamentablemente sus instrumentos ya no funcionan como al principio y es por ello que necesita renovarlos con urgencia.Es su tercer crédito en MFP y dice que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos, al igual que con los préstamos anterioresCon el dinero del préstamo espera comprar instrumentos nuevos y así podrá seguir ejerciendo su gran pasión, “la música”.
texts.en:
Robert is 41 years old, he is a happy man who lives with his wife Amelia and their two children in their own house. He plays several musical instruments; this is his great passion since he was a child. Today he belongs to a music band that performs in different events, wherever their services are requested. He is very happy to work in what he likes and he has the support of his wife and children, who are his greatest fans. Due to this motivation he believes he will get far and he hopes to achieve his dreams for the well-being of his family. He is also very close to the other members of the band and they work together very hard to get ahead. Unfortunately their instruments are not working so well anymore and they need urgently to be replaced. This is his third loan with MFP and he makes sure he will repay on schedule, as he did with the previous ones. With this loan he wants to buy new instruments and be able to keep following his great passion: music.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina P. is 24 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Christina has 5 years of experience in this business.  Christina needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Christina joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Christina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Christina P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Mrs. Dy T. is 45 years old and she lives in Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while another does housework and the third is a student at the local school.  Mrs. Dy T. and her husband, Mr. Sokhom T., are farmers who own a three-hectare field on which to cultivate rice. With this farm, they do not have enough money to support it. So, Mrs. Dy T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a harvest machine for her first child to start business. Aside from the farm, this family owns a poultry business.

loans.use: To buy a harvest machine

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 40 years-old and married with four children. Her husband is a businessman. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She owns a beer parlour where she sells drinks, groceries and rechargeable phone cards at retail prices. She hopes to expand her business to attract more customers. She looks forward to having a classic restaurant in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks, groceries and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, groceries and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Marl Nesly

texts.en:
Marl Nesly R. is from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de  Oro City. She is 26 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marl Nesly has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marl Nesly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Marl Nesly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business.  This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her store. 
---------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
Mrs. Eufracia C. is from the village of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old, married, and blessed with one adult-aged child. She owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of grocery items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns 700 PHP monthly net from the business.
In 2006, Eufracia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to access the programs and services of the cooperative. She is now on her ninth loan cycle and is requesting the amount of 5,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her existing business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokly K. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Rithy Moeung, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, were married in 2000, and have two sons. One is in school and the other is still too young. 

Sokly has been weaving silk since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She also started new business selling silk products. She buys silk fabrics from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her house. Sokly has had a Kiva loan in the past, and is now requesting another loan of US$500 to purchase silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en:
Kayed is a 59-year-old married man and the father of six children, four of whom are employed and help him in the household. He runs a successful taxi business in his home town. He is an experienced driver who has been working for over 22 years.

With the requested Kiva loan of $1,000, Kayed will be able to purchase a new car instead of the used one so that he can continue to expand his business and offer a good transportation service to customers. He feels positive about his business growth for the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Olga Katherine

texts.es: Se acerca el mes D. Mayo y con ello día en que Colombia conmemora a las madres, creado originalmente como “un día D. madres por L. paz”, que luego se convirtió en un día para cada familia en honor a su madre y se ha convertido en una fiesta en muchos lugares del mundo. En este mes D. Mayo se genera una gran dinámica comercial, porque se hace reconocimiento no solo a las madres biológicas, sino a todas las mujeres madres, o a quienes ocupan el papel D. madre. D. aquí se derivan  hermosos detalles y regalos dirigidos por jóvenes, adultos, niños, hombres y mujeres, a  suegras, hermanas, cuñadas, amigas y vecinas. Esta es L. razón por L. cual Olga Katherine D. L. R., mujer D.  gran experiencia en mercadeo, se prepara, invirtiéndole al negocio una mercancía ajustada a esta celebración, para hacer su oferta en el mes D. Mayo; elL. también decora, con motivos que expresan el amor D. madre, su otro negocio donD. presta el servicio D. fotocopiado e impresión; así lo ha hecho durante 4 años, en los que ha construido su mercado; hoy su clienteL. ha anticipado sus  pedidos D. vestidos, perfumes, carteras femeninas y necesita un crédito por valor D. $ 1.500.000 y   para poder responderle oportunamente está  solicitándolo su 5° financiamiento a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Olga dice que los créditos logrados en esta organización,  le han servido para solventar su economía familiar, porque cuando elL. se inició como comerciante  en el año 2006, vendía solamente mercancía y tenía pocos clientes, y generaba pocos ingresos para su familia;  ahora no solo son familiares y vecinos sus clientes  sino también referidos D. sus amigos y ha logrado mas utilidades, porque además agregó otro negocio: el D. servicio D. fotocopiado e impresiones que le da L. oportunidad D. compartir su tiempo, entre las actividades productivas, reproductivas y domésticas. Ahora sueña con tener su propia casa, sacar adelante L. educación D. sus tres hijos en las edades D. 1 a 9 años, incrementar su negocio en ventas e infraestructura, y sobre todo continuar con su servicio D. calidad en L. atención a su especial clienteL., porque Olga Katherine, vive en el popular barrio CiudadeL. 20 D. Julio, y su ubicación L. aprovecha muy bien, teniendo en cuenta que en él interactúan residencias familiares, negocios estacionarios y ambulantes y está muy cerca al Estadio Metropolitano D. BarranquilL., escenario seD. del equipo D. futbol muy querido por los costeños “El Junior”
texts.en:
May is approaching, and with it the day that in Colombia commemorates mothers, created originally as "a day of mothers for peace", which later became a day for each family to honor its mother and has become a holiday in many parts of the world. In this month of May sales are high because recognition is given not only to biological mothers, but to all women who mother, or who fill the role of mother. Beautiful tokens and gifts are given by youths, adults, children, men and women, to mothers-in-law, sisters, sisters-in-law, friends and neighbors. This is the reason Olga Katherine D. L. R., a woman experienced in marketing, prepares by stocking her business with merchandise tailored to this celebration, to sell in the month of May; she also decorates her other business, where she offers photocopy and printing services, with motifs expressing love for mothers. She has done this for four years, the time in which she has run her business. Now her customers have given her orders for dresses, perfumes, and purses, and she needs a loan for 1500 Colombian pesos to be able to fill these orders. She is asking for her fifth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Olga says the loans she has received from this organization have helped her cover her household expenses, because when she began her life as a businesswoman in 2006, she only sold merchandise and had few customers, and earned little for her family. Now her customers are not only relatives and neighbors but also people referred to her by their friends, and she has maD. more profit because she also added another business: the photocopy and printing service that gives her the opportunity to diviD. her time among business and domestic activities. Now she dreams of having her own house, moving ahead with the education of her three children (ages one to nine years old), expanding her business' sales and infrastructure, and above all continuing with her quality service to her special customers, because Olga Katherine lives in the popular CiudadeL. 20 D. Julio neighborhood, and her location is very advantageous for her. In the neighborhood there are family residences, shops and traveling businesses, and it is very near the Metropolitan Stadium of BarranquilL., the home field for the "El Junior" soccer team, which is very popular with the coastal residents.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise including dresses, perfumes, and purses

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Progreso(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Hacia el Progreso está formado por siete  socias que siempre se encuentran en la búsqueda de mejores días para sus familias y así poder brindarles  un mejor presente y futuro; todas las socias viven en la urbe de la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta hermosa ciudad del Ecuador tiene para el turista nacional y extranjero hermosos paisajes naturales y la belleza de su centro histórico donde se encuentran  importantes vestigios históricos como el  museo y la  Catedral de la Inmaculada Concepción  una de las más grandes y hermosas de América y otras más que datan de los siglos XVI y XVII. Sus  calles adoquinadas y casas con fachadas de estilo republicano hacen notar las diferentes influencias europeas con nobles balcones y cielorrasos tallados artísticamente. La ciudad es además conocida como la "Cuenca de los Andes" o la "Atenas del Ecuador" por ser cuna de poetas y hombres ilustres que han dejado en alto el nombre de esta ciudad.
En esta ocasión nos acompaña el señor Eulogio Rojas coordinador de la regional Azuay junto a las socias del banco comunal Mujeres hacia el Progreso.

La  señora  Jennifer García vive en el centro de la Ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 26 años de edad se encuentra casada y ha concebido un hijo que se encuentra de dos años, su esposo es diseñador  grafico en la  imprenta de su suegro de la que se hizo cargo hace ocho años, al momento no tienen casa propia viven compartiendo con sus suegros la casa y los gastos que en ella se genera. Jennifer  trabaja también en la imprenta prestando sus servicios profesionales como contadora hace tres años laborando de  8 a.m. a 1 p.m. dedicándose el resto del tiempo a su hijo.

Se encuentra trabajando con los préstamos del bankito ya tres años gracias a que fue invitada  por su mamá a  formar parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, los crédito le han beneficiado en los gastos de su hogar y en la imprenta de su esposo, con su nuevo crédito va adquirir  una impresora para su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener una casa propia.

Flora tiene 63 años de edad y vive con su esposo abogado de profesión en su casa propia gracias al esfuerzo conyugal, tiene tres hijos de 35, 32, 30 años que son casados y viven independientes
>p>
La  señora  Flora Campo trabaja hace ocho  años en el bankito y fue invitada por una compañera del gremio de artesanos  ya que ella es costurera de  oficio hace cincuenta años,  labor que aprendió de su madre,  tiene un pequeño taller en su casa donde  trabaja según los pedidos que tiene que entregar y labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario establecido. Con su nuevo credito va a comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres, gafetes, etc.  para abastecer su taller de costura.

Su sueño es ver a todos sus hijos tener su casa propia para tranquilidad de toda la familia.
texts.en:
The Women for Progress Communal Bank consists of seven members who are constantly striving for better days for their families, to offer them a better present and future. All members live in the Cuenca area. For both domestic and foreign tourists, this beautiful Ecuadorian city offers gorgeous natural scenery and the beauty of its historic center, home to historic remains such as the museum and Immaculate Conception Cathedral, one of the largest and most beautiful in America, as well as others dating back to the 16th and 17th centuries. Its cobblestone streets and houses with facades typical of the republican era give witness to the different European influences, with noble balconies and artistic ceilings. The city is also known as the “Valley of the Andes,” or the “Athens of Ecuador,” because it is the cradle of illustrious men and poets, who have made the city famous. For this occasion we are joined by Eulogio Rojas, coordinator of the Azuay regional area, along with members of the Women for Progress Communal Bank. Jennifer G. lives in downtown Cuenca, is 26 years old, married, and has a two-year-old child. Her husband is a graphics designer in his father-in-law’s printing house, who took this over eight years ago. They do not have their own home at this time, but share a house with their in-laws, along with its expenses. Jennifer also works in the printing house, providing professional services in the accounting area, for three years now working from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m., with the rest of her time devoted to her child. She has been working with loans from this bank for three years now, thanks to her mother’s invitation to join this lovely group of enterprising women. The loans have served her for household expenses and for her husband’s printing house. Her next loan will go to purchase a printing press for the business. Her goal is to have her own home. Flora is 63 years old, and lives with her lawyer husband in her own home, achieved through their own efforts. They have three children, 35, 32, and 30 years of age, who are married and independent. For eight years, Flora Campo has worked in the bank, being invited by a colleague from the artisans’ union, as she has been a seamstress by trade for fifty years, which she learned from her mother. She has a small shop in her home, where she fulfills orders, working from Monday to Saturday on a schedule that varies. With her next loan, she will buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, clasps, etc., to supply her workshop. Her dream is to see all of her children in their own homes, which will bring comfort to the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a printing press, and fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen T., 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $1 each per day to help cover the family expenses. When her husband is available from the rice field, he produces roofing from palm leaves. 

T. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

T.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
A. Firuza is an enterprising business owner. She has a place at a market where she sells kid’s clothing. Her business is doing well and provides a large part of her family’s income. Firuza is married and has three children. She has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to help purchase a new supply of inventory. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this woman. Thanks!  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing supplies of new children's clothing for the summer season.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba T. is married and has five dependents. She has not received any form of education. Her husband is a stone quarrier.

Araba cracks stones for sale, selling them mostly to builders at Abura. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra stones for distribution.

With the new earnings from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to provide a meaningful education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase extra stones for distribution

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina B. is from the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Felomina is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Felomina sells mineral and distilled water in the local community. Felomina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Felomina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Felomina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
One of the pioneer members of the Rizal Central Branch of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, is Amelita C.. She is 62 years of age and a resident of Cardona, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She joined ASHI in 2003 and was recognized as one of the good model borrowers in the center. Her husband passed away a few years ago and left her with their two children: Melody, 36, and Mariyon, 34.

When Amelita joined ASHI seven years ago, cooking and selling native foods was her business. She is thankful that ASHI provided her with capital during those times. From her income she was able to send her children to school and have them finish their choice of degree.

Again, Amelita is applying for a loan of Php 25,000 to use as capital for her food-production business. She needs this amount to buy raw materials like rice, sugar, coconut, other ingredients, banana leaves, firewood and additional cooking tools. The demand for her delicious product has increased and that is why, even at her age, she keeps on cooking and producing native food products.

Amelita’s dream is for her business to prosper for her family and for her to enjoy life to the fullest. ASHI and Kiva are a great help in the realization of her dream and she conveys her thanks to both institutions.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, coconut, other ingredients, banana leaves, cooking utensils and firewood

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Sara es conviviente, tiene 40 años D. edad y forma parte del grupo “Cristo Salvador” el cual lleva 8 años trabajando con edaprospo. Ella venD. golosinas desD. hace 1 año y dice que si tuviera un buen capital D. dinero pondría su propia bodega y así ayudaría mejor a sus 2 hijos que aun están en la escuela. Junto a los demás miembros del grupo los cuales son sus vecinos y comparten la misma devoción por Jesús, se han puesto D. acuerdo para darse la mano y mejorar juntos su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sara, 40, lives with a partner and is part of the group "Cristo Salvador," which has been working with EDAPROSPO for 8 years. She has been selling candy for a year, and says that if she had enough capital she would have her own store and in this way she could better help her 2 children who are in school. She and the other members of the group, who are her neighbors and share her devotion to Jesus, have agreed to join hands and improve their quality of life together.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Kayembe Development, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Operating a grocery and produce store has really improved T. Adrine's living conditions. In the past, T. Adrine, now 34, was involved in the farming business. Eighteen years ago, she changed her business into a food enterprise of products such as beans, millet flour, peas, and maize. She has been running this business from Rukungiri's central market, where she earns 280,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

As a married mother of 5 children, Adrine has been hardworking, knowing her responsibilities are cut out for her. She has been able to satisfy her family's requirements, including school fees for her children and other necessities, with help from her husband. Her drawback is having only a small stock of goods in her business. The loan she is requesting will enable her to expand the business through buying more goods and thus increasing her capacity to supply a ready market of customers. This will enable her to earn more sales revenue and live a more sustainable life as she looks at business expansion and building up a store.

loans.use: Purchase more stock

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. is part of the communal bank “Mapuamelen” and resides in the commune of Penco.  For the past five years, Sara has run a kiosk of confections, baked goods, soft drinks, and ice cream from her house, a temporary shack provided by the government as her house was lost during the earthquake of February 27, 2010. Sara also lost all of her inventory and two display cases. Fortunately, Sara has been approved to receive a subsidy house on her property, which she will obtain in January 2011.  Sara’s husband of 30 years is handicapped, due to an injury he received while working as a fisherman. He helps her attend to her business as they work seven days a week from 7 am to 1 am.  Sara and her husband chose these hours to take advantage of sales, as the other business in the areas close at 10 pm and open much later in the day.

With this loan, Sara will purchase merchandise.  She plans on adding to her business by offering milk products.  Sara is grateful for the economic support provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, as she has been able to expand her business. Sara is also appreciative of the lessons of “your business,” as it is now easier for her to close her accounts. Sara values the time she spends in the weekly group meetings as they have helped her be more social. 

Penco is a commune located close to the city of Concepción in southern Chile, the Bíobío Region. Its name derives from Mapudungun and means “Water of Peumo" (type of tree). It is one of the districts with the highest number of inhabitants in the region.  It is know for its industrial center and port.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora H. had always dreamed of seeing her four children graduate with degrees. This is because educational attainment is one of the major factors for gaining employment. The couple believes that education is wealth that others can’t steal. For this reason, they are working hard to give the best education for their 4 children. 

Rhodora wants to find a way to improve her family's quality of living. To this end, she joined Kiva partner, ASHI, and felt very happy to be given the chance to access working capital. The first few loans she received enabled her to operate her bamboo furniture making business. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. Now that she and her husband Mamerto, have secured access to capital, her profits have improved. For that reason, she is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount. Specifically the loan fund will be used for buying raw materials needed for her business.  This will enable her to grow their business further so that they will have savings in the future. Her long term dreams are to continue supporting her children as well as building a stronger home that can withstand flooding common in her province. 

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2007, Rhodora has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and timely repayments on loans. Since joining ASHI, she has gained more self-confidence as a businesswoman and entrepreneur managing her own venture.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her bamboo furniture making business.

loans.name: Alamakan

texts.en:
Alamakan M. is a very energetic and hardworking woman who is married and has three children.  She started her business in 2000 to find a means of supporting her family. With an initial sum of only 3,000 KGS, she began selling drinks in the street near the local market. Her persistent efforts increased her business and she now earns about 10,000 KGS a month.    

Alamakan has requested a loan of 45,000 KGS to increase the range of food products she offers. She will purchase vegetable oil, sugar, and salt. With her increased revenue, she plans to expand her business and provide a good dowry to her daughter. In the future, her dream is to buy a car for her son to help him with his own transportation business. Alamakan believes in the prosperous future of her family and does her best to make this dream come true. 

About Bai-Tushum:

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard K. lives in the village of Jajur in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is the proud mother of four children. Her three sons are 31, 29 and 25 years old. Her daughter is 22 years old. Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for over 30 years. Nvard has a high school education and considers herself to be a hard working, kind person. She dreams of seeing her children to be married with families and hopes to help them purchase homes.  

Nvard would like a loan to purchase additional calves. With proper planning she expects the family income to grow by 20 percent. The reliable services of microfinance loans have helped her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of fifteen members; they are located in Srae Kouk village in Kandal province. This village loan selected, Mrs. Heang M., a 41 year old married woman, as the village bank president. While each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Heang M. is a farmer who rent 1-hectare of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Beside of farmer, she also earns her living by selling tobacco in the local market. Since the tobacco business is going well she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more tobacco to resell. Her husband, Mr. Lim vuth, 45 years old, works as construction worker where he can receive a small salary to support his family. 

This couple has two children: One is a car driver and another is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, es una madre empeñosa en hacer las cosas bien, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Después de haber trabajado por 7 años en la costura, ahora se consagra en el bordado de chompas, que lo realiza en su casa, sin descuidar a sus hijos. En este trabajo se siente realizada y sobre todo le gusta lo que hace y sabe que cuanto más produce sus utilidades aumentarán. Es por ello que trata de avanzar lo más rápido posible; sobre todo en horas de la tarde, después de desocuparse de sus labores domesticas.  Desde muy niña aprendió esta actividad y hoy es toda una experta en el manejo del crochet. En adelante piensa agruparse entre varios socias y brindar prendas tejidas a los clientes. Es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar responsablemente el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para continuar tejiendo, asimismo desea invertir en la educación de su hijo.
texts.en: Sofia is an enterprising mother who enjoys doing things well. She lives in her own home in the company of her husband and their 3 children. For 7 years she worked as a seamstress but now she decorates sweaters with crochet accents, work that she carries out at home to keep an eye on the kids. She feels accomplished in this work and she enjoys doing it. She knows that the more she produces, the greater her earnings. She tries to work as fast as possible, especially in the afternoons when she has completed the house work. She learned the trade when she was just a girl and today she is an expert in the field. In the future she is thinking about getting a group of neighbors together to make crocheted clothing for her clients. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of threads to keep crocheting. She also wants to invest in her son's education.

loans.use: To purchase yard for knitting.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 2 hijos de los 4 que tiene. Su esposo es militar por lo que vive en otra provincia, a quien le visita con mucha frecuencia. Doña Hilda hace muchos años se dedica, a la confección de prenda militares. En todo este tiempo, su esposo que es militar; ha sido su gran apoyo, ya que por medio de él sus compañeros de trabajo le hacen pedidos a Hilda para que le confeccione dichas prendas, como: boinas, escarpines, lencerías y demás indumentarias al por mayor, para los militares. Eso la hace muy feliz a Hilda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza en la comodidad de su casa, y además, le es muy rentable. Pero cuando no tiene mucho trabajo, viaja al interior del país para visitar a su esposo, y a su hijo que también es militar, y se encuentra en otra provincia. En adelante, piensa retomar su empresa de confecciones; que lo dejó por motivos de salud. Es su 2do crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas en las fechas señaladas en el cronograma, de esa manera accede a posteriores créditos en adelante. Con el crédito, podrá realizar un viaje a la frontera del ecuador, donde  se halla su hijo, a quien extraña mucho, ya que hace un año se fue a servir al país.
texts.en:
Hilda is 53 years old.  She lives in her own home with two of her four children.  Her husband is in the military and lives in another province.  She visits him very frequently.

For many years, Hilda's business has been making clothes for the military.  Her husband, who is a soldier, has been a great support during all this time.  since, through him, his work colleagues make orders with Hilda for her to make clothes for them wholesale such as: berets, socks, underwear and other clothes.  This makes Hilda very happy.  What she most likes about her work is that she can do it in the comfort of her own home and it is also very profitable.  When she doesn't have a lot of work, Hilda travels to the country's interior to visit her husband and also to visit her son who is also a soldier and in another province.  In the future, she is planning to re-start her dressmaking business that she stopped because of her health.

This is Hilda's second loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  In this way, she will be able to access further loans in the future.  Hilda will use her loan to make a journey to the Ecuadoran border where her son is stationed.  She misses him a lot because he went off to serve his country a year ago.

loans.use: To travel to Ecuador to visit her son who is a soldier

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 40 years old, married, and supports her family with a tailoring business. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. Evangeline has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 60,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Evangeline is borrowing 8,000 PHP so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Evangeline hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for tailoring

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Godfrey has a bar, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks such as beer and sodas for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks (such as beer and sodas) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge es una persona muy seria y respetuosa el cual esta casado con la Sra. Rosa Elena, desean el préstamo por que quiere poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa el cual  atendería  personalmente   su   esposa  ya  que  por  el momento ella  no  se  encuentra  trabajando este   proyecto  representa  una  manera  de  salir  adelante obteniendo  mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is a very serious and respectful man.  He is married to Rosa Elena, and they want a loan because they would like to put a grocery store in their home.  His wife will attend the store personally, since right now she doesn't have a job.  This project represents a way for them to get ahead and earn more money.

loans.use: to invest in a grocery store

loans.name: Mrs. Poch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people are making up this village bank loan.  They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living.   Mrs. Poch was selected by the other members to be the village bank president.  

Mrs. Poch was born in 1975.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sok Hak, is a truck driver who receives a small salary to support his family.  

In order to improve her family living, Mrs. Poch wants to start a new business.  To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy some piglets to breed.  With the rest of the loan she will install sewers for use in her home. 

Mrs. Poch is a mother of four children, one of whom works as a driver, and the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
Dionita is a 69-year-old married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 47 years old and is already married.

Dionita said she has been raising pigs for 49 years. She also helps her husband grow rice at their farm. Dionita sells the pigs and rice at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and farm fertilizer.

In the future, Dionita plans to expand her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and farm fertilizer

loans.name: Teccia

texts.es:
Teccia forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Penco. 
Ella se dedica a vender artículos de confitería, tabaquería y heladería en un bazar, éste local lo arrienda en el centro de la ciudad de Concepción. Teccia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 7 años. Sin embargo las ventas en general han disminuido, lo que es desfavorable para su negocio, en la actualidad vende sus productos sólo para comprar mercadería diariamente.
Su mercadería la compra directamente a proveedores, supermercados mayoristas y distribuidoras.
Con el préstamo comprará helados, cigarrillos y mercadería de confitería. 
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer su bazar de mercadería, sin embargo para concretar éste proyecto es necesario contar con mayores ingresos para poder invertir.  
Teccia vive junto a unas tías y su hermana mayor. Ella educó a sus sobrinos, ya que su hermana se cambió de domicilio.
Su sueño es viajar y conocer el extranjero (ciudades y países fuera de Chile).
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son para ayudar a sus sobrinos socioeconómicamente.
Teccia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y apoyo otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, además a través de las reuniones, ha conocido personas muy agradables y ha logrado compartir experiencias. Respecto a los cursos impartidos en cada reunión ha reforzado sus conocimientos en ventas lo que ha logrado integrar en la gestión y operación de su negocio de manera favorable.
Penco es una comuna cercana a la ciudad de Concepción, al sur de Chile, región del Bíobío. Su nombre  viene del mapudungun y significa "agua de peumo". Es una de las comunas con mayor cantidad de habitantes en la región. Cuenta con centros industriales y un puerto.
texts.en:
Teccia is a member of the communal bank named "Newen" in the city of Penco. 

She sells pastries, tobacco products, and ice cream from a store. She rents this store and it is located in the downtown area of the city of Concepcion. Teccia has been in this business for 7 years. Her sales in general have declined and it is a challenge for her business. The profit she earns from the sale of her products is only enough to purchase her daily merchandise.

She purchases her merchandise directly from providers, wholesale markets and distributors. With this loan she will purchase ice cream, cigarettes, and pastry products. Her goal for her business is to supply her store with merchandise. But in order to meet her objective she needs to have greater income with which to reinvest.

Teccia lives with one of her aunts and her eldest sister. She sent her nieces and nephews to school when her sister changed address. 

Her dream is to travel and to see other countries (cities and countries outside of Chile). 

Her motivation to keep up her business rests on helping her nieces and nephews socio-economically. Teccia is very happy and very thankful for the loan and for the support granted to her by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner). She has also gotten to know very friend people through the meetings and she has been able to share experiences. With respect to the training provided at each meeting it has helped her reinforce her knowledge of sales. She has managed to successfully integrate this knowledge into the management and operation of her business. 

Penco is a nearby community to the city of Concepcion in southern Chile, in the region of Biobio. The name comes from the Mapudungun language, meaning "Peumo water". (Peumo is a tree native to Chile). It is one of the largest communities in the region, having industrial centers and a sea port.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, cigarettes, and pastry products.

loans.name: Felisardo

texts.en:
Felisardo is 52 years old and married with three adult children. He is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. To make a living, Felisardo owns and operates a specialized retail store. His main source of income comes from buying and selling bananas and firewood in the local community. Felisardo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Felisardo joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional bananas and firewood. This is the first loan that Felisardo has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve and expand his business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and firewood

loans.name: Semion

texts.es: Semion tiene 25 años, vive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años en casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez ha desarrollado las habilidades para desempeñarse como un buen agricultor y hoy que tiene una familia recién formada, por lo que siente la responsabilidad de sostener su hogar como padre de familia. Por ello tiene terrenos que le fue heredado, ahí siembra papa. Del mismo modo, también cría 20 carneros  2 vacas  y 4 cerdos que tiene en su establo y del que son vendidos de manera periódica y de acuerdo a sus necesidades económicas mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha. En esta actividad su esposa es quien más la apoya y ambos tienen el anhelo de tener su propia casa  con buena infraestructura para dar una mejor calidad de vidad para su familia. Este será su crédito número 3 con MFP, manifiesta que le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque  tiene una oportunidad de crecimiento para su actividad agrícola. Además renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y en el pago de la preparación de terreno con yunta para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Semion is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and their 3 year-old daughter in his parents’ house. Since he was a boy, he has developed his abilities as a good farmer. Now he has a family and he feels the responsibility of providing for his household as a father and husband. 

He has land that he inherited and he cultivates potatoes there. He is also raising 20 rams [sheep], 2 cows, and 4 pigs in his stable. He sells them periodically, according to his economic needs, while awaiting the harvest. His wife is the person who helps him the most and both want to have their own house with good infrastructure, so they can give the best quality of life to their family. 

This will be his 3rd loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He says he likes working with his communal bank because he has the opportunity to grow his agricultural business. He also renews his promise to be punctual in his repayments. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer and also pay to prepare his land with a team of oxen before he plants his next crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire laborers to help him prepare his land for the next planting.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 55 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.

Editha has a business selling different snacks. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. Editha has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and transport. 
 
With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to start a charcoal selling business, purchasing sacks of charcoal and selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to urban areas for sale. He dreams of expanding and establishing rental houses in the future. Nelson decided to join Yehu to access loan to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Génesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis lo conforman  la señora Juana del Rosario de 49 años, don José Armando de 48 años y don  Juan Manuel de 30 años. Ellos se dedican al comercio de Cortez de telas las cuales vende de manera ambulante.
 
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Juana quien en 1987 inicio a comercializar de manera ambulante recortes de tela. El sueño de ella es tener una tienda de textiles e invertirá el crédito en la comprar de telas para el negocio.
texts.en:
The Génesis group is made up of Mrs Juana del Rosario, age 49, Mr. José Armando, age 48, and Mr. Juan Manuel, age 30. They are merchants of cuts of fabric which they sell in street markets.

The group coordinator is Mrs. Juana, who started selling cuts of fabric in street markets in 1987. Her dream is to have a textile store, and she will invest this loan in the purchase of fabrics for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is a married man with three children, one boy and two girls. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past year, Hesbon has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His customers are neighbors and passersby. The high cost of repairing his motorcycle is a major challenge for him.

Hesbon decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With a 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han (in the photo) is 51 years old and her husband, Channy, is 52 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have six children--two sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes; two are garment factory workers and another one stays at home.  
  
Han and her husband are farmers. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 46 years old and lives in the village of Gundaway Cabarroguis, Quirino. She is married with three children. She is business-minded woman because she has been engaged in two businesses,  fish selling and running a grocery store.

Rita has a retail shop that sells a variety of fresh fish. She has had this business for two years while she has had her grocery store for four years. According to her, she is able to earn P5,000 monthly with her fish selling and P3,000 from her grocery store.  She is requesting a loan amount of P50,000 to buy different kinds of fish such as tilapia, milk fish and mackerel to sell in the market.

She hopes that she can increase her profit so that she can give her children a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish such as milk fish, mackerel, and tilapia for fish-selling business.

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula is 54 years old and married. She has a carenderia (eatery) located in Cortez, Bohol. She cooks viands that she sells to the people in her community. Romula works hard to support her family.

Romula is requesting a loan to buy raw ingredients like meat, vegetables, oil and vinegar. Romula hopes to expand her eatery in the future.

loans.use: buy meat, vegetables, oil and vinegar

loans.name: Mrashi

texts.en:
Mrashi is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling Khangas and handbags. She sells at retail to her neighbors and passersby. Mrashi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major challenge is to expand her business to meet her customer’s needs.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas and handbags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khanga’s and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 26-year-old single man from Gaza. He would like to have a farm to raise chickens. Sami hopes that throughout the duration of this loan he will be able to buy food for the animals and refrigerators. He hopes that this will increase his income and he will be able to support himself and his family.

loans.use: buy food for the animals and refrigerators

loans.name: Mahudekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDEKON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin.C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Gbènangnon.Le couple à trois enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge.Célestine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Célestine mène comme activité la vente des bijoux et du pâté à son domicile et de façon ambulante. A côté de cette activité Célestine vend des fournitures scolaires.Célestine mène cette activité il y a une dizaine d'année. Célestine s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDEKON un deuxième crédit.Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MAHUDEKON group has three members who are friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time the group has requested a loan from ALIDE in order to improve their businesses. The group leader, whose name is Célestine has her hand raised in the photo. Célestine is 33 years old and lives in Benin. Célestine is married to a carpenter named, Gbènangnon. The couple has three children which are still in their care and attend school. Célestine didn't complete much schooling. In order to properly care for her children, Célestine manages her business of selling pâté from her house and by going door to door. As a side business, she also sells school supplies. Célestine has been in business for about 10 years. Célestine buys her products at a market in Benin. In an effort to better satisfy her clients and increase sales, Célestine is requesting along with the other members of MAHUDEKON, a second round of financing. The first loan was properly reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and wheat flour

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La señora Irene tiene 64 años vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 15 años ella sola, es pensionada desde hace 3 años y su pensión es su única fuente de ingresos para solventar su necesidades básicas de alimentación, calzado y vestido, pago de servicios. La señora Irene cuenta con servicio medico, pero ella requiere hacerse unos estudios mas especializados que ya tiene programados pero para dentro de 2 meses, ella sabe que por su edad esta expuesta a contraer enfermedades causadas por la edad con mucha facilidad es por ello que la Sra. Irene requiere saber cuanto antes el resultado de esos estudios ya que no se quiere ver enferma a futuro con una enfermedad que si se detectaría a tiempo no le trajera consecuencias y es por ello que solicita el apoyo para realizarse esos estudios médicos
texts.en: Señora Irene is 64 years old and has lived in a social welfare house for the last 15 years. She has been pensioned for 3 years and her pension is her only source of income with which to pay for her basic necessities of food, footwear and clothing, utility payments. Señora Irene is covered for medical services, but requires more specialized tests to be performed. She already has tan appointment for hese tests but not for 2 more months. She knows that due to her age she is much more susceptible to age-related diseases which is why Sra. Irene needs to know as soon as possible the results of these tests as she doesn't want to fall ill in the future with an illness that if detected in time could be avoided. This is why she is asking for help to have the medical tests done.

loans.use: to have a medical checkup.

loans.name: Milton Raul

texts.es:
Milton Raúl tiene 40 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Milton se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: los intermediarios y vías de comunicación. El sueño es que los hijos se eduquen y sean profesionales.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  practicar el deporte en especial el boley y es muy respetuoso.
texts.en:
Milton Raúl, age 40, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children, ages 15 and 10, in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.
