The San José Communal Bank is made up of 21 members located in the parish of San José del Tambo, 60 minutes from the office. This communal bank serves farmers who raise short cycle crops such as corn, bananas, and cacao.

Milton is a farmer. He plants corn, bananas, and cacao. Purchases and sales are carried out in San José del Tambo Parish.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase seed and agricultural materials such as urea, herbicide, and fertilizer in order to maintain his crops in good condition. The loan will be a big help because he will be able to improve his quality of life and his products. He faces frequent challenges including middlemen and poor roads. His dream is that his children get an education and become professionals. In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball. He is highly respected.

loans.use: to purchase seed and agricultural materials such as urea herbicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with nine children. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama is a 45-year-old married woman with six children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling bread in Kator South Sudan for twenty year.

Rahama requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Jose Rodrigo

texts.es:
Desde hace ya 28 años José Rodrigo e instructor de conducción, el con este trabajo de ha conseguido el sustento para su familia, además de poder darles a sus hijos estudio.

El para poder seguir trabajando necesita renovar su matrícula de instructor y de esta manera continuar construyendo el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Rodrigo has been a driving instructor for 28 years.  With this work he has supported his family in addition to being able to give his children an education.

In order to be able to continue working he needs to renew his instructor’s license.  That way he can continue building his children’s future.

loans.use: to renew his instructor's license.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (in the photo), age 32, is a garment worker and her husband, Limy, age 36, has full-time employment. They have been married since 2007 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. Two attend school and another one is just baby. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phalla is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to make new windows and a stairway in her house because they are old. She will use another part of the loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband.  The motorcycle will help her husband to get work because the old motorbike breaks very often, is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes.

loans.use: To make new windows and stairway of her house and buy a new motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Irres

texts.en:
Irres is married with 2 children. She is 25 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Irres plan to earn a living by starting a new business buying and selling rice. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Irres joined PMPC this year (2011). In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is 48 years of age, married and blessed with ninth children. She is involved in the livestock business, particularly raising hogs. Her net income, every three months, is 7,000 per hog. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional livestock feed for her hogs. She would like to continue receiving loans to grow her business, and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock feed for her hogs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora, esto le ha permitido superar grandes dificultades en su vida. Maria se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida. Maria ha trabajado gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy temprana edad acudía junto a su madre al trabajo y posteriormente le dieron empleo en el mismo restaurante que trabajaba su madre; Maria ha trabajado en restaurantes, hoteles y cafeterías y gracias a esto aprendió de su madre el valor del trabajo. Maria actualmente ha montado su propia tienda donde ofrece principalmente snack, dulces y gaseosas, pues su tienda la tiene ubicada dentro de una escuela y sus principales clientes son los alumnos de la escuela. Debido a que montó su tienda con muy bajo capital, Maria no pudo surtir con gran variedad de productos su tienda, es por esto que ahora Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de snack, dulces y gaseosas para surtir mejor su negocio y hacerlo más atractivo para sus clientes.

Maria espera que de esta manera su negocio le siga generando buenos ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a su esposo y sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Maria, además de esto, espera que sus hijos tengan el acceso a una educación universitaria donde se puedan preparar para un empleo que sea bien remunerado.

loans.use: Compra de snack, dulces y gaseosas para surtir mejor su negocio y hacerlo más atractivo para sus clientes.

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is 35 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She runs a chemist and has been in business for the past three years. She also relies on her husbands income. She used her previous loan to stock more medicine. Her business did well and she repaid her loan. She is a very hard working lady. 
She requires a loan of 63,585 KES to pay school fees. She hopes to open up other chemists.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 30 years old and runs a school. She gets additional income from sewing uniforms. She has three children, ages seven, four and two of which only two attend school.

She dreams of owning a good residential house, despite the challenge of delayed salary payments.

She is acquiring credit to buy four sewing machines.

Violet is in the photo with the pupils she teaches.

loans.use: to buy four sewing machines.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy doormats and other products to resell in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Roxanne hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better future. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To doormats and other products to resell in her business.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 33 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 8 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to fertilizers and buy cows for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca continua dedicándose  a su trabajo de venta de aretes y pulseras, este trabajo lo realiza desde las 9 de la mañana  hasta las 6 de la tarde, ya que es la única forma de salir adelante con su familia. La socia desea ampliar su negocio vendiendo más bisuterías  y demás adornos personales.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "santo Domingo" y necesita el crédito para ampliar su mercadería.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar aretes y collares.
La socia está contenta y satisfecha con el crédito otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA  y se compromete  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.

loans.use: para comprar aretes y collares.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en: A 44-year-old woman, Mrs Fidelia A. lives in an urban area in Edo State of Nigeria.  She is married with two children.  She spent 6 months learning her trade, after which she opened her own store in 1985.  She says the loan will make it possible for her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pascual would like to get fertilizer and pesticides for his rice, maize and bean faram and improve his home for his six children

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
My name is Julio P.. I sell spare parts for bicycles. I've owned my business for 4 years. It is doing very well: bicycles is a transport mode that is oftenused by our people because it is cheap and efficient. At this moment, I need to increase m y inventory because it is high season.

With the profits, I want to remodel my business, feed my three children, and -most importantly- pay for private school for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Julio P. me dedico a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, en el cual me va muy bien ya que la bicicleta es un medio de transporte muy utilizado por nuestra gente ya que es muy comodo y eficiente. en estos momentos necesito incrementar mi inventario porque es una epoca de muchas ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, alimentar mis tres hijos y lo mas importante pagarles un estudio privado.

loans.use: To buy chains, oil, tires, pedals, repair kits, glue, handle bars, tensors, keys, reflectos, screws, and bolts.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina L. is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the neighborhood of Mahotas, in Maputo. She sells various food products from a bungalow in her home.

She joined this credit program in January 2006. Cristina took part in the group loan of 1,800MT, now she is entering the 5th stage of the program and plans on borrowing 8,000MT - payable back in 6 months - in order to increase the stock in her shop. Cristina has experienced gradual positive changes in her business and plans on investing the full value of the loan into her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina L. tem 35 anos de Idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e 5 filhos no Bairro das Mahotas em Maputo. Tem uma barraca na sua residência onde vende diversos produtos alimentares.

Entrou para o Programa em Janeiro de 2006, tendo começado com um empréstimo grupal de 1.800 MT.Vai para o 5º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 8.000 MT pagaveis em 6 meses para reforçar o stock . Tem verificado melhoria gradual no seu negócio uma vez que todo o valor dos empréstimos é investido no mesmo.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
I am Nazia H. from Multan and I have been living here since my birth. I was married five years ago and am the mother of one boy and one girl. I completed 8th grade and I hope my children will further complete their education.

My husband drives a rented rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi) whereas I stay at home and knit. I wish to buy wool bale from Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan) where it is relatively cheaper to expand my business. Therefore, I am requesting a loan of 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool for business expansion

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es:
Martha Francisca has three children for whom she and her husband work very hard, so they become good men. Martha's husband works as a bricklayer so his income is not very good. That is why Francisca decided to start selling things to be able to make money and help with the household expenses. Martha started selling used clothing among her neighbors and friends, and she is now trying to sell new clothing, since that is a more profitable market. So, she goes to Villa Hidalgo to get new clothes so she can have more to offer her clients.

However, the clothing she has now is for the Fall season, and she would like to buy more clothes to have more variety to show her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $550, which she has decided she will pay in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more used and new clothing to offer her clients. With your help, Martha and her husband will be able to support their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Francisca tiene tres hijos por quienes su esposo y ella trabajan muy duro para que sean hombres D. bien. El esposo D. Martha trabaja como obrero así que sus ingresos no son muy buenos. Y es por eso que Francisca decidió comenzar a vender cosas para poder sacar dinero y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Martha comenzó por vender ropa usada entre sus vecinas y amigos, y hoy está tratando D. vender ropa nueva, puesto que en esta se encuentra mucha ganancia, y se va a Villa Hidalgo a surtir D. ropa nueva para poder tener algo qué ofrecerle a sus clientas.

Sin embargo la ropa que tiene ya es la que le queda D. la temporada D. Otoño, y desea comprar más ropa para poder tener surtido que mostrarle a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito D. US $550 que está propuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses, y con este dinero podrá comprar más ropa usada y nueva para ofrecerle a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda Martha sacará adelante a sus tres hijos junto con su esposo.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for the Winter season.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or brands in the world. It’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of bar selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. The hot weather makes these drinks all the more appealing. It is a very cheap marketing tool!

Fatuma K. is one of many drink-sellers in Dar es Salaam. She requires a loan of $450 to purchase additional stock in bulk. Fatuma is married to her husband, Fatel, with whom she has one daughter, Rahuma, aged 5. She and her husband are also responsible for the care of Fatuma’s two younger sisters.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not credit-worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement."

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of soda in bulk.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando sells milk and is also starting to sell pork. He learned this business from his father who has a lot of experience in this area. The whole family is dedicated to this business and it's their main source of income. As the oldest brother in the family, Armando helps with the household costs. They live in the community of Ninachiri - Laja, located about an hour and a half from La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase the quantity of milk they can sell to the dairy factory. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation shows that he is qualified to receive the credit.

Armando es productor de leche y se esta iniciando como comerciante de carne de cerdo; estas actividades han sido transmitidas por su padre, quien tiene bastante experiencia en los rubros. Actualmente toda la familia se dedica a estas actividades y es su principal fuente de ingreso. Armando es el hermano mayor de la familia y colabora con los gastos del hogar, vive en la Comunidad de Ninachiri – Laja (Ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera de mediana calidad y forraje, para incrementar la cantidad de leche que vende a PIL Andina (fábrica de productos lácteos). Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación que se realizó permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY A DAIRY COW FOR THE FAMILY BUSINESS

loans.name: Sles

texts.en:
Mr. Sles L. lives on the way to Ankor Wat, approximately eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He was married in 1979 to Yeb Maismas. They have five sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. His wife and the other children work in the family fishing business. Mr. L. has been fishing in the Mekong River since he was a young boy. It’s a skill he learned from his parents.

Mr. L. is requesting his second loan in the amount of $800. He will use this money to purchasing fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: U. Mastura was born in 1972 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is married with 3 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007.  Like many rural women, she is engaged in the business of raising and selling livestock.  Having years of experience in raising livestock, she is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of $625 with a 7 month term to purchase a pedigree milk cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow for milking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and other goods to keep producing food for a small cafe.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana K. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has three children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Juliana wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
NUEVO RENACER está conformado por 12 personas D. los cuales 10 son mujeres y 2 son varones. La sra. Adelaida es la presidenta del grupo; tiene una hija, ella es profesora en dos colegios. La tesorera Sra. Elizabeth, tiene dos hijos D. 10 y 13 años D. edad, ella confecciona chamarras y venD. telas en Desaguadero y Potosí. La secretaria Srta. Claudia Daniela, realiza ajuares D. bebe y pinturas en tela. Las señoras arguyen que no sabían que en nuestra institución existía la banca comunal, ellas pensaban que solo se otorgaban créditos individuales, pero ahora que ya conformaron su grupo y se les otorgo el crédito, ellas están ahora con muchas ganas D. seguir trabajando en la institución. Juntas y unidas, se comprometen a ser solidarias y responsables, para así poder pasar al segundo ciclo y sacar un poco más D. crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Nuevo Renacer is maD. up of 12 people of whom 10 are women and 2 are men. The president Adelaida is a professor in two highschools and has a daughter. The treasurer, Elizabeth, sells jackets and fabrics in Desaguadero and Potosi; she also has two sons who are 10 and 13 years old. The secretary Claudia Daniela makes baby clothes and painting on canvas. Previously the ladies did not know that their was a communal bank; they thought that it was only possible to obtain individual loans, but now that they have formed their group and have asked for credit, they are very keen to continue working with the organization. United, they promise to be caring and responsible so that they can move onto the second cycle and get a little more credit.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias (Women In Solidarity) Group 3

texts.en:
Yameris M. is the single mother of a two-year-old baby girl. She has a small business killing and selling chickens in her community. She has already successfully repaid two loans to Esperanza International and is now applying for her third. With the loan money she will be able to buy more chickens to raise and then sell so that she can better her life.

Yameris has hopes of becoming a better person and she really wants to “ser alguien en la vida,” (to be someone in life). She dreams of being able to provide well for her daughter and of sending her all the way through college so that she can have a professional career. She also dreams of one day owning her very own little house. With your help and her continued loans, Yameris is on her way to making her dreams come true.

Note: This is a group loan for 5 people.

loans.use: to raise, kill and sell more chickens

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Hồng 33 tuổi, sống ở vùng nông thôn nên nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, những lúc nhàn rỗi chồng chị đi làm xây dựng bình quân 80.000đ/ ngày. Năm 2002 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn, vòng vốn đầu tiện chị vay 2.000.000đ chị đã đầu tư mua lợn giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi, qua 1 vòng vốn gia đình chị thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi có hiệu quả nên các vòng vốn sau chị đã vay mức vốn cao mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi lợn và kết hợp nuôi gà. Hiện gia đình chị đang nuôi 8 con lợn và 300 con gà mỗi lần gia đình chị xuất ra thị trường cho thu nhập 30.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 8.000.000đ đầu tư mua trâu phục vu nông nghiêp.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi H., aged 33, joined TYM Fund in 2002. As her family lives in the countryside, their main occupation is farming. Her husband is also a construction worker in his spare time, making 80000 VND per day. In the first round of loan, Mrs. H. borrowed 2.000.000 VND to buy pigs and food to raise them, which she realized is relatively profitable. Besides pigs, Mrs. H. also raises chickens. She now has 8 pigs and 300 chickens. She is able to make 3.000.000 VND by selling those poultries to the market each season. In the next round of loan, Mrs. H. would like to borrow 8.000.000 VND ($500) to buy buffalos for agricultural activities. Her family’s monthly income is 5.000.000 VND

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Luu Thi C., aged 52, has 3 children, two of whom are grown-up. Before joining TYM, her family caught fish in the sea. This business was not stable as it depended a lot on the weather. Therefore, in 2005 she joined TYM Fund and switched to trading. Everyday her husband goes to agents to buy goods for her, then she sells these goods at some markets. With reasonable price and enthusiastic service, her business is going on well and brings about a stable income of VND 3 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest more in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 38 años, está separada de su pareja y vive con sus hijos; Paulo de 16, Mariela de 15 y Carmen de 13.  Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza en la tienda que puso en su casa, desde hace ya 9 años.  Empieza su trabajo a las 8 de la mañana, después de haber alistado a sus hijos para enviarlos al colegio y cierra a las  8 de la noche.  Lo que le gusta a Nancy de su trabajo es que puede trabajar y atender a sus hijos al mismo tiempo, ya que su tienda está en su propia casa, lo difícil, es lo cansado que es atender todo el día sin poder salir.  Nancy trabaja para forjarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.   Con el dinero que se le facilite, podrá comprar más productos de belleza para mejorar su negocio y en el futuro tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 38 year old woman who is separated from her husband, and who lives with her children - Paulo who is 16, Mariela who is 15, and Carmen who is 13. She has worked selling beauty products from her home for the last 9 years. She begins work at 8:00 in the morning after sending her children off to school. She closes at 8:00 at night. Nancy's favorite thing about her job is that she can work and take care of her children at the same time, since her shop is in her home. What is most difficult for her is the fact that she gets so tired from minding the store all day without being able to leave. Nancy works to obtain a better future for her children. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products to improve her business and in the future open a large boutique.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of beauty products for her store.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol T., 51, and her husband, Mr. T. Kheav, 59, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children were married and live outside the family home and other two children live under their custody.

Thol and her husband have been farming for twenty eight years. They grow tomatoes and papayas in their farmland near the house to sell to the middle man, who takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. The couple is in the process of building their new home but lacks the money to finish some parts of the house.

Thol is requesting a loan of $1000 to add in her own money to finish the house.

loans.use: To add in her own money to finish the house.

loans.name: Meta

texts.en:
Meta lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and lives with her nuclear family. She has been involved in embroidery for more than 5 years. She got her first loan and spend it on embroidery. Now she wants to take her second loan.

She is applying for her second individual loan of 42000 Afghans with a term of 10 months to buy a new machine and to become more effective in her business and help her family better. She wants to say: "With the first loan I was able to continue my business; with the second I am sure that I will improve it even more than with the help of the first loan."

Meta is happy with this loan process. She wants to say: "This loan really helped me a lot and I have plans to continue my partnership with Ariana so as to have a big embroidery business in future to help my family better and make a better income in future."

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Chhunmeng

texts.en: Mr. Chhunmeng M. was born in 1961, and he now lives in Choeung Wat village in Kampong Cham province. He is a nurse at the Provincial Health Care Center. His wife, Mrs. Yun Kim Yan, sells medicines. Since Mr. Chhunmeng M. has a lot of patients, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase more medicines to sell them for an income. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is the father of three children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the other attends the local school. His wife is shown on the right of picture.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en:
I. Maksudjon has dedicated much effort to the business of agriculture for the past ten years. He has 0.8 of a hectare of land where he produces a variety of vegetables and a number of apricot trees. He also plants wheat and gets a rich harvest every year.The income from his land has allowed him to arrange the weddings of his two children. Currently Maksudjon is asking for a loan of $725 USD to purchase fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare his land for the upcoming season. Maksudjon is very confident that he will be awarded this loan and assures you that the money will be repaid on time, without default. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fuels, lubricants, mineral fertilizer and saplings

loans.name: Eak

texts.en: Eak S., 31, is married and lives with her husband in the Bati district, Takeo province. Currently, she is pregnant and works at a grocery store, earning around US$2 of profit every day. Her husband stays at home and helps her sell grocery products. Mrs. Eak S. is asking for a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more stuff to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega la señora Petrona E. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos a los que debe de mantener.

Es importante destacar que ella ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para la compra de sus verduras y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinadega, Mrs. Petrona E. works hard selling vegetables. She sells them herself with the goal of supporting her family. She has two small children whom she supports. It is important to note that she has been able to make progress thanks to the loans provided by Ceprodel. Today she is requesting a new loan to purchase vegetables and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel R. is a pig grower. She is 35 years old and has three children. She has a sow and piglets. She has invested a lot in hog raising because she finds it a profitable business. Her husband, Benjamin R., is a farmer. While waiting for the pigs to grow, they also grow root vegetables in their backyard to help them sustain their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed. The loan will definitely increase the size of her business. In that way, she can better support her family and her children's educational needs.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and maintain their own business. CEVI provides their clients credit, training and insurance coverage to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Magna

texts.es: Magna vive sola, se dedica a la venta de granos y productos alimenticios que ella misma procesa con un simple molino o envía a moler para venderlos en las zonas más alejadas y rurales de su localidad. Los fines de semana viaja a la ciudad de Lima para vender estos mismos productos, este ritmo de trabajo lo tiene desde hace 13 años y durante este tiempo, su labor la llena de satisfacciones porque las ganancias suplen las necesidades que tiene para sostenerse. Su deseo es seguir trabajando para conseguir establecerse con una tienda de abarrotes y así descansar del esfuerzo físico de todos estos años. Es la cuarta vez que Magna está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy convencida de que es muy beneficioso el trabajo en equipo para desarrollarse, por lo que anima a sus demás compañeros de su banco comunal a unir los esfuerzos solidarios. El dinero que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de más granos, sacos de maíz, cebada, entre otros productos, para molerlos y prepararlos para la venta.
texts.en:
Magna lives alone. She makes a living selling grain and food products that she processes with a simple mill or sends to be ground; she then sells her products in the outermost, rural parts of her town. On weekends she travels to the city of Lima to sell her products. She has maintained this work schedule for 13 years now. Her work has given her much satisfaction over the years because her profits provide her with all that she needs to support herself. Magna’s wish is to keep working so that she can set up a grocery store and thus be able to rest after so many years of hard physical labor. This is the fourth time that Magna has requested a loan from Kiva partner MFP. She is convinced that teamwork is very helpful for development, and it is for this reason that she encourages the rest of her colleagues at the communal bank to work together. Magna will use the money she is requesting to invest in purchasing more grain--sacks of corn and barley, among other products--so that she can grind them and prepare them for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Lisset tiene 22 años, es soltera vive en su casa propia con su hermana, con quien se apoya mutuamente para salir adelante. Desde muy joven tuvo que dedicarse a diferentes labores para poder cubrir sus gastos, ya que al no poder tener una educación superior tuvo que ingeniárselas para lograr mantenerse, felizmente todo su arduo esfuerzo tuvo resultados, con sus ahorros logró montar una pequeña bodega en su casa lo cual le facilita las cosas porque es un trabajo que puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar. Pero no todo es tan fácil como parece, ya que ella atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 9 o 10 de la noche, si se queda hasta más tarde implicaría algunos riesgos, por los malandrines que salen a esas horas, es por eso que hasta ahora todo le ha ido muy bien. Lisset espera seguir progresando en su negocio al cual le pone todas las ganas, pues sabe que sólo trabajando mucho logrará todas sus metas. Lisset quiere que en el futuro su bodega se convierta en un gran bazar donde pueda ofertar diferentes cantidades de mercadería, y así hacer que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, para que pueda conformar una familia a la cual brindarle lo mejor. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y6 promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará gran cantidad de mercadería como gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, etc. para abastecer mejor su pequeño negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lisset is 22 years old, shares her own home with her sister, and together they strive to get ahead. From a very young age she had to dedicate herself to a variety of jobs in order to meet her basic needs because, due to the fact that she was unable to pursue higher education, she has had to use her own wits to get ahead. Happily, she has done well and she used her savings to set up a small grocery store which she operates out of her own home. But all is not as easy as it appears. She works from 6am until 9 or 10pm not risking to stay open any later due to the petty criminals that come out at night. So far, however, she has been able to succeed. Lisset hopes to continue doing well in her business because she realizes that it is only through hard work that she will be able to get ahead and reach her goals. Lisset would like to have a large warehouse in the future where she can sell a great variety of goods thereby increasing her profits allowing her to form a family that she can provide for. This is her first loan request from PRISMA Microfinancing and she vows to be punctual in her repayments. With the money she will purchase merchandise such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, candy, etc. to better stock her small store thereby bettering her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita L. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Gelita operates a family member's "sari-sari" (local variety) store.

Gelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase stock for sale. This loan will be the fifth taken out by Gelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for "sari-sari" store business

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Timoteo S. M. vive en la capital de El Salvador, Timoteo vive en casa propia con su esposa y un hijo. A pesar de ser un hombre de 60 años de edad don Timoteo manifiesta que con perseverancia y esfuerzo se logra salir adelante, y es así como lo hace el, hace tres años Timoteo monto una tienda ubicada en su casa, negocio que al día de ahora es  la principal fuente de ingresos económicos a la familia. Timoteo solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo de productos que hasta el momento el carece, pero son demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Timoteo S. M. lives in the capital of El Salvador with his wife and a son. In spite of being a 60-year-old man, Timoteo shows that with perseverance and effort it is possible to get ahead. And that is how he does it. Three years ago he set up a store located in his house, and currently it's the principle source of income for his family. Timoteo is seeking a loan because he wants to invest in his business by stocking it up with products he currently lacks, but which are requested by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up his business.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат – женщина 44 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды, а также мужского нижнего белья на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Ее муж работает разнорабочим, в свободное время помогает жене в ее бизнесе. Они старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Инобат закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она сама ездит выбирать товар. Инобат хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для закупки летнего товара.
texts.en:
Inobat is a 44-year old mother of two. She is married and has a high school diploma. She sells children's clothes and men's underwear at Favoron market in Gafurov. Inobat's husband works day jobs, and spends his free time helping Inobat. The couple works hard in order to provide for their family. Inobat travels to Istaravshan to purchase goods at the wholesale market. She knows that a good assortment of goods attracts more clients, and she would like to improve the variety of goods she sells. In order to offer more summer clothes at her stall, Inobat is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's summer clothes

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мавчуда – женщина которая кредитуется в организации несколько лет. Она берёт кредиты для расширения бизнеса продажи детской одежды. Привозит она из Истаравшана и Бишкека. Для завоза летних маек для мальчиков и шорт она подала заявку на повторный займ. Мавчуда на снимке на месте деятельности.
texts.en:
Mavchuda is a woman who has been borrowing through our organization for a number of years. She takes out loans so she can expand her children's clothing business. She gets her merchandise from Istaravshan and Bishkek. She is seeking an additional loan to buy shipments of boys' summer shirts and shorts. Mavchuda is pictured above at her workplace.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For children's footwear

loans.name: Aina

texts.en: Aina sells provisions and drinks in her house and she has been in this business for the past 7 years. Aina is focused on her business; she does not welcome any distractions when it comes to her business. She is 38 years old and married. Aina lives in Lagos State. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Enhsaihan G. is twenty-three years old and has a one-year-old daughter. She currently lives with her husband and her baby daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She owns a small barber shop, where she works as a hairdresser. Her husband is also a barber and works in his wife's barber shop. They operate their hair- cutting business in a small room that they rent on a monthly basis. Since the start, they have been quite successful with their business and their business capital has increased from 40,000 MNT to 120,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Enhsaihan dreams of having her own work place instead of renting expensive work space for her business. 
She requests a loan to purchase new clippers and other necessary tools for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase new clippers and other haircutting tools

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame vend uniquement des objets en plastique en bordure d’une grande ruelle du quartier Forever à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un cuisinier, et le couple a 05 enfants à sa charge. Malheureusement l’hôtel dans lequel travaillait le mari a été fermé ; le mari ayant perdu son emploi, cette dame a pris la décision en 1999 de vendre des objets plastiques pour compenser la perte financière dans le foyer. Elle se rend au Ghana pour faire ses provisions. Actuellement elle a une grande clientèle, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bonnes affaires. Elle est dans le besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 gobelets en plastique, 50 seaux en plastique, 50 assiettes en plastique et 100 paniers en plastique. Elle compte sur sa longue expérience pour vite rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This lady sells only plastic ware along a big alley in the Forever District in Lomé.  She is married to a cook, and the couple have five children to support.  Unfortunately, the hotel where her husband used to work was closed.  With her husband out of a job, this lady decided in 1999 to sell plastic ware out of her house in order to make up for the financial loss.  She goes to Ghana to stock up.  Currently she has a large customer base, which means business is good.  She needs to renew her stock;  this is why she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 plastic drinking cups, 50 plastic buckets, 50 plastic plates, and 100 plastic baskets.  She's counting on her lengthy experience to repay the loan quickly.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 35 years old and lives in the village of Cabisera 9-11 of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Jimmy who works as a furniture laborer in their village. Their eldest child is Leggie Boy, who is 17 years old. He did not pursue continuing his studies in college because he was not at all interested. Their youngest child is Gelvin, who is 16 years old and presently studying in high school. Levi wants both of them to finish their studies in college. She is trying to convince her eldest son to pursue his studies and she hopes that someday they will both have a complete education.

Levi is requesting a loan amounting to PHP11,000 to use as additional business capital in her tailoring business. She wants her business to expand and become more productive, in order to improve their standard of living. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so that she can generate more income. That would greatly benefit the education of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer J., 33, is in the bicycle rental business.  She hails from Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  Her husband, Bonifacio, age 36, works at a nearby factory.  They have two children who both attend a pre-school.

Jennifer rents out bicycles to customers, both adults and children.  She has been in this business for four years.  She sometimes has trouble when a customer runs away with a bicycle or returns a broken bicycle to her shop. However, she still likes her work very much because she gets to know a lot of people from different walks of life.  She earns close to $93 a month in net income.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007.  Now on her 7th loan cycle, Jennifer needs a loan of P14,000 for the continuity of her business.  She would buy spare parts for the repairs of her bicycles.   She is also helping her husband save for the renovation of their house.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her rental bicycles.

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en: Bumi sells kerosene at retail prices to her various customers within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and she is married with 5 children. Her husband is an electrician. She is a hard-working woman. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza B. is a 41 year old widow with two loving children, who study at the Day Care Center in their village. They are happily residing in the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, two kilometers away from the national highway.

Analiza manages a business selling AVON cosmetics products and apparel, earning a net monthly income of Php 1,500.00. Aside from that she also sells some rice cakes and vegetables in their village.

Analiza would like to request a loan amount of Php 5,000.00, to purchase more AVON products. She would like to increase her income to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more AVON products to sell

loans.name: Vandanduger

texts.en:
Vandanduger is 28 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old child in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His child is in daycare, and his wife is a teacher at a local secondary school.

Vandanduger operates a raw materials trading business in town. He began his business in 2007 after managing a consumer goods retail business for 7 years. When he began his raw material business, his working capital was 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD) and in just over two years operation, his working capital has grown to exceed 3,600,000 tugrugs (~2570 USD). In order to supplement his family’s income, Vandanduger operates a taxi service at night.

Vandanduger is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2500 USD) loan in order to purchase more quality raw materials for his business. He hopes to be able to provide his family with a comfortable life while providing his local market with quality raw materials.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more quality raw materials

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji has owned an internet cafe in his town since 2004. He’s 50 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are unemployed. Today, Naji is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more computer games and programs to attract more children and students and make a good profit.

loans.use: buy more computer games and programs

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene varios prestamos con fundación león 2000 el ha sido un excelente cliente que ha demostrado ser muy responsable pues cada financiamiento los invierte en su negocio. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos, hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que anteriormente su mama le había enseñado este medio de vida a pesar de que él se dedica a impartir clases como docente no logra sufragar sus gastos necesarios, es por esto que ha incursionado. En el destace de cerdo. El recurre a la institución para solicitar un préstamo e invertirlo en materia prima. Su sueño es mantener su negocio para que sea mar rentable.
texts.en:
Concepción has received several loans from Fundación León 2000. He has been an excellent client, showing that he is very responsible by investing each loan in his business.
He has worked as a pork butcher for over 15 years. His mother taught him this way of life. His work as a teacher does not pay all the bills so that’s why he got involved in butchering pork.
He is seeking a loan to purchase raw materials. He dreams of maintaining his business and making it more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos. Ella estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la venta de comida, a su vez a la compra y venta de golosinas y refrescos.

Benita nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella requiere un nuevo crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar arroz, fideos, galletas, dulces etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es trabajar mejor y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de préstamo y la rapidez de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Benita, 37, has been a member of the "Manuela Ramos" communal bank for 3 years. She lives in Santa Rosa district, El Collao province, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has 5 children. She finished elementary school and sells prepared meals as well as sweets and soft-drinks. Benita tells us that she used her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now needs funding in the amount of 1000 new soles to buy rice, pasta, cookies, candies, etc. Her dream for the future is to work more efficiently to help her business grow. What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease and speed in getting loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, cookies, candies, sugar.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina P. is from the village of P6, Brgy. 25 Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Melodina is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Melodina owns & operates a business venture selling food products like a variety of viands. She peddles this food in the local community. Melodina has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Melodina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. She decides to request a loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Melodina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: P6, Barangay 25, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client with a good repayment record. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa. She sells groceries and foodstuffs like beans, rice, melon, tomatoes and milk. Christiana hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell to increase her profits. Christiana is happily married with four children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old single mother of seven. Some of her children attend school. She owns a four-room house, where she lives with six people. Rose takes care of additional family members. Her family has no access to electricity or piped water, but they get three meals a day.

Rose doesn't incur any transportation costs in shopping for her business, as she buys from her place of work from delivery trucks. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose works seven days a week. She receives an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing price of bananas and the rainy season. The price of bananas increases due to transportation problems. The rainy season hinders her customers' ability to reach her, because she works in an open place. She has been in her business for ten years.

Rose's monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and medication. She has been with MCDT for five years, and they are servicing her tenth loan. Rose joined MCDT because it was easy to work with and near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Nolito A., a laborer, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been doing direct selling of popular brands of clothing and cosmetics for quite some time now.

Julieta has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a 12,000 Philippines peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy advance orders in her direct-selling business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also envisions a comfortably well-off future for herself and her children.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying advance orders for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Obama Group

texts.en:
Saraya Salum, 43, is married with three children, ages 22, 22 and 14. She has had a grocery store and hotel since 1984. She works from 8 a.m. to midnight and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $652.

This will be Saraya’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to improve the hotel and has repaid the loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to start selling water, juice and sodas at wholesale prices. 

Saraya will share this loan with her loan group, Obama, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Saraya is in front in a black and white dress.

loans.use: to start selling water, juice and sodas at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of three dependent children.

Nada has run a tailoring business from her home for over twenty-five years and she has been able, during this period, to support her husband with the family income. She offers all sewing services in addition to a clothes repair service.

Nada has already taken advantage of her first loan from Kiva and she's very pleased with her decision to take a loan from Ameen because she was able to expand her business. She's a very punctual client who has repaid her loan on time.

Today, Nada is asking for a new loan of $1,200 to buy more textiles to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more textiles

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 46, spends a lot of time managing her rice-farming business. She enjoys working on the farm because it provides for the food, shelter and clothing of her family. She is married to Wilfredo and they have five children.  

She would like to continue working on her farm for the sustenance of her family but is limited as to financing the business. That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc.: to be able to take a loan intended for her business. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, enough to buy materials and supplies she needs for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gaston Koffi

texts.fr: ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de CD, clé USB et divers consommables informatiques. il s'approvisionne à Lomé, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il veut gonfler son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 600 CD-ROM, 400 CD (DVD) et 35 clés USB. il est célibataire et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'il subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This man makes his living by selling CD’s, flash drives and other computer related items. He gets his supplies in Lomé and has a very diverse clientele. He wants to increase his stock of merchandise which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase 600 CD-ROMs, 400 CD’s and DVD’s and 35 flash drives. He is single and with the revenue from his business he is able to make ends meet.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy CD's DVD's and flash drives

loans.name: Luis Rey

texts.es:
Luis Rey de 50 años de edad, vive en la Cmca. Carquita del municipio de La Libertad, es casado con la Sra. Margarita Rocha con quien procreo 4 hijos, el mayor de 24 años, otro de 22, 16 y 8 años, los mayores le ayudan a trabajar y el menor estudia primaria. 

Don Luis desde hace 20 años es pequeño ganadero del municipio de La Libertad, Chontales, donde tiene su pequeño inventario de ganado, sin embargo, esta luchando para aumentarlo por lo que esta solicitando su 4to credito para compar terneros y desarrollarlos y engordarlos para posteriormente venderlos a un buen precio que le permita obtener ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar.  Ademas de la actividad ganadera tambien tiene un camion que funciona como transporte colectivo que le genera ingresos adicionales para su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es tener la oportunidad de contar con recursos que le permitan darle a sus hijos estudios para que sean hombres de bien, y dejarles un buen patrimonio para que puedan mantenerse con un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Rey is 50 years old, lives in la Carquita district in the municipality of La Libertad and is married to Mrs. Margarita Rocha with whom he has 4 children, the oldest is 24 years old, the others are 22, 16, and 8 years old. The three eldest children help him with work while the youngest is in primary school. For 20 years Luis has been a cattle herder in the municipality of La Libertad, Chontales, where he has a small inventory of cattle. He is trying to increase the size of his herd and this is why he is asking for his fourth loan to buy calves, raise them, and fatten them so that he can sell them at a good price that allows him to earn profits which help him improve his family’s living conditions. In addition to his work as a cattle herder, he also has a truck that he uses as collective transport which allows him to earn additional money for his family. His biggest dream is to have the resources that allow him to teach his children to be good men and leave them a good inheritance that they can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves to raise for sale

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en: Sinath S. and her husband live in Preal village, in Takeo province.  She sells beef at a local market. Her husband is a farmer and construction worker.  Her husband’s worker place is far away from their home.  Sinath is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike.  They have two children; one attends a local public school and the youngest is one year old.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en: Victo is a single mother of school-aged children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Nakawa market, one of the busiest markets in Nakawa division, selling second-hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for fours years. Besides this clothing business, she also sells piped water. Victo sells to all kinds of people, on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenge is the rainy season because she works in an open place. She aspires to grow her business and to start selling wholesale only. She also hopes to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by getting additional capital. Victo resides in and rents a two-room house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food, school fees, and rent.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Orlando Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Orlando, el vive en zona radial 26 por el Barrio 24 de Septiembre, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuentan con casa propia en la cual vive con tres de sus hijos que dos ya son estudiantes universitarios y el ultimo se encuentra en el colegio, su esposa solo se dedica a labores del hogar, llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de un compañero de trabajo que al igual que el son buenos clientes, don Orlando tiene un microbus propio del cual trabaja haciendo servicios transporte urbano el cual tiene ingresos para sustento de su familia y cubrir su obligaciones financieras, el prestamo solicitado sera destinado para la compra de una caja de cambio para su micro, "estoy muy agradecido con su institucion por la confianza que depositada en mi persona" fueron las palabras del cliente.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando lives in the neighborhood Radial 26, near the neighborhood 24 de Septiembre in the city of Santa Cruz. They have their own home where they live with their 3 children, 2 that are university students and the last is in High School. His wife works only in the home. He came to our offices with a reference from a coworker, who like him is a good client. Mr. Orlando has his own mini-bus that he uses to perform urban transport services, which is how he has an income to support his family and pay for their financial obligations. The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a change box for the mini-bus. “I am very grateful to this institution for the confidence they have placed in me” were the words of the client.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a change box for the mini-bus

loans.name: Ronaliza

texts.en:
Ronaliza C. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Ronaliza is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Ronaliza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ronaliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ronaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronaliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ronaliza is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ronaliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Tho Ma Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Bam village, in Takeo province, nine people have been selected Mrs. Tho M., who was born in 1987, as a village bank president. All members of the group will use their portion of the loan for different goals in which to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Tho M. and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Proum, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land. They cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Mrs. Tho M. is also a pig breeder while her husband is a fisherman. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Tho M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcatotoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras esta formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres  que buscan con el trabajo diario mejorar la economía de sus hogares y así ofrecerles sus hijos un mejor futuro. Viven en la comunidad de Chilcatororas que es perteneciente a la parroquia Tarqui, la que es reconocida por su exuberante vegetación,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, es de clima frió.

La Señora Nelly Estela L.  vive en la comunidad de Chilcatotoras que es perteneciente a la parroquia Tarqui, tiene  27 años,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 4, 2 años de edad, su hijo de 8 años estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en el campo de la construcción, la casa en la que habitan es de su mamá en donde comparten los gastos. 
Doña Nelly se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar debido a que sus hijos aun son pequeños y dependen mucho de ella, aprovecha su tiempo para dedicarse a  la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos y ganado. Este es su primer crédito en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, en sus vacunas y alimentos. Su   sueño es tener una casa propia.

La Señora Ruth Melania L. vive en la comunidad de Chilcatotoras,  Este es el  tercer  crédito que realiza en la banca comuna, está muy contenta ya que han forman un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que busca  un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, vacas, chanchos y gallinas  que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a realizar cualquier trabajo cuando sus conocidas le dan la oportunidad de trabajar.
La Señora Ruth tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su niño estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo se dedica a varios oficios, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad la misma que fue construida con el esfuerzo de los dos.  Con el nuevo crédito que la  FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en  comprar  animales como  cuyes. Su meta es de terminar su casa ya que aun le falta  realizar varios arreglos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres de Chilcatotoras” (Women of Chilcatotoras) communal bank has ten members all of whom are women seeking to improve their home’s economy through daily work thereby offereing a better future to their children. They live in the community of Chilcatotoras which is in Tarqui parish. It is famous for its exhuberant vegetation. Most of its residents are farmers and cattlemen. Its climate is cold. Nelly Estela L. lives in Chilcatotoras which is part of Tarqui parish. She’s 27 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 4, and 2 years of age. Her eight-year-old is going to a local school. Her husand works in construction. The house they live in belongs to his mother and they all share expenses. Nelly’s children are still small so they depend a lot on her so she is dedicated to household chores. However, she uses her time to raise small farm animals like: guinea pigs, chickens and cattle. This is her first loan in the communal bank and she will use it to buy a cow, its vaccines and feed. Her dream is to have a house of her own. Ruth Melania L. lives in Chilcatotoras. This is her third loan with the communal bank. She is very happy because they form a group of tenacious woman who seek better futures for their children. She raises animals like: guinea pigs, cows, pigs and chickens for sale in her community. She also does any other kind of job when her acquaintances give her the opportunity to work. Ruth is 24 years old, married and has a 7-year-old son. Her son goes to the local school. Her husband does a variety of jobs. The house they live in is their own and it was built through their mutual effort. She will use the new loan that FUNDACION ESPOIR has grantd to buy animals like guinea pigs. Her goal is to finish building her house since it still lacks several finishing touches.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, a cow, vaccines and animal feed.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Happiness J. is in her early thirties and is married with three children. For nine years, she has been operating a small cafe where she sells assorted drinks during the day and alcoholic beverages in the evening. The cafe is open daily between 9 a.m. and 11 p.m. and earns her a good monthly profit.

This will be Happiness's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.

Happiness's first loan was used to buy new tables for her cafe, a loan which she has successfully repaid. She aims to use this second loan to buy new chairs for her cafe. Her dream is to one day build a new building for her business.

Happiness will share this loan with her loan group, Safina, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying their loans.

In the photo, Happiness can be seen on the far right.

loans.use: To buy new chairs for her café

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
el señor Teofilo O. tiene 56 años de edad y vive en union libre con la señora Juana Maria Ortiz, viven en la aldea El Caimito de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
el señor Teofilo utilizara el credito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia para su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
su negocio esta ubiacado en su casa de habitacion, tienen 15 años de vivir en ese lugar.
su meta es que su negocio sea grande y que tenga mucha variedad de productos para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes, tambien nos comento que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su señora Juana Ortiz.
texts.en:
Mr. Teófilo O., 56, lives in a common law union with Mrs. Juana María Ortiz in the El Caimito village in the city of San Lorenzo.

Teófilo will use the loan to buy merchandise for his store in order to have improved profits.

His store is located in his home; they have lived there for 15 years.

His goal is a larger store with a wide variety of products to meet all his customer demand.  He also commented to us that he wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, lard, cooking oil, corn, flour, soups, noodles, sauces, sardines, matches, candles, batteries, milk, plastic bags, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, cooking, bread, beverages and eggs.

loans.name: Virgen De La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Virgen de la Candelaria del barrio, se formó con integrantes del comité Virgen de las Mercedes del mismo barrio, las cuales quisieron formar un nuevo comité más cerca de sus casas,  actualmente el comité se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

La señora Graciela T. se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domésticos especialmente para el consumo de la familia, y la tiene la despensa que les provee a sus vecinos.
Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que el mismo cubre todo los gasto de alimentación de la familia que es lo más importante para ella.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, yerba mate, aceite y otros.
texts.en: The Virgen de la Candelaria ["Virgin of Candelaria"] Women's Group was formed by members of the Virgen de la Mercedes ["Virgin of Mercedes"] Group who lived in the same neighborhood and wanted to form a solidarity group closer to their homes.
