The group is currently in its fourth loan cycle with the "Enterprising Women" program of Fundación Paraguaya Ms. Graciela T. sells items that are typically used in the home, especially for feeding a family. She already has a small store set up, from which she sells to her neighbors. She is very satisfied with her business, as it covers all of the nutritional expenses for her family, which is the most important thing to her. She is requesting this loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, yerba mate [a bitter herbal tea], oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, noodles, oil, and other staple food items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. operates a retail shop where she sells items such as bags of sugar and salt. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice, beans and sugar to sell. 

Grace is 24 years old and is married to a clerk. She has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

loans.use: to stock more bags of rice, beans and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion J., a CCT community partner, does not count her losses, but her blessings. At 48, she has been widowed with children to raise. Adoracion was not able to attend college, but she is determined to give her children, her most treasured possessions, a bright future.  The family lives in Pasay City, Philippines.

Adoracion sells dishwashing liquid and fabric conditioner directly. She also has a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as shampoo and soap to meet the needs of her neighborhood.  Adoracion earns about Php400 daily from these small-scale businesses.

Adoracion is requesting a loan of Php48,000 to continue operating her businesses. She will use this money to buy grocery items to replenish her stock and to purchase other products that she will sell directly to her business connections. Adoracion makes every effort possible to reach the goal of making her business prosper. She plans to venture into franchising in the future. 

One challenge she faces is the number of customers who do not pay their debts on time, affecting her cash flow. But she is determined to solve the problem and emerge victorious, because she is focused on her children:  Meeting their daily needs and ensuring that she can send them to school. She also wants to improve the family's house.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel M. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Raquel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of staple products such as loaf breads to the local community. M. is also engaged in buying and selling fruits, like pineapples. Raquel has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients like flour and eggs. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like flour & eggs

loans.name: Kalagi Basooka Kwavula Group-Mityana

texts.en: Obed T. is 32 years old, married, and has seven children.  He has been running his produce selling and motorcycle transportation businesses for the last decade in Kalagi-Mityana. He began these businesses out of his own enterprise after he saw the success some of his friends were having in running the same businesses. Obed is a farmer and has been successful in his  agricultural business, in that he is able to sell the cash crops he harvests from his gardens. Obed says he sees further success if he maintains his tenacity and focus.  He earns 150,000 shillings a week from both businesses. Obed belongs to Kalagi Basooka Kwavula Group-Mityana. With this loan, he is going to improve his farming gardens with high grade manure.

loans.use: To purchase high grade manure for his gardens

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run L. was born in 1966 and has been married many years to Mr. Khoeun, age 46, who is a taxi driver. This couple has two school-aged kids. The kids help with the business when they are not studying. To earn a living, Run L. cooks and sells porridge to her neighbors for a profit. She starts selling her items in the morning and finishes in the afternoon. Presently, her house is in building process, and it is not finished yet because she lacks some materials to continue building. To deal with this problem, Run L. is asking for a loan to buy wood, cement, and other essential material for building her house.

loans.use: To buy wood, cement, and other essential material to build her house.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two grown children. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk. Sergey sells bags, backpacks, suitcases etc. He also offers a leather accessories' repair service. Currently, Sergey has 90,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His income is 8,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Sergey started his business as a small market vendor 3 years ago. Then he switched his sales location from the marketplace to a rented facility in a local mall called "City" in downtown Novomoskovsk. Sergey has a granddaughter who was born a few months ago. He loves her very much and babysits sometimes.

Sergey is seeking a 20,000 Grivnyas loan to increase his product range. He is hoping to receive additional income and to help his child raise his granddaughter.

loans.use: to increase his range of products

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en: Maritess Q. is from the village of Santa Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maritess owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maritess has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest. In 2011, Maritess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritess is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maritess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.en: Burulkan T., 54, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Tashkomur, is married and doesn’t have any financial dependants. Burulkan works in a local hospital and along with that breeds cattle. She started this business by her own initiative and has a stable income. Every month she receives 8,000 soms of income and needs some additional funds in order to purchase more head of cattle, so Burulkan decided to apply for a loan. She believes it can help her to promote the business. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sebjamol

texts.ru: Пардаева Себжамол проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование-среднее. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит просит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en: Sebjamol P. lives in Shahrituz. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education.  She earns a living raising cattle. She raises cattle for resale. She has been doing this work for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY D. WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia D. Ollantaytambo  y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rogelia; es viuda; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad; ella tiene 4 hijos (35, 32, 28, 25) años D. edad, la socia tiene como principal actividad la ganadería, la socia cría animales especialmente vacas, la socia también venD. leche, ella también reparte la leche a un centro escolar, la socia se encarga D. la alimentación y cuidado D. las vacas, ella les da vitaminas, sales minerales y alimentación balanceada para procurar una excelente leche y mejorar su producción, la socia desea seguir en actividad y pese a que ahora es más cansado para ella su actividad diaria ella desea seguir con esto para sentirse viva y dar el ejemplo a sus hijos y a su comunidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. alimento para las vacas.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a member of the "Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu" community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo province, in Cusco department.

Rogelia is 60 years old and a widow.  She has four children aged 35, 32, 28 and 25.  Her main business activity is raising livestock.  She raises animals, especially cows.  She also sells milk.  She delivers her milk to a school.

Rogelia takes care of feeding and looking after her cows.  She gives them vitamins, mineral salts and balanced feed to obtain better milk and improve her production.  Rogelia would like to continue in this business and, despite  the fact that her daily work is becoming more tiring for her, she would like to continue so that she can feel alive and set a good example for her children and her community.

Rogelia is requesting this loan to invest in buying feed for her cows.  She is very grateful to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying feed for her cows

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 33 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income selling cosmetics. Celeste works hard to provide for her family. 

Celeste is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy inventory for her sari-sari store. She has repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. Celeste aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Rarotonga

texts.en:
Rarotonga is 23 years of age.  She is married and has three children. Rarotonga owns & operates a general store selling food products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  

Rarotonga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell and to fill in the available shelves in her shop.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Rarotonga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Rarotonga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase products to sell

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 29 years old. She has four children who are ages three to fifteen years. Three of the children are in school while the youngest is not yet in school.

Anathasie owns a shop in which she sells different items such as sugar, rice, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy items such as rice, cooking oil, etc. With the profits, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop such as rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Joseph Fabricio

texts.es:
Joseph Fabricio tiene 23 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Joseph se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es salir adelante y aumentar las ganancias para tener lo necesario en la visa.

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia, hacer un poco de deporte y ayudar en la casa.
texts.en:
Joseph Fabricio is 23 years old, and he is married.  He lives with his wife and his son in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

His Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Joseph devotes himself to growing corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and sells at the fair there.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help him financially in order to supply his necessities.  His dream is to get ahead and to increase his earnings in order to have life’s necessities.

He likes to go for walks with his family, play a bit of sports, and to help at home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: A unos 15 kilometros del municipio de Pueblo Nuevo se encuentra una comarca llamada Llanos 1, donde habita el señor Hilario de 48 años de edad, productor de café y también ganadero, esta casado y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad. Desde muy temprana edad con su papá trabajaban en una finca cerca de su finca donde viven en la actualidad. Poco a poco se fueron superando y compraron su propia tierra con las cuales trabajan actualmente. ÉL solicitó su crédito para mantenimiento de café como es la compra de abono y pagar la mano de obra. Su mayor deseo es comprar más tierras, mejorar en alto ganado y hacer mejoras a su finca.
texts.en: Señor Hilario lives in a district called Llanos 1 located about 15 kilometers from the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo.  He is 48 years old, a coffee producer and also a cattleman and is married and has one son who is 18 years old.  From a very early age, he worked with his father on a farm near the farm where they now live.  They kept getting ahead, little by little, and bought their own land that they currently work on. He requested his loan to maintain coffee production, to buy fertilizer and to pay his work-force.  His greatest wish is to buy more land, greatly improve his cattle and make improvements on his farm.

loans.use: To maintain coffee production and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mahudjlo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJLO est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même zone géographique et qui mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Agbalè Virginie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Agbalè Virginie est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Etienne. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Agbalè Virginie n’a pas été scolarisée. Il y a près de cinq ans que Agbalè Virginie exerce comme activité, la vente de haricot, de farine de manioc et de l’huile végétale à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Agbalè Virginie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Agbalè Virginie désire renforcer son capital et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Agbalè Virginie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJLO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahudjlo group comprises three people who live in the same geographical area and run complementary businesses. The group representative, Abgalè Virginie, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ in order to raise the level of their businesses. Agbalè Virginie is 41 years old and married to a man named Etienne. The couple have four children, all in school and in the care of their parents. The couple live together with their children and provide for the family together. Agbalè Virginie never attended school. For close to five years, she has run a business selling beans, manioc flour, and vegetable oil at her home; this allows her to respond to the needs of her family without too much difficulty. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the hope of better responding to the needs of her clientele, Agbalè Virginie wants to strengthen her capital and raise the level of her business. To do this, she and the other members of the Mahudjlo group are seeking their second loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy food items (beans, manioc flour, etc.).

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 47, is a widow with two children. She owns and operates a shop where she sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has been engaged in this business for five years. 

Teresita has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods to offer for sale.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Jesugnon Tokan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON TOKAN est composé de trois personnes qui  habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Honoré Rufine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honoré Rufine est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à Dieu-Donné, un gérant. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Honoré Rufine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Honoré Rufine mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente de sachets, de façon ambulante. Honoré Rufine s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Honoré Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON TOKAN, un deuxième crédit. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group JESUGNON TOKAN is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Honoré Rufine, in the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 45 years old and married to Dieu-Donné, who is a manager. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. Honoré Rufine lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, she has been running a business selling pouches (often small plastic bags) door to door for twenty years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Honoré Rufine and the other members of the group JESUGNON TOKAN are requesting a second loan. The loan previously received has been repaid.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 54 years old and a widow. She earns a living by selling barbecue to the people in her community. Lucresia makes chicken and pork barbecue. She also sells hotdogs, which are in demand by the children in her community.

Lucresia has requested this loan to buy pork and chicken meat, hotdogs and sticks. She hopes to open her own eatery in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, hotdogs and sticks

loans.name: Kasselly

texts.en: Kesselly is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. He is a single university student and for the past eight years has been operating an electrical appliance shop. He enjoys the flow of his customers but has fewer goods in stock. He is requesting a loan to purchase more wire, bulbs, regulators, and sockets for his business to enable his electrical shop to become a bigger one. His dream is to become an international businessman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more wire, bulbs, regulators, and sockets for his electronics business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra,  vive actualmente en la zona Los Jazmines,  Su negocio es en el mismo domicilio,  Ella se dedica al alquiler de trajes de todo tipo y diseños de trajes típicos hace más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. La señora demostró ser responsable en su crédito anterior. Ahora el crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de tela para así confeccionar más trajes y poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, generalmente para las distintas fiestas y horas cívicas en los colegios ella tiene mucha clientela, también realiza trabajo por pedidos de distintas instituciones educativas.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the city of Santa Cruz de le Sierra.  She currently lives in the Los Jazmines area, and her business is in her home.

She rents all types of clothing and typical clothing designs.  She has been doing this business activity for two years.

She has demonstrated herself to be responsible with her previous loan.  Her current loan is to buy fabric to make more clothes and have a greater variety to offer her customers.  She generally has a lot of customers for various holiday festivities as well as school assemblies open to the public.  She also works by order with different educational institutions.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Fifamé Lydia N.

texts.fr: Fifamé Lydia est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Fifamé Lydia est mariée à un photographe du nom de Hervé. Le couple à quatre enfants à charge dont trois sont les leurs.Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Fifamé Lydia n'a jamais été à l’école, mais a appris le métier de photographie.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Fifamé Lydia  exerce le métier de photographie depuis près de trois ans.A côté de cette activité,Fifamé Lydia vend des sucreries. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité,Fifamé Lydia contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille.Fifamé Lydia s’approvisionne en articles de photographie au Nigéria Etat voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Fifamé Lydia sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Fifamé Lydia is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a photographer called Hervé. The couple are raising 4 children, 3 of whom are their own. Some of the children go to school. Fifamé Lydia has no formal education, but has taught herself photography and has been earning a living for herself and her children as a photographer for nearly 3 years. She also sells sweets. Her combined incomes enable her to contribute to the household expenses.

Fifamé Lydia gets her photographic supplies in Nigeria, a neighbouring country. She is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé in order to invest in her business so that she can satisfy her customers, increase her revenues and increase her standard of living. She has fully repaid all previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some DVDs.

loans.name: Wilbert Alberto

texts.es:
Wilber,vive con su esposa y su hija, es agricultor siembra maiz y frijol, dicho negocio surgió por su propio esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposa, llevan 6 años de trabajar la tierra, de las cosechas logran mantener la alimentación del hogar. 
El, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono y herbicidas para las plagas, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas para tener un mayor porcentaje produccion de la cual pueda vender para generar ganancias para el hogar..
El quiere ir mejorando su trabajo para crecer en los cultivos y que sean muy provechosos y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber lives with his wife and daughter.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  This business came about through his own efforts and he works with the help of his wife.  They have been working the land for six years and, through their harvests, they manage to provide food for their household.  

Wilber is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides to fight pests.  This purchase will help him to improve his harvests so that he will have a larger percentage of his production that he can sell in order to make profits for his household.

Wilber would like to improve in his work.  He would like to grow his crops better and for them to be very profitable.  He would like to get ahead in life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his crops

loans.name: Duo Shama Group

texts.es:
DUO SHAMA
Este dúo está formado por doña Leona D. 54 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos,la lider D. este duo, ella tiene una pequeña venta D. leña y pan y venD. todos los dias en su casa desD. hace 12 años, nos cuenta que está solicitando este crédito para la compra D. leña por mayor para poder seguir vendiendo ya que ahora la gente ya la conoce y le compra mucho, pero a veces cuando ella piD. la leña por mayor para la venta no hay, entonces necesita comprar mucho y así tener almacenado, para la venta, también esta doña Maria, D. 29 años, tiene 2 hijos y es casada, ella venD. ropa típica en su casa desD. hace 12 años, y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito ya que ahora no tiene cortes típicos, solo güipiles y blusas y ahora la gente empieza a pedir trajes completos entonces necesita comprar cortes y poder surtir su negocio ya que la gente la va a ir a buscar y ella no tiene lo que le piden entonces necesita comprar para poder tener lo necesario y hacer una buena venta este fin D. año, esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le conceD. D. poder obtener un crédito espera no defraudar a la fundación con este apoyo que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Dúo Shama is Leona, 54, and María, 29.

Leona is married and has two children.  The leader of this duo, she has a small firewood and bread business, and she has been selling out of her home every day for 12 years.  She tells us that she's requesting this loan because she needs to buy firewood to be able to continue selling it, since now everybody knows her and they buy from her a lot.  Sometimes when she asks for firewood wholesale there isn't any, so she needs to buy a lot and so have it stored for sale.

María, 29, has two children and is married.  She has been selling traditional clothing in her home for 12 years.  She tells us that she's requesting this loan because she doesn't have typical cuts, only huipils [traditional woven blouse or tunic] and blouses, and now people are beginning to ask for complete suits.  She needs to buy suits to be able to stock her business, since people are going to be looking for her and she doesn't have what they want.  So she needs to buy in order to be able to have the necessary items and make good sales at the end of the year.

She is very happy about the opportunity that is being given her to be able to get a loan.  She hopes she won't disappoint the Fundación with this support that is being given.

loans.use: to buy wholesale firewood for sale.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie, 49, is a married man with two grown children. Charlie is a very responsible father and husband. He does everything he needs to do just to meet the needs of his family.

Charlie is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He dreams that someday his farm business will expand, so he will be able to improve the quality of life in his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Dolorita has a shop that sells abaca products like abaca weave and abaca cloths. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for making abaca weave.

Dolorita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Dolorita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making abaca weave

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Manantial está conformado por  doce mujeres indígenas llenas de sueños que poco a poco van haciendo realidad gracias a fundación ya que antes ninguna contaba con un negocio pero gracias a dios y al trabajo de cada una están haciendo sus sueños realidad.
Decidieron ponerle Manantial al grupo por que se intensifican  como un manantial ya que son personas indígenas dignas de ser apoyadas  y transparente como el agua.
Hablan el idioma mixteco su vestimenta son naguas y mandiles.
Una de las  integrantes es la señora  Catalina de treinta y cinco años de edad, se dedica a la venta  servilletas y piezas para motocicletas  desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Margarito de  treinta y cinco años de edad , con quien tiene  tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tejer y bordar, doña Catalina es una señora muy creativa y talentosa.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus mercancías  y las personas aprecien y reconozcan su trabajo.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar más: hilos de colores, aros, ganchos para tejer, listones y ajugas.
Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha dado  que les ha dado fundación a las personas de su grupo ya que son personas que desean superarse y darles una mejor vida a sus familias.
Las integrantes del grupo son: 
Cesilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Antonia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Isabel- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Gloria- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Cecilia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Luciana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Aurelia- se dedica a la venta de venta de ropa.
Benita Ángela  – se dedica  a la venta de alfarería.
Sofía Josefa   - se dedica a la venta de  quesos.
Felicita- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.


Gracias fundación por ayudar a la gente  trabajadora y pobre con ganas de  enfrentar a la vida.
texts.en:
This group, called Manantial [Spring], is made up of twelve indigenous women who are full of dreams that are slowly becoming a reality thanks to the foundation. Before, none of them had their own business but thanks to God and the work that each one of them put in, their dreams are coming true. They decided to call the group Manantial [Spring] because they gather strength like a spring does, they are indigenous people worthy of support and they are as transparent as water. They the Mixtecan language. They wear petticoats and aprons. 

One of the members is Señora Catalina who is thirty five years old. She has sold napkins and motorcycle parts for a living for the past three years. She is happily married to Señor Margarito who is thirty five years old and they have three children - two girls and a boy. The thing she likes most about her business is tiling and embroidery. Doña Catalina is a very creative and talented lady. One of her dreams is to have a place to showcase her merchandise so people can appreciate and recognize her work. She requested the loan to buy more colored threads, hoops, sewing hooks, ribbons and needles. 

She is very grateful for the support that the foundation has given to to her and the people in her group as they want to better themselves and give their families a better life. The members of the group are:

Cesilia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Antonia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Juana - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Isabel - She sells bread for a living.
Gloria - She sells bread for a living.
Cecilia - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Luciana - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.
Aurelia - She sells clothes for a living.
Benita Ángela - She sells pottery for a living.
Sofía Josefa - She sells cheese for a living.
Felicita - She sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks, usually bought at street stands] for a living.

Thank you to the foundation for helping the poor, hardworking people who want to face up to life.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and calico to make napkins.

loans.name: Arcelli

texts.en:
Arcelli is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Arcelli has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON.
Arcelli has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Arcelli hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
Florante is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. He is 32 years old and married. Florante has one child. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Florante provides motorcycle transport services to the people in the village where they live. Each month, he usually earns PHP 7,000. He plans to use this loan of PHP 8,000 to buy side mirrors and new tires. He hopes to improve the service he provides his passengers so that he will keep generating a good income from his business.

loans.use: to buy side mirrors and new tires.

loans.name: Shano

texts.en:
Shano is 22 years young and lives in a typical Iraqi household setting, where 3 generations share the space and share the work, each contributing to making the house a home. In the guest living room, the family's possessions are neatly displayed and decorated to showcase a good status as the result of generations of work. 

As Shano was becoming an adult, it was time for her to also contribute to the family's living expenses. Educated to the primary level, she has been meeting this duty since 2008 by doing sewing work in her home.

In the past, Shano applied for, received, and successfully repaid the first loan she took from Relief International-Iraq. She used this loan to improve her working area. Shano now took a loan of 1,500 USD from RI-Iraq to buy raw materials.

Shano is under 30, qualifying for a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her sewing works.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a thirty-one-year-old man from Homabay County situated along the shores of Lake Victoria and is married to Edgar and they have two children aged two and five years.

Ben operates a motor vehicle spare parts shop in Homabay, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more stock of motor vehicle spare parts. He will use the profits to expand the business.

His dream is to use his income to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy stock of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Nelsi Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nelsi es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas dificultades en la vida, sin embargo sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superar estas adversidades y seguir progresando en su vida. Nelsi ha emprendido su negocio sola y gracias a su buen servicio se ha podido consolidar en el sector. Tomó clases de perfumería en Estados Unidos, por lo que cuando regresó al país comenzó a elaborar y comercializar estos productos. Además de esto, en su negocio ofrece ropa a sus clientes, de modo que tiene una variedad de productos con los cuales puede satisfacer a su clientela. Las ventajas que tiene Nelsi es que es muy conocida en el sector y esto le ha permitido tener muy buena clientela; por su parte, la desventaja que presenta es el poco capital con el que cuenta para poder surtir su negocio. Con el ánimo de ofrecer una mayor variedad de sus productos a los clientes, Nelsi busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de ropa e insumos para los perfumes y poder ofrecer así una mayor variedad de sus productos.

Nelsi espera que su negocio siga generándole los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, además, espera que este crezca y se consolide, de modo que pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her perfume business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has two children, ages 10 and 16 years old. She describes herself as a jovial and determined woman. Monicah operates a farm where she sells carrots, coffee, tea, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a densely-populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. 

Monicah will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and manure. Her business goal is to become a large-scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 46 years, Samnang is married and lives with his family in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. He is a father of three children. He earns a living through farming rice and growing orange which he had been in for 11 years. Together, he and his wife can earn about KHR57,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about 24,000KHR each day for the future. 
This is the fourth loan for Samnang with VisionFund. He has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve his family’s livelihood. Now he is leading his group to seek for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Manna

texts.es:
Manna dice que con la ayuda de créditos su negocio de venta de pupusas y de productos de la canasta básica se mantiene funcionando, ella genera más ingresos y puede ayudar más a su familia a superarse.
Los créditos son una herramienta muy útil para Manna, por tal motivo requiere de un nuevo financiamiento con el que podrá comprar maíz, aceite, arroz, bebidas, boquitas, quesillo, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas y surtir la tienda.

loans.use: comprar maíz, aceite, arroz, bebidas, boquitas, quesillo, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas y surtir la tienda

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is a distinguished LAPO client who smiles when it comes to talking about her business. She is 45 years old and married with five children. "I am in need of the sum of $450 for my business expansion," she says.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon has three children who help him on his farm. He has lived in Baba, Ecuador for over 30 years where he has made a living growing rice. Although his children are all grown up, they all work the fields together in order to make ends meet for the family. On his farm Ramon also raises plantain trees and a few other secondary crops.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.en:
My name is Maria M. and I work as a male and female used clothing saleswoman. I have had my business for about two years. My clients are very good because I can sell my high quality product at a low price. My goal is to increment my inventory because this business is very good. With the extra earnings, I plan to buy wood to remodel my store and more importantly, to feed my two little daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria M. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque vendo mi producto a un precio muy bajo y de buena calidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario ya que este negocio es muy bueno y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar madera para remodelar mi puesto de venta y lo mas importante alimentar mis dos hijitas que tengo.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is originally from Veracruz but she moved with her husband and children to the city of Reynosa in Tamaulipas to look for better opportunities. Graciela is a very hard-working woman and her drive to stand out and get ahead with her family led her to start her business when she got to Reynosa. Before that, she used to just sell cheese and chorizo (a Spanish sausage), but with her savings, she managed to open a grocery store a year ago that is doing very well.

Now, Graciela is asking for a $475 loan that she will use to buy a broader range of merchandise for her customers. Be part of Graciela’s success and help her grow her business. She is very grateful for the opportunities that you can give her with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es originaria de Veracruz, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades se mudó junto con su esposo e hijos a la ciudad de Reynosa en Tamaulipas. Graciela es una mujer muy trabajadora, los deseos de sobresalir y salir adelante con su familia la motivaron a iniciar su negocio desde que llegaron a Reynosa, anteriormente vendía sólo quesos y chorizo, pero gracias a sus ahorros, desde hace un año logró abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde ha obtenido muy buenos resultados.

En estos momentos, Graciela solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Forma parte de los logros de Graciela y apóyala en el crecimiento de su negocio, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en: Sabrina is 17 years old and is living with her four brothers and sisters.  Her father has a small grocery store and sell basic foodstuffs.  Sabrina will finish secondary school next year and is considering going to university.  But her parents' incomes are not sufficient to pay for both her tuition and other family needs.   So,she has decided to take action.  She is requesting a loan to buy inventory to open a mobile store.  She plans to sell men's clothes, shoes and underwear.  She has already contacted a provider who will sell her wholesale merchandise monthly.  Sabrina is very positive-minded and is sure that she’ll succeed.

loans.use: To start a small clothing business in order to set aside money to go to university next year

loans.name: Virginia Benzane

texts.pt:
Virgínia Benzane Xirindza is a 40-year-old married mother of five. She was born on January 24, 1967, in the district of Namaacha, Maputo province, and lived with her parents until the age of 18. She attended school only until the 6th grade due to her family's financial situation.

She met her husband in 1985 and moved in with her mother-in-law in the Massaca neighborhood, where she busied herself solely with the housework. The following year, she felt the need to obtain employment to help with the household expenses, so she worked as a domestic worker at a home in the city of Maputo for a year and a half.

In 1987, she and her husband purchased a parcel of land in the town of Boane. There they built a house and moved in a year later. Since then, she has devoted herself to money-making activities, specifically the sale of essential products. In 2006, she rented a space in the town of Boane where she continued to sell a variety of products.

Three months later, the owner decided to sell her the space. As she was determined to own her own business, she purchased it and operates from there to this day. Through some of her friends and neighbors who were Hluvuku clients, she came to know of this institution. She applied for her first loan of 30,000 MT in 2006 and repaid it without incident. With the loan of 15,000 MT she plans to increase stock. She currently employs one worker, thereby helping to reduce the high local unemployment rate. The profits from the business help her care for her family as well as cover expenses for her children’s school and healthcare.

This client’s business has had a positive impact on the community. The business is located in a passenger terminal, where she offers thirst-quenching refreshments to travelers and students. She also provides an appropriate environment where goods can be consumed under minimal hygienic conditions. In the future she aspires to acquire a mode of transportation to facilitate the acquisition of her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 03 Boane Cliente: Virgínia Benzane C. Actividade: Comercio Valor do Empréstimo: 15.000,00mt ( 600 usd) Aplicação: Compra de produtos para revenda Inicio: 05-11-07 Fim: 27-02-09 Virgínia Benzane Xirindza, casada maritalmente tem 5 filhos, com 40 anos de idade, nasceu a 24 de Janeiro de 1967 no distrito de Namaacha província de Maputo e viveu com os seus pais até aos 18 anos estudou até 6ªclasse devido a debilidade financeira da família. Conheceu o marido em 1985 e passou a viver com sua sogra no bairro da Massaca, e ela só fazia trabalho domésticos, no ano seguinte sentiu-se obrigada a procurar emprego para ajudar nas despesas familiares, trabalhou como empregada domestica numa residência de um cooperante na cidade de Maputo durante 1 ano e meio. Em 1987 junto com o marido adquiriram uma parcela na vila de Boane construíram uma residência e um ano mais tarde passaram a nova residência. Desde então passou a dedicar-se a actividades de geração de rendimentos concretamente a venda de produtos de 1ª necessidade. Em 2006 alugou um estabelecimento na vila de Boane, continuou o se negocio vendendo variedades de produtos, passados 3 meses o proprietário decidiu vender lhe o estabelecimento, no entanto como estava decidida a ter emprego próprio comprou, e vem fazendo os seus negócios até hoje, com ajuda de amigos vizinhos clientes da Hluvuku teve conhecimento desta instituição, aproximou-se e solicitou o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 30.000.00mt em 2006 e pagou-o sem problemas. Com o crédito de 15.000.00mt pretende aumentar o stock dos produtos do seu negócio actualmente emprega 1 trabalhadora contribuindo para a reduçâo dos índices já elevados de desemprego.Com os rendimentos do negocio, suporta os encargos da família, as despesas escolares e de saúde dos seus filhos. A actividade desenvolvida por esta cliente tem um impacto na comunidade pois alivia os transportadores de passageiros, alunos para compra de refeições e matar a sede uma vez que as instalações estão localizadas na terminal de passageiro e cria cultura das pessoas consumirem em locais apropriados com mínimas condições de higiene. No futuro aspira ter uma viatura para melhor facilitar o movimento do seu negócio na aquisição dos produtos.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Juana Margot

texts.es:
Juana is 35 years old. Currently, she lives in the Lamas district of the province of Lamas in San Martin. She has three children who are still minors.

Before becoming a member of the “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos” (City of Three Floors) Communal Bank, she used to sell beauty products. With the first loan of S/. 300.00, she was able to buy toys and some perfumes, with which she started a business in the house where she lived. Thanks to her earnings, and with the other loans she received from her Communal Bank, she now owns a business selling a variety of products.

With the loan of S/. 900.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase toys for boys and girls due to the upcoming holiday festivities. She will also buy perfumes and clothing for men, women and children, as well as a variety of home decorations to offer her demanding clientele. She dreams of opening a children’s clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana tiene 35 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín. Tiene tres menores hijos. La señora Juana antes de pertenecer al banco comunal “ciudad de los 3 pisos” se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, pudo comprar juguetes y algunos perfumes, con lo cual abrió un negocio en la casa donde vivía, posteriormente gracias a sus ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibe en su Banco Comunal posee un negocio con variedad de productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 900.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará juguetes para niños y niñas con motivo de estas fiestas navideñas, también comprará perfumes y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y variedad de adornos para el hogar para ofertar a su exigente clientela. Sueña con abrir una tienda de ropa para niños.

loans.use: Purchase toys, perfumes, clothing and home decorations.

loans.name: Irela De La Concepci

texts.es:
Irela M. works selling clothes from her own stall inside La Estación market in the beautiful town of León, Nicaragua. M. has spent the last 16 years dedicating herself to this business.

Initially the clothes were sold in the open air from a small basket; later she obtained her own area in which she placed her products.

Ceprodel have provided Irela with financial help for the last year and a half with a total of 11 credits which have allowed her to increase her stock and ensure her children’s maintenance and continued education, thanks to the business which generates enough income in order to be able to live with dignity. She currently has a pressing need to acquire more merchandise (clothes) in order to market them, and for this reason she came to Ceprodel looking for more support.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad de la señora Irela M. se refiere a la venta de ropa en un local propio dentro del mercado la Estación en la bella ciudad de León Nicaragua. La señora M. tiene 16 años de dedicarse a este negocio

Inició el negocio vendiendo la ropa a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego obtiene su tramo propio donde colocar sus productos.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de año y medio con un total de 11 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los está formando gracias al negocio que le genera utilidad para poder vivir dignamente. Su necesidad actual es la urgencia de adquirir mas mercadería (ropa) para comercializarla, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel buscando este apoyo.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Busiya East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hafusa N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Hafusa is 24 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 2 children aged 5 and 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Hafusa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house and financially support the children. Hafusa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX s00000 in order to improve her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hafusa is joined in her small group by Amina N. and Hellen K.. Amina N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Hellen K. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.use: To expand maize business

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith C., age 43, has about 10 years of experiences selling vegetables at a Phsar Loer market and usually makes on average around $3/day of income. Her husband uses his own motor-bike to transport clothes and other household goods to sell from place to place. He adds about $5 each day for his family. This couple has five children who are students.

Mrs. Rith C. has applied for a loan to expand her inventory. She will also use a part of the loan to buy extra fashionable clothes to satisfy the demands of her husband's clients. Her husband said that the more clothes they have in their inventory, the more options they have to fulfill their clients’ demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to buy very fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Since she was very small in her hometown, Julia helped her mom serving in her restaurant where she sold ceviche (a citrus-marinated seafood salad) and shellfish. Twenty years later Julia decided to move to Lima from Piura (a city on the north coast of Peru). Nevertheless, she was not the only one that moved to Lima. Little by little more piuranos kept arriving in the place where Julia lives and, as they kept arriving, they would ask her occasionally to prepare the dishes of food that she used to prepare with her mom.

This was how she began her business three years ago. A time later, she prepared the room dining room of her house to receive her clients. Nowadays, with the aid of her husband, who works as a construction laborer, she is building a space inside her house for her restaurant.

Her business grows larger all the time. Happily she can now count on the aid of her husband, her older daughter and a niece. Her objective is to grow this business more and to be able to hire more people to work with her.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña, en su ciudad natal, ayudó a su mamá atendiendo en su restaurante donde vendía ceviches y mariscos. Hace veinte años atrás Julia decidió mudarse a Lima desde Piura (ciudad en la costa norte del Perú). Sin embargo, ella no fue la única que se mudo a Lima, poco a poco iban llegando más piuranos al lugar donde Julia vive y, conforme iban llegando, le iban pidiendo de vez en cuando que prepare los platos de comida que solía preparar con su mamá.

Fue así que comenzó su negocio hace ya tres años. Un tiempo después ambientó la sala comedor de su casa para recibir a sus clientes y hoy en día, con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero de construcción, está construyendo un local dentro de su casa para su restaurante.

Su negocio se va haciendo cada vez más grande, felizmente cuenta ahora con la ayuda de su esposo, de su hija mayor y de una sobrina. Su objetivo es crecer mas en este negocio y poder contrata r a mas personas para que trabajen con ella.

loans.use: To buy implements necessary for her restaurant.

loans.name: Betty Teodora

texts.es:
Betty used to earn a living selling things on credit which is how she scraped together enough money to set up a more stable business. She now sells snacks at a stand in the city center. The business is going well and she can help her husband with household expenses. She lives in an "anticretico" (a property arrangement common in Bolivia) with her husband and 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

LA SEÑORA BETTY ANTERIORMENTE SE DEDICABA A LA ACTIVIDAD D. REPARTIR COSAS AL CREDITO, CON LO QUE JUNTO UN CAPITAL PARA MONTAR UN NEGOCIO MAS ESTABLE, ACTUALMENTE VEND. GOLOCINAS EN UN ANAQUEL EN EL CENTRO D. LA CIUDAD, LE VA MEJOR CON ESTE NEGOCIO Y PUED. AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ELLA VIVE EN UN ANTICRETICO JUNTO A SU ESPOSO Y SUS 2 HIJOS.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is an enterprising young woman, who started out as an entertainer at the age of 14 in a well-known children’s show. As she gained experience, she started her own show with her mother’s help. Now that she is grown, she wants to invest in her business to make it grow and to have greater independence. She employs 13 workers who participate in the events with her.

She seeks a loan of $825USD, to be repaid over a period of three months, because she needs additional funds to invest in additional and more varied costumes. On occasion, she has lost a customer who requested a certain type of show that she could not provide and this would allow her to increase her enterprise's wardrobe. With your support, Lorena will be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena, es una joven emprendedora que inicio como animadora desde los 14 años en un reconocido Show Infantil, como adquirio experiendia realizo su propio show con la ayuda de su mama, pero ahora que ya es mayor de edad desea empezar a invertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer y tener mayor solidez. En su show cuenta con 13 empleados que participan en los eventos con ella.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $825 que pagara en 3 meses ya que ante la falta de dinero para invertir en mayor cantidad y variedad de botargas en ocaciones ha perdido clientes porque le que solicitan un show que no tiene, ademas de esto podra invertir en mas vestuario para su negocio. Con tu apoyo Lorena consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: To buy new costumes.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Z. Rohat is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children. Rohat embroiders and sells national skull-caps for men in the local market. She has been in this business for 28 years. She learned this skill from her grandmother and now she is teaching her daughters. Rohat 's husband came from Russia and is currently unemployed. Her husband has heart disease and can’t be engaged in hard labor. Rohat is supporting the family by herself with the help of her daughter, who is pictured on the photo.

Rohat wants to expand the business and generate income to improve the living conditions for her family. With this purpose she needs 950 USD for the term of 12 months. She plans to purchase fabric to embroider national skull-caps. Rohat is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Rohat’s business.

loans.use: Purchase the fabrics for embroidering the national skull-caps.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina baji is the wife of M. R. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. She has a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 12 years. Amina baji is a mother of six children: five sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Amina baji’s husband has a food business. He runs a small hotel in his community and sells rice and chick peas. Amina baji is a housewife, and she also makes embroidered dresses to order. Amina baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (rice and chick peas) for her husband’s food business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) for her embroidery business. Shamim baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a power loom machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her husband's food business

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Consolata D., a married woman who is 34 years old with two children aged 10 and 13. She owns a beauty salon that she established in 2004. She currently earns about $400 as monthly profit from this business. She has two employees who help her in her business, and together they work 6 days per week and 11 hours per day. Consolata is requesting a loan of US$ 875 to enable her to open another beauty salon.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To obtain capital to open a new beauty salon

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es: Estefanía tiene 40 años, está divorciada y vive sola, no tuvo hijos.  Se dedica a la producción de helados desde hace 9 años en su negocio propio, pero tiene una experiencia de 20 años, ya que comenzó trabajando en una fábrica heladera.  Desde que Estefanía decidió independizarse, para realizar la venta de los helados, le ha ido muy bien, ya que ella le pone muchas ganas y empeño a todo lo que hace. Usualmente vende durante las mañanas, que es donde se consumen más los helados y también parte de las tardes. Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite interactuar con la gente, haciendo amistad con las personas mayores y los niños, que son los que más consumen estos ricos helados, la parte difícil de su trabajo es tener que lidiar con el clima, ya que muchas veces por estas zonas las mañanas son nubladas, llueve o graniza, haciendo que la demanda baje.   Estefanía quiere asegurar su vejez, trabajando ahora que aún es joven, ya que al no contar con hijos que velen por ella, se preocupa por su futuro.  Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayores insumos, para elaborar sus helados, así como cajas de tecnopor, que es donde los mete para venderlos y así hacer que en el futuro su negocio sea mucho más productivo y rentable.
texts.en:
Estefanía is 40 years old. She is divorced and she lives alone. She does not have any children. For the past 9 years she has worked making ice creams in her own business, but she has 20 years of experience, as she began working in an ice cream factory. Since Estefanía decided to become independent, in order to sell ice creams, it has gone very well, and she currently gets good profits and sells all that she has. Usually she sells during the mornings, which is when people eat most of the ice cream, and also in part of the afternoons. She likes to work because it allows her to interact with people, making friends with adults and children, who eat most of her delicious ice creams. The difficult part of her business to have to fight the climate. Often, in her area it is cloudy in the mornings, or it is raining or hailing, which lowers demand. Estefanía wants to have a secure old age. She has worked since she was a child, and now since she doesn’t have children of her own to care for her she worries about her future. With the money that she is asking for she would buy better ingredients in order to improve her ice creams and styrofoam boxes, which is what she puts them in to sell them, so that in the future her business will be more productive and profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make and sell ice cream.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoeun T., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-ol Chheng, 38, who live in a small village off of national road two about twenty kilometers South of Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them study in the local school.

Mr. Chhoeun has been a mason for three years. His wife has been selling grocery items for one year. She buys grocery items from Ta Khmao market to resell at her home. Chhoeun is requesting a loan to add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for driving to work.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for driving to work

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn E. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Van Voeun, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to E. a living. In their plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, which has a bad effect on their crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Morn E. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

She is 58 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a farmer, while another is employed in a garment factory. Another one is a computer teacher and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин мужчина 45 лет , отец двоих детей, работает водителем собственного такси. Жена работает врачом в городской больнице.С детства Мухиддин помогал своему отцу за уходом домашнего скота,в основном у них были коровы.После смерти отца Мухиддин пошёл по его стопам и продолжил это дело.И до сих пор он занимается этим бизнесом по продаже скота.На сегодняшний день у него две большие коровы, и 5 баранов, которые он перепродаёт на воскресных рынках. Мухиддин для увеличения скота решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Muhiddin is a 45-year-old man, the father of two children, and works as a taxicab driver. His wife is a physician at the town's hospital. From childhood, Muhiddin helped his father to care for their domesticated cattle; generally they had cows. After the death of his father, Muhiddin stepped into his shoes and continued the business, and to this day he trades in cattle. At present he has two large cows and five rams, which he will sell at the Sunday market. Muhiddin decided to take out a loan in order to increase his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Nkokonjeru-Mulumba Rehema Group

texts.en:
Rehema M. (right) is 32 years old. She is a hard-working, cooperative and friendly buisnesslady. For 4 years now, Rehema has been in the retail shop business. Due to insufficient capital, she needs a loan to replenish her stock of soap, sugar, rice, and beans. Her profit margin lies at approximately 15% of sales.

Rehema is married with 3 children who are all in school. As a devoted wife, she supports her husband in caring for the family. Her dream is to start up a wholesale shop in Bombo town. Rehema's hope is to have her children graduate from higher institutions of learning someday.

loans.use: Purchase soap, sugar, flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Through her initiative, Mrs. Ramona N. established a variety store. She has received a loan to purchase groceries and additional products to increase her inventory. Ramona  was born in Pandan and was blessed with four (4) children. She is widowed, and rearing her children and sending them to school was a challenge.
	She received her P5, 000.00 loan on January 22, 2009 and purchased supplies of groceries for her variety store. This new inventory will add to the convenience of her customers. Her customers are her neighbors and the people who visit at the local Barangay hall. At the moment her variety store stand is her sister's property and it is very useful to her business.
	Ramona plans to expand her business to add new products for fishing and construction materials. She dreams that she will be able to send her grandchild to school and to build a house where she can live permanently.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda inició el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con gastos familiares y estudios de sus hijos
Comenzó el negocio  en abril de 1996 inicio vendiendo sandwich y tacos en la hora de salida de los niños en escuelas. 
Su negocio ha ido progresando  desde que inicio a la fecha  ya que ahora  tiene un local instalado dentro de la escuela  en el cual ahora vende mas variedad de alimentos, y por lo tanto mas ganancias

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Imelda started her business in order to help her husband with household expenses and tuition for their children. She started her business in April of 1996, selling sandwiches and tacos after school. Her business has progressed since it opened, since now now has a store inside a school in which she sells a variety of foods, which means more earnings. She needs a loan of MXN $4000, which she will pay off in 12 bi-weekly payments, to purchase more raw materials and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Monsieur Mor N. est un menuisier métallique, il est marié et a des enfants. Il habite à la cité Senghor de Thiès.
