Il aune grande expérience du métier depuis 25 ans  et il est à son premier prêt. Il travaille sur commande et compte aménager son atelier avec ce prêt pour mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Mor N. is a weldor who works on commission. He's married and has children. He lives in the Cité Senghor in Thiès. Having been in this business for 25 years, he's very much experienced. He's seeking his first loan to outfit his workshop to better satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To outfit his workshop

loans.name: Eva Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Eva Emperatriz J. D. R. tiene 58 años vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta II ciclo D. Educación, abandonó los estudios debido a que se casò y se dedicó a su hogar. Tiene 06 hijos D. los cuales 01 depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Eva se dedica a la venta D. tejidos, inició su negocio hace ya 10 años vendiendo tapetes y chompas, al principio tenia pocas ventas pero luego se hizo D. clientes y amplio su negocio vendiendo vestidos, carteras y todo tipo D. tejido que le da muchas ganancias. Por un tiempo también se dedicó a la fabricación D. sandalias y zapatillas que luego abandono. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. hilos.
Con el crédito D. 500 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. hilos y materiales para tejer.
Eva tiene el gran sueño D. tener una tienda D. manualidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva Emperatriz J. D. R. is 58 years old and lives in the Aurora Diaz settlement, district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, in the La Libertad area of Peru. She studied until fourth graD. when she left her studies owing to the fact that she married and dedicated herself to her home. She has six children, of which one depends on her financially.

Eva is dedicated to the sale of knitted goods. She started her business ten years ago selling tablecloths and sweaters. At first she had few sales but later she got more customers and increased her business selling dresses, purses, and every type of knitted good that gave her good earnings. For a while she also was involved in the making of sandals and shoes, which she later gave up. She carries out her business from her home.

Her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank, “Las Auroras en Accion II” (The Dawns in Action II), she invested in the purchase of thread. This loan of 500 PEN, which she will pay off in four months, will be invested in the purchase of threads and materials for knitting. Eva has the big dream of having a store of handicrafts in her home.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of threads and materials for knitting

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru:
Мухарам Саримсокова трудолюбивая женщина, занимается животноводством 6 лет. Живет в Зафарабадском районе, поселке Зафарабад с мужем Гайратом и 3 детьми. 
  Мухарам  откармливает домашний скот и перерабатывает молоко. 
  Она очень любит готовить и  кроме животноводства, она изготавливает самсу- это национальные пирожки с мясом, травой или тыквой, и продает их на рынке.
  Она обратилась в "Микроинвест", для того чтобы получить кредит 1600 сомони, для  откорма скота.
texts.en:
Muharam S. is a hardworking woman, who has bred cattle for six years. She lives with her husband Gayrat and three children in the town of Zafarabad, in Zafarabad district. Muharam raises domesticate cattle and processes the milk. She really loves to cook and, in addition to breading cattle, makes samsa, a traditional pastry containing meat, herbs or pumpkin, and sells them in the marketplace. Muharam came to MicroInvest to take out a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni for fattening cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle and selling dairy products

loans.name: Munawar Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nazia Baji and Shamshad Baji and Razia Baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap businesses. 

Munawar Baji is the wife of B. A. who owns a two-room brick house. She has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years. B. A. runs a scrap business, and Munawar Baji prepares "Parandas," which have become fashionable for women. Parandas are used to tie hair back tightly. She sells parandas to the community and earns income. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap (empty bottles and wasted papers) for her husband's scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.
Note: "Munawar baji is showing its collection of parandas in this picture."

loans.use: To buy scrap (empty bottles and waste paper) for scrap businesses.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
A. Nazokat has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a married mother and she wants her children to be well educated so that they can have a better future. Nazokat has worked in farming for the last 15 years. Nazokat is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, tomato and cucumber. Currently, Nazokat is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор – 33 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Её муж уехал в Россию работать. Здесь он не смог найти хорошую работу, чтобы накопить денег и купить для себя скот. У Гулбахор было всего лишь 15 овец. Но недавно она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Пока ее муж найдет работу в России и пришлет ей деньги, ей будет помогать ее брат. Гулбахор очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband went to Russia to find work, as at home, he was unable to find a good job so that they could save money and buy cattle.Gulbahor only had 15 sheep. But recently, she learned about our organization and took out a loan to purchase a dairy cow. While her husband will find work in Russia and send her remittances, her brother will help her out. Gulbahor is very pleased that our organization is helping her during a difficult moment in her life.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Зарифова Мунира проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 29 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Мунира по специальности "учителем" проработала 2 года. В данный момент она занимается сельским хозяйством. Этим  видом деятельности занимается более 2 лет. Она в основном выращивает рис. Муж находится на заработках в России. Кредит просит для покупки удобрений и семян, чтобы посеить рис.
texts.en:
Munira Z. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 29 years old, married and has four children. Munira has worked in her profession as a teacher for two years. At this time she does farming. She has been working in this field for more than two years. She mainly grows rice. Her husband is now working in Russia. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to sow rice.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells slippers, pot and cloth in her house. She has been in this business for the past 9 years. Esther lives in Abeokuta. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Esther hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more cloth, pots and slippers to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers, pots, and cloth

loans.name: Tayo

texts.en: Tayo is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She has a shop where she sells medicine and provisions. She is requesting for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicine and provisions so that she meet up with the increasing number of her customers and make more profit.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medical drugs and provisions to sell

loans.name: One United Club Group

texts.en:
Sangai, a 26-year-old woman living in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, Liberia, is married with two children, ages 9 months and 5 years old. Her eldest is not in school. Sangai’s business is retail clothing, including jeans, T-shirts and sandals, which she imports from nearby Guinea. She sells to the farming community from a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She has been running her business for three years now. Sangai is illiterate because, although she wanted to attend school, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide.  

Sangai's dream is to grow her business so she can soon have a much bigger stall and ultimately build a permanent clothing shop. After recovering from a two month illness, she is taking out this loan to buy inventory in larger quantities. With the profits from her business, Sangai dreams of building a permanent house and sending her children to school, which she was denied.

One United Club is a group of five borrowers, led by Sangai B., living in Kolahu, Lofa county – the breadbasket of Liberia.

loans.use: To increase inventory of jeans and T-shirts

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley T. is from the village of Landing, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Shirley is separated from her spouse and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Shirley is just starting this business.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI. Her goal was to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, an amount that will be used to purchase new items in order to expand the store's product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shirley from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the store's product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more medicines in bulk

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married to Jimmy and they were blessed with two children: Rosalie and Sheryl.  They are living a simple life in the village of Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. They belong to a poor family, but through hard work and sacrifices they have been able to support the education of their children who are both college graduates and are now working.  

Rosalinda manages her own sari-sari store (community-based store) while her husband works as a bus inspector. She wants to improve her small business to earn more and save for their future. Since she has little capital to invest in her store, she is asking for financial support from the Kiva lenders in the form of a loan of PHP5000.  She will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She hopes for more business success.

loans.use: Additional capital for her small variety store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 27 years old and is married to Danny who is a construction worker in the village of Nagassican Santiago City. The couple is blessed with two children: PJ Dan, seven years old, is an elementary school student; and Danica Jane is two years old.

Leonida is a vegetable vendor in their village.  She would like to improve her vending business by asking for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders.  She is now requesting to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 so that she can purchase more vegetables.  She believes that by having enough capital, her business will become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene D. is 47 years-old and lives with her mother and 26-year-old son in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She has a small-scale food store in the town. Her mother is the cashier and they mostly sell basic food products such as rice, floor and beverages such as soft-drinks. She purchases food products from wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and sells them through her store. She pays a visit to Ulaanbaatar 4-5 times per month to purchase the inventory for her business. She has been running the store with help from her mother since 2004 and they have been quite successful. She says that she would like to expand her store by adding a greater variety of food products.  She requests a loan to purchase more food products for her business.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase more food products .

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is a mother of 4 and she is 43 years old. She sells foodstuffs and detergent from her house in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business and family life. Titilayo is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and detergent to sell. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.  She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and detergent to sell

loans.name: Wilma Francisca

texts.es: Wilma Francisca tiene 53 años de edad, la señora tiene 28 años de tener este negocio pero es importante resaltar que esta actividad nació por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia ya que ella se dedica a lo que es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 28 años que tiene este negocio, ha logrado mejorar poco a poco y ofertar más productos a sus clientes. Este es otro de los financiamientos que ella realiza con fundación león 2000 es el recurso más importante que tiene hasta los momentos es por eso que realiza este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Wilma Francisca is 53 years old. She has had her business for 28 years, but it is important to understand that she started it because of the lack of employment opportunities. With the objective of helping her family, she started a clothing sales business. Over 28 years, she has managed to improve the business little-by-little, offering more products to her customers.

This is Wilma’s second loan with Fundación León 2000, which is her most important resource. That is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Moevao

texts.en:
Moevao E. is 25 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Moevao has 6 years of experience in this business.  Moevao needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 355 tala or US $148 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Moevao joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Moevao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Moevao E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.25 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.45 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years of age and is married with four children aged between 7 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She lives in her own two-room house and has the time and money to eat three meals a day. She takes care of additional family members.

Her three greatest expenses every month are paying electricity bills, school fees for children, and rent for her business premises.  Betty sells charcoal and raw food, mostly on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and serves about thirty customers a day. She has done this for business for four years now.

Betty's main challenges is that there are many retail shops that sell the same products as her.  She has been with Kiva field partner MCDT for six years now, and has borrowed twelve times.  She has had the same MCDT borrowing groupmates for five years now.  Betty wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, and bunches of bananas and sacks of cassava and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: Maria Del Pilar tiene 59 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería por lo que siempre ha logrado salir adelante. Esta Señora no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido una gran ayuda para su negocio. Maria tiene más de 31 años de obtener esta actividad, por lo que siempre ha sido muy popular en su cuadra pues sus vecinos han recurrido a su vivienda en busca de granos básicos que a diario se utiliza, es una persona muy humilde pero trabajadora. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, café, papel, golosinas y gaseosas para no perder a sus clientes. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio ya que hay mucha competencia pero no todos ofrecen el carisma que ella ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Del Pilar is 59 years old. She has been able to stay ahead because of the grocery store that she manages. This is not the first time Maria has received a loan and the previous ones that she obtained have been a great help to her business. She has been in business for more than 31 years and is very popular since neighbors come to her to buy basic grains on a daily basis. Maria is a humble, yet hardworking person.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, coffee, paper, candy, and sodas so that she will not lose customers. Her desire is to remain active in her business since there is much competition. However, not everyone serves their customers with as charismatic a personality as she does.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz is applying for a second loan. To improve his business, he started a new business, a general store. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy toys and products.

loans.use: To buy toys and products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita N. is from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Carmelita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Carmelita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2004, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 19th loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products.

She rents video CDs to people in her village for an income of about USD 2.5 per day. Her husband buys and sells cows, earning an income of USD 5 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows for sale when the price is good.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay for her children’s school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of his children, ages 15 and 13, attend a local secondary school.  His eldest child, Ganchodor, will graduate from high school in 2010. 

Purevdorj operates two businesses. During the summer, he sells souvenirs with his wife near local monuments. They have been selling souvenirs since 2003. The province they live in is a center of tourism in Mongolia, which is a great advantage to their business. During the winter, Purevdorj works as a solderer and electrician. Purevdorj is certified as an electrician, and has worked as a plumber at a local generator plant for many years (1981-2000).  He is an industrious person who has a great business mind. His family is the most important thing for him and he says, “As a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up.” He is requesting a loan to purchase souvenirs and religious articles in the Chinese border cities of Ereen and Beejin.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface A. is 39 years old, married with 4 children.  He sells medicines at retail prices to his customers. His wife sells groceries to also support their home. Boniface loves this business because of the-one-on-one interaction with his customers.   He is requesting  a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Loubaboutou

texts.fr:
Cette femme, née en 1980 est revendeuse d’articles électroménagers.  Elle est mariée sans enfant.
Elle expose ses différents articles (ventilateurs, lecteur DVD) dans sa boutique située à ADIDOGOME.
Elle cumule près de 08 ans dans cette activité. Le crédit sollicité sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de ventilateurs, lecteurs DVD et divers articles électroménagers.
Elle espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Loubaboutou A. was born in 1980 and is a reseller of electrical appliances. She is married and without children. She displays her various products ( fans, DVD players ) in her shop localed in Adidogome. Loubaboutou has worked at this business for 8 years. This loan will be used primarily to buy fans, DVD players and various electrical appliances. She hopes that this new loan will provide additional profits.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of fans DVD players, and various electrical appliances

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Daisy tiene 43 años, ella es una carismática mujer que vive con su pareja quien es obrero y sus tres hijos. Todos ellos viven juntos en su propia casa. Hace mas de 2 años atrás ella se dedica en la venta de ropa, pues  necesitaba de una actividad que le permitiera pasar tiempo con su familia, sobre todo de sus hijos. Es así que gracias a su gran carisma y poder de convencimiento, que aprovechó para incursionar en la venta de ropa. Desde entonces se dirige cada cierto tiempo a los mercados centrales de la capital para adquirir prendas de vestir, de los más variados colores y modelos, para luego ser ofrecidos a sus vecinas, amigas y familiares quienes son sus principales clientes. Paralelo a este trabajo, también le hacen pedidos de traer mercadería de ropa en cantidad para otros comerciantes. En un futuro quiere tener un local donde pueda ofrecer toda su mercadería y hacerla mas atractiva. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ropa de invierno para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Daisy is 43 years old. She is a charismatic woman who lives wither her spouse who is a laborer, and their three children. They all live together in their own house. She has been selling clothes for more than 2 years, because she needed an activity that allowed her to spend time with her family, especially her children. Thanks to her great charisma and power of persuasion, she was able to get into selling clothes. Since then, she goes periodically to the central markets of the capital to acquire clothing of various colors and patterns in order to offer them to her neighbors, friends and family, who are her main customers. At the same time, people also order clothing merchandise from her to bring in bulk to other merchants. In the future, she wants to have a locale where she can offer all of her merchandise and make it more attractive. This is her second loan with MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments on time. With the loan she is asking for, she will purchase winter clothing for the season.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda R. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Rosalinda is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She is also making souvenir items from seashells, beads and coco shells. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a determined businesswoman, a hardworking and resourceful mother of three children. She is 52 years old. Sophia is a petty trader who sells palm oil to customers in her community. Operating her trade for the past 20 years, Sophia has amassed good marketing experience and made many customers. She plans to invest this loan to purchase a fresh supply of palm oil to meet her customers’ demands. She dreams of being able to sell palm oil in larger quantities to make more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Coumba  S. habite a la cite Fadia  2 une des cites environnantes de la localité  de Guediawaye. Elle  est âgée de 32 ans et est mère de 2 enfants. 
Elle a démarré  l’activité  de vente de petit déjeuner  en s’associant avec une de ses  copines. Par la suite elle s’est retrouvée seule dans la gestion de cette activité.Depuis 2 ans elle s'adonne a la vente de petit dejeuner et de dinner a la patte D'oie. Par conséquent  elle se trouve confrontée à un besoin de financement pour développer  son activité. Et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs. Madame S. est membre de la caisse depuis un an et n’a jamais contracté  de prêts.
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari à supporter les dépenses  quotidiennes de même que la location  et ceci grâce  a ses bénéfices  dans le but  de maintenir leur équilibre social.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Coumba S. lives in the city of Fadia 2, one of the neighboring cities of Guediawaye. She is 32 years old and the mother of two. She started selling breakfast when she joined up with one of her friends. Soon after, she ended up doing it alone. For 2 years, she has been devoting all of her time to selling breakfast and dinner. She thus finds herself in need of financing to develop her business. This is the reason why she seeks a loan of 50,000 frs. Mrs. S. has been a member of the bank for a year and has never taken a loan. Her goal is to help her husband with the daily expenses and rent to be able to maintain their social balance.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo V. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Consuelo owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Consuelo has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Consuelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consuelo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Consuelo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn T. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old. Annalyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annalyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over 16 years. She dreams of having all her children finish college and have a bright future.

Annalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Edilberto; tiene 33 años de edad; el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica a trabajar con la crianza y engorde de animales él se dedica al agro y ve todo el desarrollo y proceso en los animales ovinos, menores, aves de corral y otros. El socio requiere un capital para realizar estudios en los animales para mejorar su raza y engorde. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios que realizara a algunos animales para su crecimiento sano. 

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Edilberto belongs to the Nueva Victoria – Chinchero communal bank, located in the Chinchero district, province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco, located 45 minutes from the city. He is 33 years old, lives with his common-law wife, and has 2 children. He raises and fattens stock, working in agriculture and overseeing the development of sheep, fowl, small animals, and other. Edilberto needs money to complete studies in his field, in order to improve the breed and the fattening process. He requests a loan to invest in studies he will carry out on some animals for healthy growth. Edilberto expresses his thanks for the loan available via this means, and commits to pay the installments at the times stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios que realizara a algunos animales para su crecimiento sano.

loans.name: Dave Alexander

texts.es:
Dave de 20 años, es diseñador aerográfico (arte en tela), vive en el suburbio una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Empezó hace 4 años cuando estaba en el colegio de diseños y artes con algunos ahorros y muchas ganas de tener su propio negocio par poder solventar sus gastos. Actualmente esta perfeccionando su técnica de dibujo en camisetas, gorras y telas. Diseña en la computadora los diseños y las plasma en la ropa que le piden. 

Para seguir con su negocio de diseño aerográfico quiere el préstamo para comprar camisetas, gorras y para mejorar el loca. En el futuro quiere ser licenciado en diseño grafico y tener una agencia de publicidad.
texts.en:
20-year old Dave is a graphic designer using airbrushing techniques (art on fabric). He lives in an area where most of the local people run businesses. He began four years ago using some of his savings to take a course in the college of art and design and determined to run his own business so he could earn a living. Currently Dave is perfecting his technique putting designs on t-shirts, ball caps, and fabric. He uses a computer to create the designs and then transfers them to clothing as requested by his customers. Dave plans to use the loan to buy t-shirts and ball caps, and to improve his place of work. In the future he wishes to obtain a professional qualification in graphic design and run an advertising agency.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and ball caps for his design business

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

La señora Olga tiene 28 años y esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos, en este tiempo ha podido ayudarse mucho con los créditos que recibe de la Fundación Espoir por eso está muy agradecida y a gusto con el Banco. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 7 años de la cual tiene dos hermosos hijos de 3 años el mayor y de 1 y seis meses el segundo. Su Marido es ebanista.

Tiene un negocio de comida en el Mercado Municipal y en sus ratos libres también vende ropa por catalogo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 15h00 en su restaurante y la venta de ropa en las noches por ratos ya que tiene que dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos que no los ve mucho, ellos quedan al cuidado de su mama.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de la comida.
 
Su sueño es tener un  restaurante más elegante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Dios Con Nosotros" [God With Us] meets every two weeks in the residential area of el Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the provincial capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills. 

Olga, 28, has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles. During this time she has been very much helped by the loans she receives from Fundación Espoir so she appreciates and is quite happy with the Bank. She has been in a committed relationship for seven years by which she has two beautiful children, the oldest being three years and the second, 18 months. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. 

She has a food service business in the Municipal Market and in her spare time she also sells clothing by catalog. She works seven days a week from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. at her restaurant and handles the clothing sales now and then in the evenings as she must dedicate time to her children whom she does not see much; they are cared for by her mom. 

This loan is to purchase products for the preparation of the food. 

Her dream is to have a more elegant restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Norome Group

texts.es:
El grupo Norome lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya, cuna del folklor nicaragüense, una de ellas es la señora Anastia Gaitán de 40 años quien vende cosméticos. Gaitán inicio con el comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado Oriental y desde hace dos años invirtió en cosméticos y perfumes negocio en el que le ha ido muy bien. 
Ella es madre y padre de dos niños por los cuales labora arduamente todos los días para que no les falte un techo, el pan y los estudios principalmente. El crédito lo invertirá en perfumes  y algún día desea poder ella con su propio dinero costear su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Petrona del Carmen M. Paramo de 50 años desde 1990 se dedica al comercio de ropa usada actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Zeneyda del Socorro de 21 años ella inicio comercializando frutas en la actualidad vende leña.
texts.en:
The Norome group is made up of three hard-working, diligent and enterprising women from Masaya, the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore.  One of the women is Mrs Anastia Gaitán who is 40 years old and sells cosmetics.  Gaitán started out selling fruit and vegetables in the Mercado Oriental market and two years ago invested in cosmetics and perfumes, a business in which she has done very well.

She is mother and father to two children for whom she works hard every day to keep a roof over their heads, make sure that they have food and that they stay in school.  She will use her loan to buy perfumes and one day she hopes to be able to use her own money to finance her business.

Petrona del Carmen M. Paramo is another member of the group.  She is 50 years old.  Since 1990 she has worked selling second-hand clothes.  This is the activity for which she will use her loan.  The group's final member is Zeneyda del Socorro who is 21 years old.  She started off selling fruit and currently sells firewood.

loans.use: Cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Pablo Fernando

texts.es:
Pablo de 29 años, es ebanista en un taller. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Su papa le enseño desde pequeño como hacer un mueble cuando creció y a la edad de 13 años empezó a realizar sus primeros muebles con ayuda de su papa. Después de un tiempo decidió que su profesión iba a ser ebanista en un negocio familiar. En la actualidad trabaja por contratos que le hacen sus clientes no tiene horario fijo porque trabaja con su papa en su propio taller. Hace puertas, anaqueles, juegos de salas, comedor etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo pintura, laca, diluyentes para pinta muebles que tiene hechos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando como ebanista y ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Pablo is 29 years old.  He is a cabinet maker and works in his own workshop.  He lives in an urban area which is considered a suburb of Guayaquil and is noted for the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.

His father taught him how to make furniture from an early age.  As he grew up, at the age of 13, he began to make his first pieces of furniture with his dad's help.  After a while he decided that his profession was going to be that of a cabinet maker in a family business.  He currently works from contracts that his customers make with him.  He doesn't work fixed hours because he works with his father in his own workshop.  He makes doors, shelves, living room sets, dining room sets etc.

To continue in his business he would like to use this loan to buy paint, lacquers and thinners to finish furniture which he has made.  In the future, he would like to continue working as a cabinet maker and help his parents financially.

loans.use: To buy paint, lacquer and thinner

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh a 30 ans et est marié. IL vit à Bèkpota où il exerce son activté et compte dans cette dernière près de 2 ans. Il est technicien de profession mais associe à son activité principale la vente de l’eau mise en sachet et de cartes de recharges.  Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et à la direction Togo cellulaire, Togo Telecom, Moov. IL sollicite un prêt au près de WAGES pour augmenter son commerce
texts.en: Edoh is 30 years old and married. He lives in Bèkpota, where he has his business and has worked for nearly two years. He is a technician by profession, but his main business has been selling bagged water (similar to bottled water, but less expensive) and prepaid credit for pay-as-you-go mobile phones. He purchases his supplies in the large market of Lomé and, for his phone business, from the companies Togo Cellular, Togo Telecom and Moov. He is requesting this loan from the micro-finance organization called WAGES in order to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase "pure water" (bags of water) and prepaid cell phone credit.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Consistency is the key for CCT* community partner Jennifer L., who wants to keep her business in shape. Jennifer, 34, reached college and is married to Josefino, who works as a messenger. Josefino and Jennifer have three children and together they reside in Pasay City, south of Manila. Jennifer has started a frozen food business, in which she sells products like longganisa (sausage) and tocino (cured meat) to neighbors and household people in their community. Jennifer also cooks viands (tasty dishes) so that neighbors who are in the rush and can not find time to cook their own meals can have a good meal from Jennifer's store and get going with their work. Jennifer earns a monthly income of 7,900 Philippines pesos (Php). To help her continue operation of her business, Jennifer is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will use the money to buy more stocks of frozen food and enough ingredients for a daily variety of delicious viands for her customers to choose from. Jennifer desires to be able to put up a restaurant someday, and as stated, her consistency to provide excellent products is the key. She badly needs to maintain a consistently profitable business in order to meet the daily needs of her children. As many small-scale entrepreneurs admit, Jennifer also finds it challenging to deal with customers with long lists of debts. But no challenge, no matter how difficult, can stop her from consistently working with all her strength in order to be able to send her children to school up until college. She envisions have her own house and living in it with a happy, successful family. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase of frozen food and other items for sale

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si S. is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a married woman and blessed with three children. Most of them are students in the local public school. Si S. has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer. Si S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Si S. and her family, Si S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to feed for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to feed for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price

loans.name: Risueñas De Atenco Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama  Risueñas de Atenco está integrado por 12 clientas, en él se encuentra la señora Ma De Los Remedios quien tiene 30 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es comerciante fabrica caja para el zapato. Ella tiene 2 hijos, la sra nos platica que inició su negocio hace 12 años en un local pequeñito de una medida de 1X1.5mt todo lo hacian manual ya que a la semana hacian entre 150 a 200 cajas como a los 2 años les vendieron unos aparatos para facilitar el proceso de la caja, hoy en dia realizan entre 1000 a 1300 cajas por semana lo cual es un ingreso que les da para vivir y poder darle a sus hijos lo necesario para que el dia de mañana sean unos profesionistas.
texts.en:
The group is called “Risueñas de Atenco” (Cheerful people from Atenco).  It is comprised of 12 members.  Maria de los Remedios is one of the members.  She is 30 years old, and she has a middle school education.  

She is a merchant, and she makes shoe boxes.  She has two children.  She tells us that she started her business in a very small place measuring 1 x 1.5 meters.  They did everything by hand.  They made between 150 and 200 boxes a week.  Two years ago they were sold some apparatus to facilitate the process of making the box.  Now they make between 1,000 and 1,300 boxes a week.  

This income gives them a living, and they are able to give their children what they need in order to become professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy material to make shoe boxes

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en: Arlen D. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Arlen is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Arlen runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as snack foods, biscuits and beverages. She also makes and sells snacks like rice and cheese cakes. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Arlen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and snack foods. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra Q., de 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, esta casada con Demetrio de 35 años y tienen 04; viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Palmapampa distrito de Samugari. Alejandra, es campesina, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niña, desde entonces ha trabajado en esta actividad alrededor de 10 años; cultivando los siguientes productos: cacao, café, hojas de coca y plátano, productos que son extraídos gracias a los jornaleros que contrata durante la temporada de cosecha. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alejandra Q., 30, is from San Miguel district.  She’s married to Demetrio, 35, and they have four children.  They live in their own house in the community of Palmapampa, Samugari district.

Alejandra is a farmer.  Her parents taught her this occupation when she was a little girl.  Since then she’s worked in this occupation for about 10 years.  She farms cocoa beans, coffee, coca leaf and banana.  Her crops are harvested thanks to laborers she hires during harvest time.  She sells the cocoa beans and the coffee in the city of San Francisco because that’s where the best prices are offered for her quality grains

What she likes most about her work is harvesting because that’s when she feels the months of hard work are rewarded by the quality of her fruits.  She considers the most difficult part transporting the products from the harvest to the drying spot.  In the future she’d like to buy new farmland to increase production.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She feels this support will be very helpful for her business’s progress.  She is very well liked in her communal bank by her fellow members because her work is very mutually supportive of them.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more fertilizer and manure to improve the quality of her fields.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old and married. She has 2 children, aged 17 and 9. To make a living, Rema owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rema works hard to build her business.

Rema joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rema has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Rema is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en:
Zibalile is 48 years of age, single and has one child aged 24 who is still in education. She also has four relatives that she lives with and takes care of. In the photo above, she is in the red dress raising her hand.
Zibalile sells chickens from her home and has been in this business for one year. She does not have any other sources of income. She says her main business challenge is when chickens die and she doesn't get any profit. Zibalile requested this loan through Kiva partner, WDB, to buy more live chickens. In the next five years, she would like to increase her stock of chickens and grow her business. She hopes to use any additional profit to support her family. Zibalile hopes that WDB will continue to help her and others.

loans.use: To buy live chickens

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias al interés y entusiasmo de la señora Esthela G., junto con María Iluminada Rodas del km 13 ½  Acaray Minga Guazú de Ciudad del Este, ex integrante del grupo. Ellas contactaron con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Virgen de Fatima, están en el Sexto Ciclo, cuenta con 17 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes realizan reuniones quincenales y organizan diversas actividades. Poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la Fundación. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus actividades.
La sra. Roque Teresa, integrante del comité, se dedica a la venta de ropas, tiene muy buena clientela desde hace varios años, pero ella desea poder contar con mayor variedad de ropas para ofrecer a sus clientes, como se acerca la época de otoño desea adquirir abrigos pues la competencia es mucha y no quiere perder a sus clientes.
Ella espera contar con la ayuda crediticia de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group was established through the interest and enthusiasm of Mrs. Maria Iluminada Rodas from 13 ½ Km in Acaray, Minga Guazu, 'Ciudad del Este' [City of East], who is no longer a member. She established communication with neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.

The group is called ‘Virgen of Fatima’, has seventeen members, and is in its sixth loan cycle. It is a cohesive, caring and responsible group.  Its members have biweekly meetings and organize diverse activities. Their enterprising spirit keeps them working and responsibly paying back the loan with the Foundation. The loan will open doors to continue progressing.

Mrs. Roque Teresa has been selling clothing for several years. She wishes to have more variety to offer to her customers and since fall is approaching she wants to buy new coats to better compete with other similar stores and keep her customers. She hopes to obtain assistance from KIVA and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram H. has a fishery. The nature around his fishery is beautiful and pure. Aram is planning to expand his business by purchasing beehives and fish meal. A pure and very healthy honey can be produced in nature like this. Aram’s family- his teacher wife, his pensioner mother and 3 children- will greatly benefit from the additional income. There are always plenty of buyers of quality honey, which is so much in demand locally, as most Armenians like home remedies, and honey is a must have item for each household here.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and fish meal

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Puntod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Juliet is married and has eight school-aged children. Juliet sells green bananas & coconut wines in her community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her third from HSPFI. Juliet is requesting 4,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional green bananas. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas

loans.name: Leon

texts.es: León tiene 28 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa, construido a base de material rustico, ubicado en la comunidad de Canal anexo del distrito de Palmapampa. León es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante con sus plantas de cacao, café y plantas de achiote, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus cultivos al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras debido a la plaga de insectos, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado sin causar daño a su salud. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos ya que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con el crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en: León is 28 years old.  He is a very hard-working young man.  He lives in his own house, built from rustic materials and located in the Canal community in the Palmapampa district.  León is a young man focused on his responsibilities, and he works with great care to excel and move forward with his cacao, coffee, and achiote plants.  After he harvests them, he brings them to sell in the city of San Francisco, where he already has various buyers who know the quality of his products and don't hesitate to wait for him in order to buy all of his crops at wholesale.  What he likes most about his work is planting his land and making it fertile and productive.  He has been doing this work for 5 years, and he thinks the most difficult thing is fumigating his fields due to the plague of insects, since he has to do it very carefully without damaging his health.  In the future, he hopes to continue saving his earnings, since he would like to buy more land.  This is his second credit with MFP.  He knows that this loan will be very beneficial for the development of his work.  He is happy to be a member of his communal bank.  He will use the loan for crop maintenance such as trimming, clearing, and fumigation.

loans.use: to hire day workers to trim, clean and remove the underbrush in his fields.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 39 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Eugenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Concepcion is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and noodles for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Concepcion from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches   covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and noodles for sale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 27 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children.

Margarita works as a fisher-woman and catches fish to sell. She has been doing this work for 20 years with a monthly income of PHP 20,000 but still the income from fishing is insufficient for their daily consumption and for the education of their children. According to Margarita, she wants to have an additional fishing boat. So Margarita has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy a brand-new fishing boat.

Margarita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Margarita hopes that she can buy a brand-new fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: 4 - Hoằng Phong - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hồng is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling beverages.

Hồng is 30 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 4 - Hoằng Phong - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her one dependent.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes to provide for her child. She hopes for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to maintain a beverage stall.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y esforzada, tiene 56 años de edad vive con su esposo y con el menor de sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia. Tiene más de 40 años de experiencia en la agricultura, siembra papa y maíz en sus terrenos que posee. Sus hijos y su esposo trabajan activamente en estas tareas, del mismo modo posee una granja en donde cría cuyes; vacas, cerdos y ovejas, pues le  agrada trabajar en esta tarea, aunque reconozca que muchas veces es muy sacrificada. Las ventas de los productos que cosecha, le permiten recuperar el capital invertido, además de almacenar para su propio consumo; sin embargo tiene proyectos de incrementar su producción en las siguientes cosechas para poder vender a mayores cantidades y generarle ganancias. Por esta razón, desea  continuar y extender la siembra. Supo de MFP  por medio de sus vecinos que la invitaron a integrarse al banco comunal  de la cual se ha convertido en una integrante muy responsable, que cumple con los acuerdos. En esta ocasión el dinero que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Rosa has always been a very hard-working and dedicated person.  She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her four children in her own home.

Rosa has more than 40 years experience in farming.  She grows potato and corn on land that she owns.  Her children and husband work actively in this business too.  Rosa also owns a farm where she raises guinea pigs, cows, pigs and sheep as she enjoys this work although she recognizes that it is often very demanding.  The sale of the products which she harvests allow Rosa to recover the capital that she has invested.  She also stores some of her produce for her own consumption.  However, she has plans to increase her production in her upcoming harvests so that she can sell in larger quantities and make more profits.  She would like to continue and extend her sowing.

Rosa found out about MFP through her neighbors who invited her to join their community bank.  She has become a very responsible member of the bank who honors agreements.  On this occasion, she will invest the money that she is requesting in buying sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can sow her potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullahi has operated a stationery shop business for the past three years, selling at the market to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of competition in his business. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

Abdullahi and his wife have two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he has requested, he plans to purchase one box of books to offer for sale. He decided to join Yehu to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase one box of books to offer for sale

loans.name: Agerico

texts.en: Agerico is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Agerico is planting & harvesting vegetables like ampalaya (bitter melon). He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants. Agerico has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Agerico hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants

loans.name: Kawsar

texts.en: Kawsar is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is from Lebanon. After 17 years of experience in grocery shops, she opened a small mini-market in 2007. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and sells products that meet local demands. She helps her husband with the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. She hopes that her income will increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with 4 children. Maria and her husband are both farmers. She helps her husband grow and sell rice. Her husband earns an extra income working as a palm oil harvester. Maria works hard to help provide for her family. She dreams for her children to have bright futures.

Maria has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, the father of two children, has been a rice farmer for the past 15 years. He learnt this type of farming from his parents. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and, lastly, harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: La señorita Maria Erlinda, es una persona de 25 años de edad de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar una carrera técnica (auxiliar en enfermería), vive habitualmente en la casa de sus padres que está ubicado en la comunidad de Iluri Garante - Tíraque y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo; su actividad económica es el servicio que brinda con su profesión en el Hospital Central de la población de Ivirgazama por el cual tiene una remuneración mensual. Finalmente la clienta manifiesta tener ganas de superarse y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para realizar la compra de un lote (terreno) para que posteriormente pueda construir en ella su casa y de tal forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Erlinda, 25 years old and single, was able to study in a technical program (nursing assistant).  She usually lives in her parents' house, located in the community of Iluri Garante - Tíraque, and has no dependents to care for.  Her economic activity is the professional service she offers in the Hospital Central, for which she receives a monthly salary.

María Erlinda says she wants to improve herself, and for that she sees the need to request investment capital to buy a piece of property so that later she can build a house and, in this way, improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piece of property.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is separated and has been blessed with two children. She is currently spending her income on her two students. Yolanda continues to make her grocery store grow. For almost 15 years of operating this business, she has been able to increase the income generated. Thanks to her willingness and effort, she has been able to achieve a stable business. Yolanda tries to keep her customers satisfied by offering a variety of products.

With her previous loan, Yolanda bought products for her store with the intent of increasing her income each day. Being a single mom, she needs to double her effort and time to be able to sustain all the needs of her family. In this way, she can support her children until they will finish their degree course. Yolanda would like to fulfill her dreams in life, so for these reasons, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be use in restocking her grocery store. She believes that she can increase her sales, have more variety and fulfill her obligations to her two children.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva don la tesorera es la señora Gualbertina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de queso y yoyurt, venta de cosméticos, tejido de mantas, venta de pilas, comercio de ropa. 

La señora Gualbertina indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus las socias antiguas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio organización de venta de frutas que  viene trabajando hace tres años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de la Ceja y lo comercializa en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía una de las socias no se ubico en un lugar adecuado y por ello solo aparese medio cuerpo.
texts.en:
The “Margaritas” (Daisies) communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The bank is comprised of nine members, and it is run by a board of directors.  Gualbertina is the treasurer.  The members of the communal bank carry on various business activities.  Some of them are making blankets, selling vegetables, selling fruit, selling cheese and yogurt, selling cosmetics, weaving blankets, selling batteries, and selling clothes.

Gualbertina says that she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago by invitation from long time members.  She currently has a business of selling fruit.  She has been working in her business for three years.

The loan that she will now take out is for the growth of her business (to buy fruit).  She will get it in La Ceja, and she will sell it at her sales location.  This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family as much as is possible.  She is married and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health trainings and the loan.

One of the members in the photograph was not placed in a space with enough room.  That is why you only see half of her body.

loans.use: to buy fruit.
