loans.name: Mirian Maricela

texts.es:
Mirian Maricela tiene 38 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Mirian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño comprarse una casa que sea propia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo, es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Mirian Maricela, 38, is single and has no children.  She lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Mirian is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for her because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and her product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a house of her own.  She enjoys walks in the countryside in her free time and she is a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like pants, T-shirts, slippers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gennetta

texts.en:
Gennetta is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gennetta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gennetta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gennetta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Oswaldo Mauricio

texts.es:
Oswaldo Mauricio tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, hace 15 años . las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Vicente. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener beneficios económicos.

El sueño es poder tener una casa.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Mauricio is 32 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children, ages 15 and 8. He lives with his wife and their children in Cantón Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the communal bank Las Palmas, which is located in the Campo Alegre district, which is in Cantón Bab. This communal bank is dedicated to agricultural work.

Oswaldo works in agriculture. He has been planting corn and rice for 15 years. He buys and sells in San Vincente. He is applying for the loan to plant corn and buy compost.

With the help of the loan, he will realize economic benefits.

His dream is to be able to have a house.

He has not been faced with any particular problems. In his free time he likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy compost

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 57 years old and married. She has four children. 

She has been making and selling charcoal for 15 years. Leonora works hard and is able to support her husband in providing for their needs through this business. 

Leonora has requested a loan to buy more coconut shells and wood to make charcoal. Leonora hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells and wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor Province.  He is married with no children.

Joseph works in the fishing industry and sells his catches in the market. He has been doing this for 9 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 7000 to purchase a new set of fishing nets for his fishing business. 

Joseph has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 11 months.  In the future, Joseph hopes to have savings to ensure a good future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of fishing nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Liposong Ozamis City. She is 57 years old. Lilia is a widow and has seven children. 

To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells cassava and coconut to local community members. Lilia has been in her business for 15 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, 45, is the mother of three children. Mercedita has one year experience raising pigs, an activity that allowed her to raise all her children. She is determine to works hard to lift her family from poor living. 

Mercedita is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. She dreams with seeing her business grow and to have a good estate to leave her children good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en: Policarpio is a married man he sells milk and makes cheese he needs a loan to buy a milking cow because he wants to increase his milk production and he needs more animals at his little farm he hopes you can help him he is an experienced man he learned about this business when he was a kid so he is ready to be more productive

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Glady’S

texts.en: Mrs. Glady’s O. is a 35 year old woman, married with a child. She acquired formal training in business for six months and finally opened her own in the year 2002. She resides in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She plans to increase her business with the stated amount.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ayaz

texts.en: Ayaz M. owns a fruit and vegetable stand at the local bazaar in the small town of Khachmaz, located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ayaz would like to invest in increasing the quantity and variety of his inventory in order to attract more customers to his stand. He wants to remain competitive with the other local fruit and vegetable stands in the community.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Azam K. began his business with only $200. Today his business assets are worth $2000. He is married, with two growing children. His stock is delivered to him by his suppliers. His brother also helps him in the business.

Azam has been with MicroInvest for three years and during this time he has excelled in his business. Azam K. needs $1200 to open a new retail location.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Аъзам начинал свой бизнес с суммы 200$, на сегодняшний день его активы составляют 2000$. Он женат, в его семье подрастают двое детей. Товары ему привозят его поставщики. В его бизнесе ему помогает брат. В Микроинвесте он уже 3 года и за эти годы он преуспел в своем бизнесе. Каримову Аъзаму нужно 1200$ для открытия новой торговой точки.

loans.use:
To open his new shop

для открытия своего магазина

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mercaderia a mejores precios

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 34 years old, married, and has 7 childen. Her husband has a greenhouse and works selling flowers in the city of San Cristobal. She works in arts and crafts, and together with one of her daughters, Patrona P. P., makes table clothes and napkins and then they embroider them and sell them in Zinacantan, to the tourists visiting the area. They belong to the group Sabila 2, together with Mrs. Rosa Hernandez Gomez (artisan). With the loan they will buy cloth and thread to increase the production of their embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA, tiene 34 años, es casada tiene 7 hijos, su esposo tiene un invernadero trabaja vendiendo flores en la ciudad de San Cristóbal , ella se dedica a la artesanía y junto a una de sus hijas Patrona Pérez Pérez confeccionan manteles y servilletas y luego las bordan y venden en Zinacantan al turismo que visita la zona . Pertenecen al grupo Sábila 2 junto a doña Rosa Hernández Gómez (artesana). Con el préstamo compraran telas e hilos para aumentar cada una la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: cloth and thread for embroideries

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Korng is 52 years old and her husband Mr. Chem Chhin is 54 years old. The couples was married in 1977 and have seven children: 3 daughters and 4 sons. Korng operates a business selling snacks in her village and doing farming work with her husband. Besides farming, her husband also plays classical Khmer music with his band in the village. They have both never attended school.

This is Korng's first loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $1,000 to buy a bull to help plough ricefields.

loans.use: Buy a bull to help plough the soil

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama S. (“she who cares for the child”) is 37 and a married mother of five children. She has been managing a supply of charcoal at the town market for six years. She buys the charcoal in Badou, a town 70 km from Kpalimé, and then resells it in Kpalimé. This business earns her enough income to pay for most of her family’s expenses, especially since her husband earns a meager and irregular income.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Ama S. (celle qui tient l'enfant) est agée de 37 ans, mariée et mère 5 enfants. Elle gère un stock de charbon au marché de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle achète le charbon à Badou , localité située à 70 Klm de Kpalimé et revend ce charbon en ville à Kpalimé. Cette activité lui procure des revenus qu'elle utilise pour le financement de la plus part des charges familiales surtout que son mari a des revenus dérisoires et irréguliers

loans.use: Purchase of 50 bags of charcoal in Badou to resell them in Kpalimé

loans.name: Nuraeni

texts.en: Nuraeni, 30, is the mother of a 6-year-old daughter. Her husband, M., does not have any job, so to earn income for the family, she sells snacks, crispy chips, etc. at her small shop and earns about US$ 15 a day. She is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to buy more goods for her shop and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her little shop

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Nigina Kurbonova S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. She sells cottonseed oil. She has 10 years experience working in this business. She purchase cottonseed oil at the cotton factory at a wholesale price and resells it on the market in Yavan as well as from home at a higher retail price. She plans to use the obtained credit to increase turnover. Increasing turnover will allow her to increase the profit obtained from the business. Cottonseed oil is in high demand in rural areas, therefore Nigina's business helps the local population purchase this good at an affordable price. Because the seller purchases the good in the same city and does not need to spend additional money on delivering it to the market, the price remains much lower than if it was delivered from the capital. Nigina plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Шодиева Нигина Курбоновна жительница города Яван.Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей хлопкового масла. Опыт работы в данной деятельности уже 10 лет. Покупает масло на Хлопковом заводе по более низкой цене и реализует на рынке Явана, а так же из дома. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на увеличение товарооборота. Если она увеличит оборотную сумму объем ее реализаций увеличится и соответственно увеличится ее доход.В сельской местности большим спросом пользуется данная продукция, поэтому занимаясь этим клиентка дает возможность населению проибретать масло по доступным ценам, т.к продавец не расходует деньги на поставку товара, а приобретает в том же городе, соответственно в наценке не учитывается расход на транспорт и цена становится ниже, чем если бы масло привозили из столицы. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Cesilia's Rose Red Group

texts.en:
Cesilia, age 31, is the singe parent of an 8 year old girl. She owns two businesses- a small street cafe and also a tailoring office. She starts cooking at 6:30am for her cafe, which serves lunch daily. In the afternoon, she works at her tailoring business and finishes work at 7:30pm. She started these businesses in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $320 from her work.

In the past, Cesilia took a previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more food stock and fabrics. She paid this loan back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to help her tailoring business. She will share this loan with her loan group, which totals 18 members. These members hold eachother accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Cesilia is sitting in the front row, third from the left.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Hilda's Umbunga Group

texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. Hilda has been a tailor since 2006. She works every day from 10 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business dealing in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring (clothes) items for her business.

loans.name: M’Tambéna

texts.fr:
Mr. M’tambéna H. was born in 1971 in Kokoliakpé village of Haho prefecture. He is married and the father of three children. He established a shop selling basic goods. With income from his shop “Petit Paris,” he manages to meet the needs of his family, especially those of his children. Currently, he envisions adding new sales activities: selling cell phone credit recharge cards and local drinks. This is the first loan he is seeking and will allow him to expand his business activities by buying four drink containers and credit recharge cards with a value of 75,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. M’tambéna est né en 1971 à Kokoliakpé dans la préfecture de Haho. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a crée un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités. Avec le revenu de son magasin « PETIT PARIS », il arrive à assurer les charges de sa famille surtout celle de ses enfants. Présentement, il envisage ajouter d’autres activités à l’ancienne. Celle de la vente des cartes de recharges et des boissons locales. Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de réaliser son projet par l’achat de quatre (4) bidons de 50 litres de contenance et des cartes de recharges pour une valeur de 75000FCFA

loans.use: Purchase and resale of cell phone credit recharge cards

loans.name: Nyiragicari

texts.en:
She was born in 1969 in Burundi, neighbouring country to the south of Rwanda where her parents took refuge. She is married to GAHIGI Prosper and has 8 children and 7 orphans whom she is taking care of.

She has completed senior 4 secondary school. She has been a businesswoman since after the 1994 genocide in Rwanda. She started by selling small items and after years in the business she started to improve as now owns a shop selling embroidered clothes in her local market.

She wants an additional loan to boost her business and is confident enough to improve her business, once she gets a loan from Vision Finance Company. She is also expecting that the loan will allow her to earn more income that will help her to improve her family living conditions, especially for the health care and education of children and the orphans she cares for.

loans.use: To buy embroidered clothes for retail

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Upendo M..  She is not married, and has one blessed child, aged one. In 2006 Upendo established her small shop. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $350 every month from this business. Upendo requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of goods for her shop. She thanks you for your support.  


The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of goods for her shop (general items like salt, sugar, soap, etc).

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: This the second time for Mrs. Oum N. to ask for a loan in order to improve her standard of living. She sells lottery in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. She is a 44-year-old widow with three children. One of her children is a worker in a Chinese noodle restaurant, while anther one owns a small grocery store in the local village. The youngest one assists Mrs. Oum N. with her business. In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Oum N. wants to start a pig-breeding business. She decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets for breeding and reselling later at a better price.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets for breeding

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena C. sells clothing and fabric at the Elmina Market. Helena has received Junior High Education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman.

Helena has been selling cloth and fabric since 1998. She is responsible for the feeding of the family and the payment of their utility bills. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to increase the quantity of cloth and fabric in her store for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the putting-up of the family house.

loans.use: to add to her capital to increase quantity of cloth and fabric in her store

loans.name: Sroan

texts.en: Mrs. Sroan I., 37, is a farmer who grows rice in Kampong Svay Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She grows rice twice a year in the dry season, and her husband, Mr. Team Mei, 42, is a fisherman as well as a construction worker. Sroan has five children, all of whom are single and young. One of them is a construction worker in Phnom Penh City, who also helps to support the family's daily expenses. She always cares about her rice crops because it is the main income in her family. Due to her farmland being infertile, she needs a loan of 500,000 Riel (US$125) to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop to increase yield and the rest to pay for seeds.

loans.use: Sroan would like to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop to increase yield.

loans.name: Thi Thuy

texts.vi: Chị Đặng Thị Thùy là thành viên của Quỹ ình thương từ năm 2003. Những năm đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị Thùy đều vay vốn và sử dụng để chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi, tranh thủ thời gian nông nhàn hai vợ chồng chị Thùy còn đi làm thuê để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng ngoài chi tiêu và hoàn trả vốn cho Quỹ tình thương theo quy định gia đình chị Thùy còn có thể tiết kiệm được một khoản tiền nhỏ dành để đầu tư cho con cái ăn học và mua sắm thêm đồ dùng gia đình cải thiện cuộc sống. Vòng vốn tới chị Thùy  mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 6 con lợn giống về nuôi, số vốn còn lại gia đình sẽ đầu tư mua sắm thêm dụng cụ lao động phục vụ cho công việc làm thuê.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi Thuy has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. She frequently borrowed from the Fund to raise livestock in the earlier years. Currently, besides farming and raising livestock, she and her husband also work as hired workers to increase their income. With the monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD), not only can she repay the loan weekly and settle daily expenses, but she also can save a small amount to send her children to school and to purchase more household applications, thus improves the standard of living. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to purchase 6 more pigs to breed, as well as to buy working tools for their job as hired workers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase breeding pigs

loans.name: Mohammad Nazir

texts.en: M. Nazir lives in district one of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and is married with 7 children. He owns land and cultivates it with a lot of hard work to earn money and cover the daily requirements of his big family. He needs some tools for collecting the harvest, so he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afs. He is very glad to have the opportunity to improve his living standard.

loans.use: buying tools to collect the harvest

loans.name: Ghurzang

texts.en:
Ghurzang is a young man who is uneducated, but has lots of experience in the agricultural business. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years in Shewa, Nangarhar province. Prior to this loan, he worked in agriculture in his own village, but now he has responsibility for his family. For the past 10 years he has tried many times to increase his sales of animals, but was unsuccessful. Then he was pleased to find AFSG in Jalalabad city, and decided to apply for a loan.

Now he requested an individual loan to enlarge his work and further his business with more success and become strong in his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Benkafo(Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes de Benkafo sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ce groupe fait essentiellement des activités diverses et variées : (restauration, habillement…)              
Elles sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans et sont à leur sixième prêt. Selon la présidente ce partenariat est très important car cela leurs permet d’avoir un capital permanent pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus.
Le présent prêt permettra d’acheter 10 kg de poisson frais par jour à 650 FCFA le kg, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire et du bois de chauffe. Ce poisson sera frit et vendu. Ce commerce permet de gagner 200 Fcfa sur chaque kg de poisson vendu. Elles effectuent leurs ventes de façon fixe au marché et de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de Koumantou en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Les vendeuses de tissus achètent 10 pièces de tissus wax à Bamako(capitale du Mali). Les tissus wax sont découpés en « 3 pagnes » puis vendus. Les tissus bazin sont vendus par mètre. Les commerçantes gagnent 250 FCFA sur chaque « 3 pagnes » vendu et 500 FCFA sur chaque mètre de bazin vendu.
Les membres de Benkafo peuvent  réaliser en moyenne 30.000 à 45.000FCFA par mois. Cela suffit pour rembourser le prêt et faire face à certaines dépenses de la famille. 
A l’avenir les membres de Benkafo veulent avoir leurs propres boutiques afin de devenir des grossistes en commerce de poisson frais et de tissus demandés par la clientèle.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkafo are all married and average 47 years of age and four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou (in Bougouni prefecture, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group essentially does a variety and diversity of work: catering, clothing, ...

The group members have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for three years and are on their sixth loan. According to the president, this partnership is very important because it enables them to have continuous capital for working in income-generating businesses. The current loan is enough to buy 10 kg of fresh fish each day at 650 francs CFA per kilo, 5 liters of cooking oil, and some firewood. The fish will be fried and offered for sale. This commerce allows them to earn 200 francs per kilo of fish sold. The group members make their sales from a fixed location at the marketplace and door-to-door in the different districts of Koumantou, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed generally of women.

The members who sell cloth will buy 10 lengths of Wax brand cloth in Bamako (capital of Mali). This cloth is cut up into three "pagnes" (each typically about 1 meter by 3 meters in size) which are then sold. Damask fabric is sold by the meter. The merchants earn 250 francs from each pagne sold and 500 francs from each meter of damask sold.

The group members can realize an average of 30,000 to 45,000 francs per month. This is enough to repay the loan and to address certain family expenses. In the future, the group members want to have their own shops in order to become wholesalers of the fresh fish and cloth that customers demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and cloth

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en: Mrs. Savoen K. is a villager in Boeung village in Kandal province. She is a 49-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local school. She is a sculptor. Since her career is doing well, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more sculpture tools to earn more income to support her family's living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more sculpture tools.

loans.name: Marlene Ines

texts.es:
La señora Marlene T. es una excelente comerciante que se ha destacado por vender golosinas en su propio tramo en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor hasta el atardecer.

Su negocio ha sobresalido por ser muy surtido y es de importancia destacar que ella no posee apoyo por lo que es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener. Sin embargo Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos para la compra de las golosinas. Hoy en día una vez más espera ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta forma continuar con el mejoramiento de su negocio y así mantener a sus pequeños hijos que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Marlene T. is an excellent merchant who has been exceptional in selling delicacies and sweets in her own section of the Central market in the city of Chinandega, where every day she begins her work in the early hours of the morning and continues until dusk.

Her business has stood out for having a wide assortment of stock. It is important to point out that she has no personal support, as she is a single mother with two children to maintain. However, Ceprodel has been a mainstay in her business because it has offered her loans for the purchase of delicacies and sweets. Now she is hoping once more to receive a loan and in this way to continue with the improvement of her business and thus take care of her little children, who so much need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of delicacies and sweets

loans.name: Kholjigit

texts.en:
T. Kholjigit has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 10 years. This business requires a lot of dedication due to the fact that is demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true because it requires the strict control of every one of the animals and at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business Kholjigit is able to maintain his spouse and six children. It is because of this he his soliciting a loan through IMON International. The credit will allow him to be buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It's also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Hotamchon

texts.ru:
Хотамчону 32 года. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Его жена работает учительницей в их сельской школе. Её дети тоже идут в эту школу. Она учитель начальных классов. Зарплата учителей совсем маленкая, но жена Хотамчона все равно ходит на работу, чтобы учить сельских детей. Хотамчон, после 2-х лет кредитования в нашей организации увеличил свой капитал  и купил себе машину.
Сейчас у него закончились наличные деньги, и он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще одну партию молодых овец.
texts.en:
Hotamchon is 32 years old. He is married and a father of two children. His wife works as a teacher in their village school. Her children will also go to this school. She is a teacher of the elementary grades. The teacher's salary is very small, but Hotamchon's wife still goes to work to teach the village children. Hotamchon has increased his working capital and bought a car after two years of taking out loans at our organization. Right now he is low on cash and took out a loan to buy a couple of more young sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle and prosesing of milk

loans.name: Ghulam Rabani

texts.en:
Ghulam Rabani is the son of S. J.. He lives in district 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40, married, and has 4 children. He is a hard working farmer. He has more than 25 years of farming experience, and has been interested in farming since he was a child.

Now he is a good farmer and he desires to make his business vast. He would like to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to purchase the needed tools and the seeds for his land.

He would like to mention that Kiva is a useful process that can support all the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: for expanding his business

loans.name: Jowakir

texts.en:
Jowakir J. currently sells plastic plates at the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods in her shop to sell. She has six children and married a nurse. In the future, Jowakir wants to open up another shop for selling the same items but in a different location or market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G. lives in the rural community of Barangay Buliwao Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Being a widow is a difficult situation because she must care for all four of her children who are all studying at the moment in college and high school. She works very hard to give them all a better education and future someday. Daisy is managing a general store to be able to proviD. her children with their daily needs and allowances for school.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for her business. She is hoping that someday, her business will become progressive and one of the leading stores in their village. She purchases her sales merchandise in the public market of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. With the amount she is asking to borrow, Daisy will able to buy merchandise in bulk, which will reduce costs. Daisy is a positive thinker and hopes in the future she will be able to earn more to benefit her children. She believes that nothing is impossible if she does her best and asks the help of our Almighty God.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk for her store

loans.name: Babughirana B Kabugho Veronica Group

texts.en: K. Veronica is a married business lady ,age 30 years old, blessed with four children going to school and looking after her mother. She has been operating a business manufacturing local brew for seven years so far. She is using this loan to purchase millet flour and yeast to manufacture the local brew. K. Veronica is a hardworking business lady who is managing to take care of her family. Her hope for the future is to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase millet flour and yeast for manufacturing local brew.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en: Elen N. is from the town of Lumad, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 27 years old and is single. Elen owns and operates a variety store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste and other highly needed products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 32 years old, married and has two children.  She makes a living running a small grocery store out of her home. She and her family live in a neighborhood called El Arenal in the city of Pucallpa, where her husband earns a living as a baker.  

Amanda has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about two years, and belongs to a communal bank known as Nuevas Amigas (New Friends).  Amanda invested her very first loan of about $100 in her shop and plans to do the same with this new loan.  Amanda is very friendly to her customers and her business is growing slowly but surely.

Amanda is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support and business education she receives. Manuela Ramos loan officers give educational sessions about how to grow and promote one's business, as well as other topics, at the monthly meetings of every communal bank.  Additionally, Amanda is pleased that Manuela Ramos requires little paperwork from its borrowers.  To receive a loan, all one need do is be recommended by another responsible borrower, have an ongoing business, and be punctual and responsible in making loan payments.

loans.use: Products for a small grocery shop/ general store

loans.name: Atuganile

texts.en:
Atuganile is a member of the Itiji 05 borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 33 years old woman,she is Married and a mother of 3 children.

Atuganile started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 10 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Atuganile`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer,soda.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan ,Atuganile hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer,soda

loans.name: Amidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur   Amidou S. a 41 ans, marié et père de six  enfants. Il vit avec sa famille à Noumousso, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. est dans le domaine du commerce il ya six ans. Aujourd’hui il s’est frayé un chemin et dispose d’une boutique où il vend divers articles de consommation en plus des céréales. Expérimenté et crédible il mène son activité avec discernement  et sert sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croitre. 
Afin de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son cinquième prêt  individuel , tous les précédents se sont bien dénoué. 
Avec ce  prêt, il compte acheter,  30sacs de 50kg de riz, 5 sacs de 100kg de sorgho et 10 sacs de 50kg de sucre. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Kadiolo avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et surtout de fonctionnaires.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Amidou S. is 41 years old, married, and the father of six children.  He lives with his family in Noumousso, a district in the city of Kadiolo (in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Mr. S. has been in commerce for six years.  He cleared his own way and now has a shop where he sells various consumer goods, in addition grains.  Experienced and credible, he runs his business with wisdom and serves his ever-growing customer base.  To satisfy his more and more numerous customers, he is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is on his fifth individual loan.  All his previous ones were settled.  With the present loan, he intends to buy thirty 50-kg sacks of rice, five 100-kg sacks of sorghum, and ten 50-kg sacks of sugar.  He stocks up in Kadiolo and then sells these goods retail to customers composed men, women, and particularly civil servants. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business fund, to help with family expenses, to cover the loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods:  sugar, sorghum, and rice

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is already 60 years old and is married to Cornelio, who is busy working in their small farm lot located in their village. They are blessed with six children and they are married. They now have their own families and lives separately from them. Pascuala and her husband are happily residing in the village of Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela.

Pascuala has been managing her general store since her children were still young. It serves as their alternative source of income for how many years and was of big help to their family. Pascuala is still aiming to become progressive in her retail business. Having sufficient capital, she knows that her ambition will be attained. That is why she wanted to request loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital that will somehow lead to the progress of her general store.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais

loans.name: Kanaan A Group

texts.en:
Asin K. R. is a 38 year old man. He leads the Kanaan A Group, which is composed of 8 people in Erbaun Village, East Amarasi Sub district, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Erbaun Village is situated for about 52 Km from Kupang City near to the eastern coast of Timor Island. This village can be categorized as a remote village. The road leading to this village is in bad condition with many holes on it. This makes it difficult for public transportation to enter the village. Only trucks enter, but even they are only available once a week. 

Most of the community in Erbaun village relies on farming to generate income in order to meet their family's needs. But a part of the community, especially those living in coastal area, also try to dig sand to sell as the quality of sand in this village is quite good. This is another way for them to generate money.

Asin has been living in Erbaun Village since he was a child. Due to his parents' poverty, Asin was only able to have primary education. Consequently, he had to become a farmer because no other jobs were available to him.

Asin is a married to a 30 year old woman named Elkana. They have been blessed with two children. They are: Mesrin, 6 years old, in the first grade of elementary school, and Vivi, 4 years old and thus not at school yet.

Asin lives close to the coast. He and family live in a modest house, where the roof is made of palm leaves, the walls are composed of palm branches, the floor is mere dirt and there is no electricity. Asin likes farming better than digging sand as farming is his hobby. He usually sells bananas and coconuts at Inpres market in Kupang City once a week. His wife also helps him in generating money by selling their products. Even though both of them have worked hard to generate money, the income is only enough to meet their daily needs. They cannot save money. Asin and his wife are also challenged by competition in selling their goods.

This is the reason why Asin is interested in joining a cattle fattening program with the other group members. The availability of cattle food makes him even more enthusiastic about joining the program. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,300,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened for 12 months. He hopes that the cattle fattening program will enable him to cover all of his family needs. The other group members are also requesting a loan as they want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Macarlina

texts.en:
Macarlina G. is from the village of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Macarlina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Macarlina sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Macarlina has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Macarlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macarlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. She use her previous loan to purchase new items to sell. Macarlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Macarlina's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Rahmat is married and has three children. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. This business requires lots of travel because he needs to go to remote areas where these animals cost less. This requires considerable financial means. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

To strengthen his business, Rahmat is asking for a loan of $1000 USD, which he will use to buy more cattle for expanding his business. This will allow him to meet the needs of his household effectively.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nassim

texts.en:
Nassim is 44 years old and is married with six children between 6 and 20 years old. She lives in Musanze, which is approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Nassim is a hardworking businesswoman selling decorative and hygiene items. This is her tenth successful year in business! She employs three people from her community in her shop. The hours of her business are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week.

Nassim is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase some additional decorative items and handicrafts to sell to her customers. With the additional sales expected due to the approaching Christmas season, she desires more products to display and offer.

Any additional profits Nassim earns will allow her to sustain her children through their studies and better provide for their basic food and health needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional decorative items and handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, D. 66 años, vive con su esposo Marcelino, D. 66 años; tiene 3 hijas, pero solo viven con una D. ellas (Nancy D. 30 años). Su casa, que es propia está ubicada en una apacible zona D. la sierra del Perú. 

Esta atenta y trabajadora señora se dedica a la panadería, oficio que aprendió desD. muy joven. Preparar diversos tipos D. panes es un arte, ya que debe calcular, mezclar los ingredientes exactos para que todo salga bien; además sabe que con los años ha podido perfeccionar su técnica y así sus panes son más deliciosos.
En la actualidad trabaja por servicios pagados para una panadería particular, a pesar D. su edad esta mujer tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante y esta actividad le genera buenas ganancias, las que está ahorrando porque sueña implementar su propia panadería.
Paralelamente, también se dedica a la venta D. frutas (al por mayor) con su esposo y sabe que tener dos negocios no es fácil, requiere D. mucha dedicación y así lo han hecho hasta ahora, con mucho empuje. 
La vida D. Graciela deja la lección D. que nunca es tarD. para seguir luchando y que a pesar D. la juventud muchas personas suelen sentirse cansadas, pero ella no es así, pues tiene muchos planes para el futuro.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser responsable en cada uno D. sus pagos, además no quiere quedar mal con ningún miembro D. su banco comunal, el cual está compuesto por personas que conoce y luchan día a día, como ella, para progresar. Graciela tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en comprar varios sacos D. harina para producir mayor cantidad D. pan y poder independizarse; también adquirirá más frutas para la venta.
texts.en:
Graciela, 66 years old, lives with her husband Marcelino, also 66. They have three daughters, but only one lives with them (Nancy, 30). Their house, which they own, is located in a pleasant area in the mountains of Peru.

Graciela is an attentive and hardworking woman who does baking, a skill she learned when very young. Preparing different kinds of breads is an art, as one must calculate and mix the ingredients exactly for everything to come out well. With the years, she has perfected her technique and so her breads are very delicious.

Right now, Graciela provides paid services for another bakery. In spite of her age, she wants to get ahead and this generates good income. She is saving so she can have her own bakery. At the same time, she works selling fruit wholesale with her husband. She knows that having two businesses is not easy but requires dedication, as she has done up to now with much energy. Her life proves that it is never too late to continue fighting. Many young people feel tired, but not her. She has many plans for the future.

This is Graciela’s third loan with MFP and she promises, once again, to be responsible with her payments. She doesn’t want to spoil her relationship with the other members of the communal bank, which is maD. up of people she knows and who, like her, fight daily to get ahead. She will use this loan to buy sacks of flour to make more bread and become independent. She will also buy fruit to sell.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Foafoaga

texts.en:
Foafoaga P. is 41 and married with 3 children (ages 6 - 22 years).  She owns a business venture, selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Foafoaga has many years of experience in this business.  Foafoaga needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 130 tala or US $54 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Foafoaga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Foafoaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Foafoaga P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.35 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.87 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel M. is from the village of Brgy. Ibung, Villaverde Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old. Leizel is single. Leizel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Leizel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $86 US) for these activities.

In 2010, Leizel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Leizel is requesting her first loan from ASKI, in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a posho mill.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie T. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Ronie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ronie owns & operates a business providing trisikad (motorized tricycle) services to transport local community members. Ronie has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Одинаев Абдусаттор проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец, работает электриком. Сам Абдусаттор занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает пшеницу. Урожай который он получает, вывозит на рынок. В этой области более 5 лет. До этого занимался торговлей. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Abdusattor O. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 28 years old, married and has 9 children. His wife is a homemaker. He lives together with his parents. His father works as an electrician. Abdusattor is involved in agriculture. He has a small plot of land, where he grows wheat. He sells the obtained harvest at the market. He has been in this business for over 5 years and was previously involved in retail sales. Abdusattor is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Ya Pom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ya P. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. Each group member will use their loan for different purposes. This village bank loan has twenty-two members who live in Chhmar Puon village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Ya P. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family, and her husband is a construction worker. In the rice field, they have a problem because their field is infertile. Thus, in order to have a productive tobacco crop, Mrs. Ya P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rest of the loan she would like to use to hire farmer laborers to plow her field. She is a mother of a child who is too young to go to school or work. All of the members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Fary

texts.fr: Fary D. est une femme de 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants tous majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 3 ans et demi et y a reçu 7 crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle développe une activité d'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 14 moutons qu'elle engraissera et revendra au bout de 5 mois au niveau des marches hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Fary D. is a 68-year old woman, married and the mother of eight grown children. She has been a member of the Keur Ngalgou Banc Villegeois for three and a half years and previously obtained seven loans, all of which she managed well and always repaid on time. She raises sheep, and her new loan would allow her to purchase 14 sheep for fattening and reselling about five month later at one of the local weekly fairs. Her goal is to help contribute to her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strenghtening her livestock business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata C. est âgée de 53 ans, mère de 8 enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et ses enfants à Fana Coura un des quartiers la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
 Fatoumata, après plus de 10 ans d’expériences, dans son activité de vente de céréales, elle vient de faire connaissance de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qui occupe  de nos jours une place importante dans son activité.
Elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Pour le nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, trois tonnes de céréales avec les fournisseurs venant des environnants de Fana.
Elle effectue sa vente sur place dans son magasin à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle espère avoir 129 000FCFA de bénéfice au cours de son cycle de prêt qui servira à couvrir les dépenses de la famille et les dépenses liées à l’activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata C., age 53, is the mother of eight children and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in Fana Coura, a district in Fana City, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. With over ten years of experience in her business selling grains, she was recently introduced to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which has an important place in her work these days. She is on her fourth individual loan, and all the previous ones have been repaid. For the new loan, Fatoumata intends to buy three tonnes of grain from suppliers from the Fana area. She makes her sales locally in her store. Her customer base is composed of women and men. She hopes to obtain 120,000 francs CFA in profit over the course of her cycle. The profits will be used to cover family expenses, as well as those associated with her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene una tienda de golosinas, en un local alquilado que esta ubicado cerca del mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y también de algunos distribuidores locales, actividad que realiza todos los días. Aurelia es conviviente y tiene un hijo, viven en casa propia, por lo que sueña tener una casa propia y también ampliar con otro local.
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Piedra Nueva, y necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas de diferentes marcas.
texts.en:
Aurelia runs a candy shop in a rented space that is located near the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Her purchases are both wholesale and retail, and she daily acquires her products in Lima and from various local distributors. Aurelia lives in her own house with her partner and her son. She dreams of owning her own store and of expanding to another location. Aurelia is a member of the Musuq Rumi (New Rock) Communal Bank, and needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to buy various brands of soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various brands of soft drinks.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provicia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en la zona donde vive, este negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional con el cual solventar la economía de su familia. Adicionalmente vende pescado en los caseríos de la zona, es ayudada en este negocio por su esposo.

Ellos han sabido sacar adelante a estas actividades con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, se han hecho conocidos en la zona gracias a la calidad de productos y al buen trato que ofrecen. Actualmente María Isabel ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas artículos para ampliar su bodega.

María Isabel es una mujer honesta y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder seguir trabajando para ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera tecnica o superior, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos la estiman mucho y admiran su capacidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the Punto Cuatro settlement, in a rural area of the Mochumí district. This is an agricultural area that is part of the Lambayeque province, and is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 2 years she has sold staples and groceries from a store located in the home where she lives. This business was started up because of the need to have a second income to cover the household expenses. She also sells fish in the settlements in the area, and her husband helps her with this business. They have known that they must put a lot of effort and dedication into these activities in order to succeed. They have become well known in the area thanks to the quality of their products and the good prices that they offer. María Isabel is now requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for 500 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy more products to increase her business. María Isabel is an honest and hardworking woman. Her main wish is to be able to continue working so that she can provide her children with the opportunity to study for a technical or college degree. In the neighborhood where she lives her neighbors hold her in high esteem and admire her work ethic.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staples and groceries to expand the store that is set up in her house

loans.name: Benkadi  7 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Faty B. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women, on average 43 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their activities at the start of the winter campaign. The crops they speculate on are ground nuts and millet, among others. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Faty B. intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser before prices increase, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately 2.5 hectares (6 acres). The crops are sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. They hope to attain an average profit of 35,000 FCFA per campaign.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs
